FRAG_DOCUMENT: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation for air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems that would have an exposed surface temperature more than 120°C when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources shall be of noncombustible material.
unique_id: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation for air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems that would have an exposed surface temperature more than 120°C when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources shall be of noncombustible material.Coverings, Linings, Adhesives and Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A crawl space that is not considered as a basement by Article 3.2.2.9. and in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 30 m.
unique_id: A crawl space that is not considered as a basement by Article 3.2.2.9. and in which sprinklers are not installed, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. into compartments not more than 600 m2 in area with no dimension more than 30 m.Fire Blocks in Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load given in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.
unique_id: A roof or other building surface and its structural members subject to loads due to snow accumulation shall be designed for the specified load given in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), distributed over the entire loaded area.Full and Partial Loading

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).
unique_id: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).Fastening to Lath

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4.(2), and Articles 9.15.3.5.and 9.15.3.6., and the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4. and Article 9.15.3.7.
unique_id: Where a foundation rests on gravel, sand or silt in which the water table level is less than the width of the footings below the bearing surface, the footing width for walls shall be not less than twice the width required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4.(2), and Articles 9.15.3.5.and 9.15.3.6., and the footing area for columns shall be not less than twice the area required by Sentences 9.15.3.4.(1)and 9.15.3.4. and Article 9.15.3.7.Basic Footing Widths and Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The following building envelope assemblies and components shall be addressed in the energy model calculations: above-ground walls and roof-ceiling assemblies, floors and walls in contact with the ground, and doors, windows and skylights. (See Subsection 9.36.2.)
unique_id: The following building envelope assemblies and components shall be addressed in the energy model calculations: above-ground walls and roof-ceiling assemblies, floors and walls in contact with the ground, and doors, windows and skylights. (See Subsection 9.36.2.)Building Envelope Calculations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.16.3.(2)and 9.10.16.3.(3), fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.10.16.3.(2)and 9.10.16.3.(3), fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and MaterialsFire Block Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a concealed space referred to in Sentence 3.6.4.3. is used as a return-air plenum and incorporates a ceiling membrane that forms part of the required fire-resistance rating of the assembly, every opening through the membrane shall be protected by a fire stop flap that stops the flow of air into the concealed space in the event of a fire, is supported in a manner that will maintain the integrity of the ceiling membrane for the duration of time required to provide the required fire-resistance rating, conforms to ULC CAN/ULC-S112.2-07 Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies and activates at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the return-air plenum, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.
unique_id: If a concealed space referred to in Sentence 3.6.4.3. is used as a return-air plenum and incorporates a ceiling membrane that forms part of the required fire-resistance rating of the assembly, every opening through the membrane shall be protected by a fire stop flap that stops the flow of air into the concealed space in the event of a fire, is supported in a manner that will maintain the integrity of the ceiling membrane for the duration of time required to provide the required fire-resistance rating, conforms to ULC CAN/ULC-S112.2-07 Fire Test of Ceiling Firestop Flap Assemblies and activates at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the return-air plenum, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.Plenum Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.3.(2)and 3.4.3.3.(4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.3.3.(2)and 3.4.3.3.(4), no fixture, turnstile or construction shall project into or be fixed within the required width of an exit.Exit Width Reduction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.1.8.3. shall terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where it abuts on or intersects a floor, a roof slab, or a roof deck.
unique_id: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.1.8.3. shall terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where it abuts on or intersects a floor, a roof slab, or a roof deck.Continuity of Fire Separations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The orientation of the foundation of the proposed house as constructed shall be within 22.5° of the orientation used in the energy model calculations.
unique_id: The orientation of the foundation of the proposed house as constructed shall be within 22.5° of the orientation used in the energy model calculations.Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.
unique_id: Dead-end aisles shall be not more than 6 m long.Aisles

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The thermal characteristics of windows, doors and skylights shall be determined by calculation or testing in accordance with CSA A440.2-14/A440.3-14 Fenestration Energy Performance/User Guide to CSA A440.2-14, Fenestration Energy Performance for the reference sizes listed therein, or NFRC 100-2010 Determining Fenestration Product U-factors and NFRC 200-2010 Determining Fenestration Product Solar Heat Gain Coefficient and Visible Transmittance at Normal Incidence for the reference sizes listed therein. (See Note A-9.36.2.2.(3).)
unique_id: The thermal characteristics of windows, doors and skylights shall be determined by calculation or testing in accordance with CSA A440.2-14/A440.3-14 Fenestration Energy Performance/User Guide to CSA A440.2-14, Fenestration Energy Performance for the reference sizes listed therein, or NFRC 100-2010 Determining Fenestration Product U-factors and NFRC 200-2010 Determining Fenestration Product Solar Heat Gain Coefficient and Visible Transmittance at Normal Incidence for the reference sizes listed therein. (See Note A-9.36.2.2.(3).)Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and prevent detrimental movements.
unique_id: Where an excavation is backfilled, the backfill shall be placed so as to provide lateral support to the soil adjacent to the excavation, and prevent detrimental movements.Backfilling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Note A-9.21.5.1.(1).)
unique_id: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Note A-9.21.5.1.(1).)Clearance from Combustible Materials

ARTICLE_TITLE: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.
unique_id: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the piping is sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating required for the fire separation.Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4. nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.
unique_id: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4. nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.Basements

ARTICLE_TITLE: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.2.
unique_id: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to Article 9.32.2.2.Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace Inserts
unique_id: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace InsertsAppliance Standard

ARTICLE_TITLE: Slip Resistance of Ramps and Stairs
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The surfaces of ramps, and landings and treads shall have a finish that is slip resistant, and if accessible to the public, shall have either a colour contrast or a distinctive pattern to demarcate the leading edge of the tread and the leading edge of the landing, as well as the beginning and end of a ramp.
unique_id: The surfaces of ramps, and landings and treads shall have a finish that is slip resistant, and if accessible to the public, shall have either a colour contrast or a distinctive pattern to demarcate the leading edge of the tread and the leading edge of the landing, as well as the beginning and end of a ramp.Slip Resistance of Ramps and Stairs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation required to be protected with a closure shall be not more than 22 m2, with no dimension more than 6 m, provided the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
unique_id: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation required to be protected with a closure shall be not more than 22 m2, with no dimension more than 6 m, provided the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.Maximum Openings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if such walls support a solid masonry superstructure, the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.
unique_id: Foundation walls shall be considered to be laterally supported at the top if such walls support a solid masonry superstructure, the floor joists are embedded in the top of the foundation walls, or the floor system is anchored to the top of the foundation walls with anchor bolts, in which case the joists may run either parallel or perpendicular to the foundation walls.Foundation Walls Considered to be Laterally Supported at the

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.
unique_id: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Articles 9.5.2.3.and 3.8.2.1., every building shall be designed in conformance with Section 3.8.
unique_id: Except as provided in Articles 9.5.2.3.and 3.8.2.1., every building shall be designed in conformance with Section 3.8.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.
unique_id: Where a foundation is to rest on, in or near sloping ground, this particular condition shall be provided for in the design.Sloping Ground

ARTICLE_TITLE: Design Basis for Plain, Reinforced and Pre-stressed Concrete
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings and their structural members made of plain, reinforced and pre-stressed concrete shall conform to CSA A23.3-14 Design of Concrete Structures (See Note A-4.3.3.1.(1).)
unique_id: Buildings and their structural members made of plain, reinforced and pre-stressed concrete shall conform to CSA A23.3-14 Design of Concrete Structures (See Note A-4.3.3.1.(1).)Design Basis for Plain, Reinforced and Pre-stressed Concrete

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of cladding materials.
unique_id: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of cladding materials.Attachment of Cladding to Sheathing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3. shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.
unique_id: Illumination from lighting required in Sentence 9.9.12.3. shall be provided to average levels of not less than 10 lx at floor or tread level.Emergency Lighting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2)and 9.32.3.7.(3), a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 50 L/s shall be installed in each kitchen.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.7.(2)and 9.32.3.7.(3), a supplemental exhaust fan with a rated capacity not less than 50 L/s shall be installed in each kitchen.Supplemental Exhaust

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to Sections 3.3.and 3.4.
unique_id: Tents and air-supported structures shall conform to Sections 3.3.and 3.4.Means of Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a single heating system serves a house with a secondary suite, individual temperature controls shall be provided in each dwelling unit served by the system. (See Note A-9.33.4.3.(1).)
unique_id: Where a single heating system serves a house with a secondary suite, individual temperature controls shall be provided in each dwelling unit served by the system. (See Note A-9.33.4.3.(1).)Heating System Control

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(13), a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.2.4.20.(13), a manually operated silencing device shall be incorporated within the circuitry of a smoke alarm installed in a dwelling unit so that it will silence the signal emitted by the smoke alarm for a period of not more than 10 min, after which the smoke alarm will reset and again sound the alarm if the level of smoke in the vicinity is sufficient to reactuate the smoke alarm.Smoke Alarms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.6.5.4.(3), combustible coverings and linings, including associated adhesives and insulation, shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and a smoke developed classification not more than 50.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.6.5.4.(3), combustible coverings and linings, including associated adhesives and insulation, shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and a smoke developed classification not more than 50.Coverings, Linings, Adhesives and Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.
unique_id: Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to CSA A23.1-14 Concrete Materials and Methods of Concrete Construction and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.Aggregates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.
unique_id: The material used as backfill or fill supporting a footing, foundation or a floor on grade shall be of a type that is not subject to detrimental volume change with changes in moisture content and temperature.Backfilling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2.
unique_id: The sides of an excavation in soil or rock may be unsupported where a design is prepared in conformance with the requirements of Articles 4.2.5.1. and Article 4.2.5.2.Unsupported Excavations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2., 9.20.13.12.and 9.28.1.5.)
unique_id: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2., 9.20.13.12.and 9.28.1.5.)Required Sealants

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Intake openings for a linen chute or a refuse chute shall be located in rooms or compartments that have no dimension less than 750 mm, are separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, are designed for no other purpose, and do not open directly into an exit.
unique_id: Intake openings for a linen chute or a refuse chute shall be located in rooms or compartments that have no dimension less than 750 mm, are separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, are designed for no other purpose, and do not open directly into an exit.Linen and Refuse Chutes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Lavatories required by Sentence 3.7.2.3. shall be equipped with faucets that operate automatically, or have a manual control that complies with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b), does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.
unique_id: Lavatories required by Sentence 3.7.2.3. shall be equipped with faucets that operate automatically, or have a manual control that complies with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b), does not require the application of continuous force to maintain water flow, and where metered, provides at least 10 s of water flow.Lavatories

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The installation of a hydronic heating system shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating Systems
unique_id: The installation of a hydronic heating system shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating SystemsInstallation of Hydronic Heating Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 9.9.11.3.(2)(b)and 9.9.11.3.(2) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.
unique_id: Where no exit is visible from a public corridor, from a corridor used by the public, or from principal routes serving an open floor area having an occupant load of more than 150, an exit sign conforming to Clauses 9.9.11.3.(2)(b)and 9.9.11.3.(2) with an arrow or pointer indicating the direction of egress shall be provided.Exit Signs

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Separations for Vertical Service Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only openings that are necessary for the use of the vertical service space shall be permitted through a vertical service space enclosure.
unique_id: Only openings that are necessary for the use of the vertical service space shall be permitted through a vertical service space enclosure.Fire Separations for Vertical Service Spaces

ARTICLE_TITLE: Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings containing 2 dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.
unique_id: In buildings containing 2 dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.Combustible Drain, Waste and Vent Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Article 9.24.2.4., steel studs in non-loadbearing interior walls shall have a metal thickness of not less than 0.46 mm.
unique_id: Except as required in Article 9.24.2.4., steel studs in non-loadbearing interior walls shall have a metal thickness of not less than 0.46 mm.Thickness of Studs

ARTICLE_TITLE: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Reinforcing around openings in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall comply with Article 9.20.17.3.or 9.20.17.4.
unique_id: Reinforcing around openings in flat insulating concrete form foundation walls shall comply with Article 9.20.17.3.or 9.20.17.4.Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Foundation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a second manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated not less than 4 times.
unique_id: If a second manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector is operated in a fire alarm system with zone coding as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.4.(3), in a zone other than that for which the first alert signal was sounded, the coded alert signal for the first zone shall be completed before the coded alert signal for the second zone is repeated not less than 4 times.Description of Fire Alarm Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Sentence 3.1.5.23.(2), subject to the limits on the size of elements that penetrate fire separations as stated in Sentence 3.1.9.3.(2), within a fire compartment of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, totally enclosed non-metallic raceways not more than 175 mm in outside diameter, or of an equivalent rectangular area, are permitted to be used to enclose optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables, provided where the wires and cables in the raceways meet or exceed the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.21.(1)(a), the non-metallic raceways meet the requirements for at least an FT4 rating in CSA CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 262-04 Optical Fiber Cable and Communication Cable Raceway Systems or ULC CAN/ULC-S143-14 Fire Tests for Non-Metallic Electrical and Optical Fibre Cable Raceway Systems and where the wires and cables in the raceways do not meet or exceed the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.21.(1)(a), the non-metallic raceways exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test  – Conduit or Tubing on Cable Tray in Clause 6.16 of CSA C22.2 No. 211.0-03 General Requirements and Methods of Testing for Nonmetallic Conduit
unique_id: Except as required in Sentence 3.1.5.23.(2), subject to the limits on the size of elements that penetrate fire separations as stated in Sentence 3.1.9.3.(2), within a fire compartment of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, totally enclosed non-metallic raceways not more than 175 mm in outside diameter, or of an equivalent rectangular area, are permitted to be used to enclose optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables, provided where the wires and cables in the raceways meet or exceed the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.21.(1)(a), the non-metallic raceways meet the requirements for at least an FT4 rating in CSA CAN/CSA-C22.2 No. 262-04 Optical Fiber Cable and Communication Cable Raceway Systems or ULC CAN/ULC-S143-14 Fire Tests for Non-Metallic Electrical and Optical Fibre Cable Raceway Systems and where the wires and cables in the raceways do not meet or exceed the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.21.(1)(a), the non-metallic raceways exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test  – Conduit or Tubing on Cable Tray in Clause 6.16 of CSA C22.2 No. 211.0-03 General Requirements and Methods of Testing for Nonmetallic ConduitNon-metallic Raceways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Lumber roof sheathing shall not be more than 286 mm wide and shall be applied so that all ends are supported with end joints staggered.
unique_id: Lumber roof sheathing shall not be more than 286 mm wide and shall be applied so that all ends are supported with end joints staggered.Lumber Roof Sheathing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The drained and vented air space, and drainage material described in Sentence 9.27.3.1. may be interrupted by penetrations for windows, doors and services, flashing, and furring, provided the furring does not make up more than 20% of the furred area.
unique_id: The drained and vented air space, and drainage material described in Sentence 9.27.3.1. may be interrupted by penetrations for windows, doors and services, flashing, and furring, provided the furring does not make up more than 20% of the furred area.Minimum Protection from Precipitation Ingress

ARTICLE_TITLE: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
unique_id: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings in which a sprinkler system has been installed in accordance with NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes a fire alarm system need not be installed.
unique_id: In buildings in which a sprinkler system has been installed in accordance with NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes a fire alarm system need not be installed.Fire Alarm System Required

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.5.(1).)
unique_id: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.5.(1).)Tire Storage

ARTICLE_TITLE: Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over wood-frame walls shall be installed so that it extends from a point not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing to a point 150 mm up the wood-frame wall.
unique_id: Flashing beneath weep holes in masonry veneer over wood-frame walls shall be installed so that it extends from a point not less than 5 mm beyond the outer face of the building element below the flashing to a point 150 mm up the wood-frame wall.Flashing for Weep Holes in Masonry Veneer

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An underground walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.
unique_id: An underground walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.Underground Walkway

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Revolving doors shall comply with Article 3.4.6.15.
unique_id: Revolving doors shall comply with Article 3.4.6.15.Door Action

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Single wall metal smoke stacks shall be designed and installed in conformance with NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning Appliances
unique_id: Single wall metal smoke stacks shall be designed and installed in conformance with NFPA 211-2016 Chimneys, Fireplaces, Vents, and Solid Fuel-Burning AppliancesMetal Smoke Stacks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to Subsection 1.1.3.
unique_id: Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral response accelerations, shall be determined according to Subsection 1.1.3.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Masonry or concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.21.
unique_id: Masonry or concrete chimneys shall conform to Section 9.21.Masonry or Concrete Chimneys

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Hip and valley rafters shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than the common rafters and not less than 38 mm thick, actual dimension.
unique_id: Hip and valley rafters shall be not less than 50 mm greater in depth than the common rafters and not less than 38 mm thick, actual dimension.Hip and Valley Rafters

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stucco lath shall be held not less than 6 mm away from the backing by means of suitable self-furring devices.
unique_id: Stucco lath shall be held not less than 6 mm away from the backing by means of suitable self-furring devices.Self-Furring Devices

ARTICLE_TITLE: Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the slope factor, Cs, shall be as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5)and 4.1.6.2.(6).
unique_id: For all arch roofs, curved roofs and domes, the slope factor, Cs, shall be as prescribed in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(5)and 4.1.6.2.(6).Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The heat source component of combined space- and service water heating systems that are not within the scope of CSA CAN/CSA-P.9-11 Performance of Combined Space and Water Heating Systems  shall meet the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.3.10. for the applicable equipment type. (See Note A-9.36.3.10.(3).)
unique_id: The heat source component of combined space- and service water heating systems that are not within the scope of CSA CAN/CSA-P.9-11 Performance of Combined Space and Water Heating Systems  shall meet the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.3.10. for the applicable equipment type. (See Note A-9.36.3.10.(3).)Equipment Efficiency

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of this Subsection, the term "principal ventilation rate" shall mean the normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan as required by Article 9.32.3.3.
unique_id: For the purpose of this Subsection, the term "principal ventilation rate" shall mean the normal operating exhaust capacity of the principal ventilation fan as required by Article 9.32.3.3.Definitions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.
unique_id: Eave protection shall be laid beneath the starter strip and shall consist of No. 15 asphalt-saturated felt laid in two plies lapped 480 mm and cemented together with lap cement, Type M or S roll roofing laid with not less than 100 mm head and end laps cemented together with lap cement, glass fibre or polyester fibre coated base sheets, or self-sealing composite membranes consisting of modified bituminous coated material.Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.9.1.(2)to 3.1.9.1.(5)and Article 3.1.9.4., penetrations of a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an F rating not less than the fire-protection rating required for closures in the fire separation in conformance with Table 3.1.8.4., or cast in place (see Note A-3.1.9.1.(1)(b)). (See also Article 3.1.9.5. for requirements regarding penetrations by combustible drain, waste and vent piping.)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.9.1.(2)to 3.1.9.1.(5)and Article 3.1.9.4., penetrations of a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be sealed by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an F rating not less than the fire-protection rating required for closures in the fire separation in conformance with Table 3.1.8.4., or cast in place (see Note A-3.1.9.1.(1)(b)). (See also Article 3.1.9.5. for requirements regarding penetrations by combustible drain, waste and vent piping.)Fire Stops

FRAG_DOCUMENT: On a building more than 3 storeys in building height where the slope of the roof is less than 1 in 4, all main roof areas shall be provided with direct access from the floor areas immediately below, either by a stairway, or a hatch not less than 550 mm by 900 mm with a fixed ladder.
unique_id: On a building more than 3 storeys in building height where the slope of the roof is less than 1 in 4, all main roof areas shall be provided with direct access from the floor areas immediately below, either by a stairway, or a hatch not less than 550 mm by 900 mm with a fixed ladder.Roof Access

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If the plenum clearance required in accordance with Sentence 3.6.5.6. is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be not less than the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1 800 mm from the plenum, and 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1 800 mm or more from the plenum, except that this distance is permitted to be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)
unique_id: If the plenum clearance required in accordance with Sentence 3.6.5.6. is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be not less than the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1 800 mm from the plenum, and 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1 800 mm or more from the plenum, except that this distance is permitted to be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the supply duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)Clearance of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.3.(2), at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or 2 water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional 2 water closets or urinals.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.3.(2), at least one lavatory shall be provided in a room containing one or 2 water closets or urinals, and at least one additional lavatory shall be provided for each additional 2 water closets or urinals.Lavatories

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.
unique_id: If the vertical distance between seating platforms in bleachers is more than 280 mm, an intermediate step shall be provided the full width of the aisle and proportioned to provide 2 equal risers between platforms.Bleachers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except those for electrical wiring, noncombustible conduit and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, and for standpipes, sprinkler piping, exit doorways and wired glass and glass block permitted in Article 9.9.4.3.
unique_id: A fire separation that separates an exit from the remainder of the building shall have no openings except those for electrical wiring, noncombustible conduit and noncombustible piping that serve only the exit, and for standpipes, sprinkler piping, exit doorways and wired glass and glass block permitted in Article 9.9.4.3.Fire Separations for Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dry cement shall not be added to the floor surfaces to absorb surplus water.
unique_id: Dry cement shall not be added to the floor surfaces to absorb surplus water.Surface Finish

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.
unique_id: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement

ARTICLE_TITLE: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.
unique_id: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to Section 9.5.Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.5.(1), 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1), where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
unique_id: Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences 6.2.1.5.(1), 9.33.5.2.(1)and 9.33.5.3.(1), fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in Sentence 9.10.10.4.(1), where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.Location of Fuel-Fired Appliances

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25 mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.
unique_id: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25 mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.Fasteners

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.
unique_id: Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.Odour Removal Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.1.(1) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.3.(2)(b).
unique_id: This Article applies where the required protection is provided in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.1.(1) and compliance is demonstrated in accordance with Clause 9.11.1.3.(2)(b).Adjoining Constructions

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Structural Loads and Effects
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.1. and their related effects shall include dead loads transferred from structural elements, wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function (see Note A-5.2.2.1.(2)(c)), live loads due to use and occupancy, and loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 4.1.8.18., the structural loads referred to in Sentence 5.2.2.1. and their related effects shall include dead loads transferred from structural elements, wind, snow, rain, hydrostatic and earth pressures, earthquake effects for post-disaster buildings, depending on their intended function (see Note A-5.2.2.1.(2)(c)), live loads due to use and occupancy, and loads due to thermal or moisture-related expansion and contraction, deflection, deformation, creep, shrinkage, settlement, and differential movement.Determination of Structural Loads and Effects

ARTICLE_TITLE: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, and doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a single dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6. and Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)
unique_id: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, and doors to accessory buildings and to garages serving a single dwelling unit, door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be operable with one hand and the door shall be openable with not more than one releasing operation. (See also Sentence 3.8.3.6. and Note A-3.3.1.13.(4).)Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: OSB conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing shall meet the minimum panel mark of W16, on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., W24, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and W16, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at mid-wall height.
unique_id: OSB conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing shall meet the minimum panel mark of W16, on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., W24, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and W16, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at mid-wall height.Minimum Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).
unique_id: The required exit width for an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serving more than one balcony level shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).Exit Width

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.
unique_id: Penetrations of a firewall or a horizontal fire separation that is required to have a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Article 3.2.1.2. shall be sealed at the penetration by a fire stop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ULC CAN/ULC-S115-11 Fire Tests of Firestop Systems has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.Fire Stops

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Backfill shall be graded to prevent drainage towards the foundation after settling.
unique_id: Backfill shall be graded to prevent drainage towards the foundation after settling.Grading of Backfill

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A walkway of noncombustible construction used only as a pedestrian thoroughfare need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.3.14.and 3.2.3.15.
unique_id: A walkway of noncombustible construction used only as a pedestrian thoroughfare need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.3.14.and 3.2.3.15.Walkway between Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.3.3..
unique_id: The scope of this Part shall be as described in Subsection 1.3.3..Scope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
unique_id: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.Orientation of Studs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible roof covering that has an A, B, or C classification determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.15. is permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Combustible roof covering that has an A, B, or C classification determined in conformance with Subsection 3.1.15. is permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.Combustible Roofing Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1).
unique_id: If an exit stair in an assembly hall or theatre serves more than one balcony level, the exit stair shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.4.4.1.(1).Fire-Resistance Rating of Exit Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17.(2)and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.17.(2)and 9.10.9.17.(3), a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.Separation of Repair Garages

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The finish of the surface of a platform in or adjacent to a stepped aisle shall conform to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).
unique_id: The finish of the surface of a platform in or adjacent to a stepped aisle shall conform to Sentence 3.4.6.1.(1).Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The slope required by Sentence 9.26.3.1. shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and exterior columns (see Note A-9.27.3.8.(4)), and once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls. (See Notes A-9.26.4.1. and Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)
unique_id: The slope required by Sentence 9.26.3.1. shall be sufficient to maintain a positive slope after expected shrinkage of the building frame, where these surfaces are supported by exterior walls and exterior columns (see Note A-9.27.3.8.(4)), and once design loading is taken into consideration, where these surfaces are cantilevered from exterior walls. (See Notes A-9.26.4.1. and Note A-9.26.1.1.(1).)Slope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar bed or applied to a sound smooth base with a suitable adhesive.
unique_id: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar bed or applied to a sound smooth base with a suitable adhesive.Substrate

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10. and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10. and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.Exhaust Ducts and Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where pier-type foundations are used, the piers shall be designed to support the applied loads from the superstructure.
unique_id: Where pier-type foundations are used, the piers shall be designed to support the applied loads from the superstructure.Pier-Type Foundations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.
unique_id: Except within dwelling units, corridors that provide access to exit from sleeping rooms and that have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to the appropriate requirements in Subsection 9.10.17.Flame-Spread Ratings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The bottom of excavations shall be kept from freezing throughout the entire construction period.
unique_id: The bottom of excavations shall be kept from freezing throughout the entire construction period.Protection from Freezing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.3.8.(1) are that the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m, the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints, the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed, the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.
unique_id: The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Clause 3.2.3.8.(1) are that the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m, the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints, the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed, the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.Protection of Exterior Building Face

ARTICLE_TITLE: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass other than safety glass shall not be used for a shower or bathtub enclosure.
unique_id: Glass other than safety glass shall not be used for a shower or bathtub enclosure.Types of Glass and Protection of Glass

ARTICLE_TITLE: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.Continuity of the Air Barrier System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.
unique_id: A ramp shall have handrails on both sides.Handrails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dry wells shall be not less than 5 m from the buildingfoundation and located so that drainage is away from the building.
unique_id: Dry wells shall be not less than 5 m from the buildingfoundation and located so that drainage is away from the building.Dry Wells

ARTICLE_TITLE: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a fire alarm system is required, every public corridor in buildings of residential occupancy and every exit stair shaft shall be provided with smoke detectors.
unique_id: Where a fire alarm system is required, every public corridor in buildings of residential occupancy and every exit stair shaft shall be provided with smoke detectors.Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.77. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 9 600 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 4 800 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 3 200 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or 2 400 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.77. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 9 600 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 4 800 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 3 200 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or 2 400 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.
unique_id: Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.Structural Movement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5. and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).) (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)
unique_id: Where the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5. and adjacent occupancies that are permitted to open into the lobby are sprinklered, the fire separation between such occupancies and the lobby need not have a fire-resistance rating. (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).) (See Note A-3.4.4.2.(2)(e).)Exiting through a Lobby

ARTICLE_TITLE: Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Portions of the perimeter of a single open or enclosed space need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), where the roof of the space projects not more than 3.5 m from the face of the framing of the nearest parallel braced wall band, and half the perpendicular plan dimension, that portion of the perimeter structure does not support a floor, and the roof of the space is integral with the roof of the rest of the building with framing members not more than 400 mm o.c., or constructed with roof framing not more than 400 mm o.c. fastened to the wall framing (see Table 9.23.3.4. and Article 9.23.9.1. for balloon framing). (See Note A-9.23.13.5.(3).)
unique_id: Portions of the perimeter of a single open or enclosed space need not comply with Sentence 9.23.13.5.(1), where the roof of the space projects not more than 3.5 m from the face of the framing of the nearest parallel braced wall band, and half the perpendicular plan dimension, that portion of the perimeter structure does not support a floor, and the roof of the space is integral with the roof of the rest of the building with framing members not more than 400 mm o.c., or constructed with roof framing not more than 400 mm o.c. fastened to the wall framing (see Table 9.23.3.4. and Article 9.23.9.1. for balloon framing). (See Note A-9.23.13.5.(3).)Braced Wall Panels in Braced Wall Bands

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor, if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.
unique_id: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor, if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.Installation of Thermal Insulation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Anchoring of Roof Framing to the Top of Flat Insulating Concrete
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Attachment of roof framing to wood top plates shall be in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.
unique_id: Attachment of roof framing to wood top plates shall be in accordance with Table 9.23.3.4.Anchoring of Roof Framing to the Top of Flat Insulating Concrete

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The thickness of masonry walls surrounding the smoke chamber shall be not less than 190 mm at the sides, front and back, except that the portions of the back exposed to the outside may be 140 mm thick.
unique_id: The thickness of masonry walls surrounding the smoke chamber shall be not less than 190 mm at the sides, front and back, except that the portions of the back exposed to the outside may be 140 mm thick.Wall Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exhaust outlets shall be designed to prevent backdraft under wind conditions.
unique_id: Exhaust outlets shall be designed to prevent backdraft under wind conditions.Exhaust Ducts and Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Note A-4.1.8.15.(6).)
unique_id: Where structures have vertical variations of RdRo satisfying Sentence 4.1.8.9.(4), the elements of the SFRS below the level where the change in RdRo occurs shall be designed for the forces associated with the lateral load capacity of the SFRS above that level. (See Note A-4.1.8.15.(6).)Design Provisions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(2).)
unique_id: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h. (See Note A-3.3.6.2.(2).)Storage of Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Floor joists described in Sentence 9.20.8.2. shall not project into the cavity.
unique_id: Floor joists described in Sentence 9.20.8.2. shall not project into the cavity.Cavity Walls Supporting Framing Members

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.)
unique_id: If a fire pump is installed, it shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 20-2016 Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.5.18.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.)Fire Pumps

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless it can be shown that the size of openings that exceed this limit does not present a hazard, there shall be no opening that permits the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 100 mm through a guard for a fire escape.
unique_id: Unless it can be shown that the size of openings that exceed this limit does not present a hazard, there shall be no opening that permits the passage of a sphere whose diameter is more than 100 mm through a guard for a fire escape.Guards and Railings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The floor of an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7. shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.
unique_id: The floor of an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7. shall be liquid tight and surrounded by liquid tight walls and sills of sufficient height to confine within the vault all of the liquid from the largest item of electrical equipment, but to a height of not less than 100 mm.Electrical Equipment Vaults

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.14.(6), a stage for theatrical performances and ancillary spaces, including workshops, dressing rooms and storage areas, shall be separated from the seating area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except for a proscenium opening protected with a sprinkler deluge system conforming to the requirements of NFPA 13-2013 Installation of Sprinkler Systems an unframed fire curtain if the opening is not more than 20 m wide, or a semi-rigid fire curtain if the opening is more than 20 m wide.Stages for Theatrical Performances

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp or 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit, and 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-3.4.6.4.) (See also Articles 9.9.6.1. and 9.9.6.6. regarding landings in exits.)
unique_id: A landing may be omitted at the bottom of an exterior stair or ramp provided there is no obstruction, such as a gate or door, within the lesser of the width of the stair or ramp or 900 mm for stairs or ramps serving a single dwelling unit, and 1 100 mm for stairs or ramps not serving a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-3.4.6.4.) (See also Articles 9.9.6.1. and 9.9.6.6. regarding landings in exits.)Required Landings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the exposing building face of any section of an exterior wall enclosing a single room or space, or combination room and space, has a limiting distance of 2 m or less, that section of the exposing building face serving the room or space shall not be divided into portions for the purpose of calculating area of exposing building face. (See Sentence 9.10.15.4. and Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)
unique_id: Where the exposing building face of any section of an exterior wall enclosing a single room or space, or combination room and space, has a limiting distance of 2 m or less, that section of the exposing building face serving the room or space shall not be divided into portions for the purpose of calculating area of exposing building face. (See Sentence 9.10.15.4. and Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system referred to in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of brick, masonry, concrete, metal sheets or metal shingles.
unique_id: A roof covering is not required to have a Class A, B or C classification for a tent, an air-supported structure, a building of Group A, Division 2 occupancy not more than 2 storeys in building height and not more than 1 000 m2 in building area provided the roof covering is underlaid with noncombustible material, or a steel building system referred to in Article 4.3.4.3., provided the roof covering consists of brick, masonry, concrete, metal sheets or metal shingles.Roof Coverings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Reinforcement for Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Vertical reinforcement required by Sentence 9.20.17.2. and interrupted by wall openings shall be placed not more than 600 mm from each side of the opening.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a door swings toward a stair, the full arc of the swing shall be over the landing.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The foundation depths required by Sentence 9.12.2.2. do not apply to foundations for buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, and whose superstructure conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes or accessory buildings that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction, not more than 1 storey in height, not more than 55 m2 in building area, and where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the floor joists is not more than 600 mm.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall account for the following space-heating temperature set-points: 21°C in all living spaces above the basement, 19°C in basements and common spaces, and 15°C in crawl spaces intended to be conditioned spaces.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhaust and exhaust from the building or adjacent buildings.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Loads Due to Use of Floors and Roofs
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.5.1.(2), the specified live load on an area of floor or roof depends on the intended use and occupancy, and shall not be less than either the uniformly distributed load patterns listed in Article 4.1.5.3., the loads due to the intended use and occupancy, or the concentrated loads listed in Article 4.1.5.9., whichever produces the most critical effect. (See Note A-4.1.5.1.(1).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.5.12.(2)and 3.1.5.12.(3), combustible interior wall and ceiling finishes referred to in Clause 3.1.13.1.(2) that are not more than 1 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass in doors and in sidelights that could be mistaken for doors, within or at the entrances to dwelling units and in public areas, shall conform to the requirements of Article 9.6.1.4.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless otherwise indicated herein, dimensions of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces. (See Note A-9.5.1.2.)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heat-recovery systems used to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.36.3.8. shall be capable of recovering at least 40% of the sensible heat from exhausted air when tested in accordance with AHRI 1060 (I-P)-2013 Performance Rating of Air-to-Air Exchangers for Energy Recovery Ventilation Equipment(see Note A-9.36.3.8.(4)(a)), or have a sensible-heat-recovery efficiency complying with Sentence 9.36.3.9. when tested in accordance with CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A single stage fire alarm system installed in a building of assembly occupancy that has an occupant load more than 300 shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Under fire conditions, where the fire-resistance rating of the structure is less than that of the firewall, lateral support shall be assumed to be provided by the structure on one side only, or another structural support system capable of resisting the loads imposed by a fire on either side of the firewall shall be provided.

(See Note A-6.3.1.4.(2).)

(See Note A-9.36.3.4.(2).)
