ARTICLE_TITLE: Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence 9.20.8.5. is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.
unique_id: Where the masonry veneer described in Sentence 9.20.8.5. is rough stone masonry, the projection shall be measured as the average projection of the units, and the thickness of the veneer shall be measured as the average thickness of the veneer.Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall take into account the service water heating use schedule presented in Table 9.36.5.8. using a load of 225 L/ day for houses with or without a secondary suite, or 140 L/day per dwelling unit for other types of residential buildings.
unique_id: The energy model calculations shall take into account the service water heating use schedule presented in Table 9.36.5.8. using a load of 225 L/ day for houses with or without a secondary suite, or 140 L/day per dwelling unit for other types of residential buildings.Service Water Heating System Calculations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Ceiling, Wall, Fenestration and Door Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fenestration area made of flat panes that are not all in the same plane or curved panes shall be measured along the surface of the glass. (See Note A-9.36.2.3.(5).)
unique_id: The fenestration area made of flat panes that are not all in the same plane or curved panes shall be measured along the surface of the glass. (See Note A-9.36.2.3.(5).)Calculation of Ceiling, Wall, Fenestration and Door Areas

ARTICLE_TITLE: Design of Heating and Air-conditioning Systems
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA Manuals. (See also Subsection 9.32.3. for the design of systems that also provide ventilation.)
unique_id: Heating and air-conditioning systems, including ducting, and mechanical heating and refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest the CHC Handbook on Hydronic Heating Systems, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA Manuals. (See also Subsection 9.32.3. for the design of systems that also provide ventilation.)Design of Heating and Air-conditioning Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
unique_id: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.Wall Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation required to be protected with a closure shall be not more than 11 m2, with no dimension more than 3.7 m, if a fire compartment on either side of the fire separation is not sprinklered.
unique_id: The size of an opening in an interior fire separation required to be protected with a closure shall be not more than 11 m2, with no dimension more than 3.7 m, if a fire compartment on either side of the fire separation is not sprinklered.Maximum Openings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For buildings on hills or escarpments with a slope, Hh/(2Lh), greater than 0.1 (see Figure 4.1.7.4.), the topographic factor, Ct, shall be calculated as follows: Ct=1+DSCg1+DSwhere DS=DSmax1- xkLh exp-az/Lhwhere Smax= applicable value from Table 4.1.7.4., x= horizontal distance from the peak of the hill or escarpment, Lh= horizontal distance upwind from the peak to the point where the ground surface lies at half the height of the hill or escarpment, or 2Hh (where Hh = height of hill or escarpment), whichever is greater, z= height above ground, and k and  = applicable constants from Table 4.1.7.4. based on shape of hill or escarpment.
unique_id: For buildings on hills or escarpments with a slope, Hh/(2Lh), greater than 0.1 (see Figure 4.1.7.4.), the topographic factor, Ct, shall be calculated as follows: Ct=1+DSCg1+DSwhere DS=DSmax1- xkLh exp-az/Lhwhere Smax= applicable value from Table 4.1.7.4., x= horizontal distance from the peak of the hill or escarpment, Lh= horizontal distance upwind from the peak to the point where the ground surface lies at half the height of the hill or escarpment, or 2Hh (where Hh = height of hill or escarpment), whichever is greater, z= height above ground, and k and  = applicable constants from Table 4.1.7.4. based on shape of hill or escarpment.Topographic Factor

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.
unique_id: Unless otherwise stated in this Subsection, the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 when used in conjunction with accumulation factors for increased snow loads.Specified Snow Load

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(4).)
unique_id: Where a stair or ramp is wider than its required exit width, handrails shall be located along the most direct path of travel. (See Note A-3.4.6.5.(4).)Handrails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing.
unique_id: Exterior dampproofing shall be applied from finished ground level to the top of the exterior of the footing.Application of Dampproofing Material

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.) (See Article 9.20.9.6.)
unique_id: Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with Article 9.10.3.1. is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h. (See Article 9.20.9.6.) (See Article 9.20.9.6.)Glass Block as a Closure

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 3.5.2.1.(3), controls for the operation of building services or safety devices, including electrical switches, thermostats, faucets, door hardware and intercom switches, that are intended to be operated by the occupant and are located in or adjacent to a barrier-free path of travel shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3. (See Note A-3.8.2.6.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 3.5.2.1.(3), controls for the operation of building services or safety devices, including electrical switches, thermostats, faucets, door hardware and intercom switches, that are intended to be operated by the occupant and are located in or adjacent to a barrier-free path of travel shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3. (See Note A-3.8.2.6.(1).)Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Footings shall rest on undisturbed soil, rock or compacted granular fill.
unique_id: Footings shall rest on undisturbed soil, rock or compacted granular fill.Support of Footings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fire damper shall be installed in the plane of the fire separation so as to stay in place should the duct become dislodged during a fire. (See Note A-3.1.8.10.(1).)
unique_id: A fire damper shall be installed in the plane of the fire separation so as to stay in place should the duct become dislodged during a fire. (See Note A-3.1.8.10.(1).)Installation of Fire Dampers

ARTICLE_TITLE: Wall with Limiting Distance Less Than 1.2 m
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Openings in a wall that has a limiting distance less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.
unique_id: Openings in a wall that has a limiting distance less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall.Wall with Limiting Distance Less Than 1.2 m

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.7.2.2.(4)and 3.7.2.2.(16), the number of water closets required for a mercantile occupancy shall be at least one for each 300 males and one for each 150 females.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.7.2.2.(4)and 3.7.2.2.(16), the number of water closets required for a mercantile occupancy shall be at least one for each 300 males and one for each 150 females.Water Closets

ARTICLE_TITLE: Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be supplied from a generator, batteries, or a combination thereof.
unique_id: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be supplied from a generator, batteries, or a combination thereof.Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Drinking fountains required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall be located along a barrier-free path of travel, have a minimum clear floor space of 800 mm by 1 350 mm in front of it, where it has frontal access, provide a knee clearance in accordance with Clause 3.8.3.15.(1)(d), have a spout that is located near the front of the unit, at a height between 750 mm and 915 mm above the floor, and directs water flow in a trajectory that is nearly parallel to the front of the unit, at a height not less than 100 mm, and be equipped with controls that activate automatically, or are located either on the front or on both sides of it and comply with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b).
unique_id: Drinking fountains required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall be located along a barrier-free path of travel, have a minimum clear floor space of 800 mm by 1 350 mm in front of it, where it has frontal access, provide a knee clearance in accordance with Clause 3.8.3.15.(1)(d), have a spout that is located near the front of the unit, at a height between 750 mm and 915 mm above the floor, and directs water flow in a trajectory that is nearly parallel to the front of the unit, at a height not less than 100 mm, and be equipped with controls that activate automatically, or are located either on the front or on both sides of it and comply with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b).Drinking Fountains

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.8.(6)to 9.32.3.8.(8), any mechanical air exhausting device, other than the principal ventilation fan operating at a rate not greater than the maximum permitted by Table 9.32.3.3., shall be provided with outdoor makeup air supplied by a fan rated to deliver outdoor air to the dwelling unit at a rate not less than the exhaust capacity of the device, and not greater than that exhaust capacity plus 10%.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.32.3.8.(6)to 9.32.3.8.(8), any mechanical air exhausting device, other than the principal ventilation fan operating at a rate not greater than the maximum permitted by Table 9.32.3.3., shall be provided with outdoor makeup air supplied by a fan rated to deliver outdoor air to the dwelling unit at a rate not less than the exhaust capacity of the device, and not greater than that exhaust capacity plus 10%.Protection Against Depressurization

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1. (See Note A-5.9.3.2.(1).)
unique_id: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1. (See Note A-5.9.3.2.(1).)Structural and Environmental Loads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.21., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article.
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 3.2.4.21., smoke alarms shall be installed in accordance with this Article.Smoke Alarms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All structural framing elements shall be designed for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd   1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.
unique_id: All structural framing elements shall be designed for an SFRS with Rd =1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for Rd   1.5 and the applicable referenced design standards, or for an SFRS with Rd > 1.0, using the forces referred to in Sentence 4.1.8.22. with RdRo = 1.0, except that the SFRS shall be detailed in accordance with the requirements for the selected Rd and the applicable referenced design standards.Supplemental Energy Dissipation Design Considerations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service water heating systems with storage tanks shall be equipped with automatic temperature controls capable of adjustment between the minimum and maximum temperature settings permitted for the intended use.
unique_id: Service water heating systems with storage tanks shall be equipped with automatic temperature controls capable of adjustment between the minimum and maximum temperature settings permitted for the intended use.Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit and except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.12. and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel, and swing on its vertical axis.
unique_id: Except for doors serving a single dwelling unit and except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.12. and Article 3.4.6.14., every exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel, and swing on its vertical axis.Direction of Door Swing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 9.13.3.1., where the exterior finished ground level is at a higher elevation than the ground level inside the foundation walls, exterior surfaces of foundation walls below ground level shall be dampproofed.Required Dampproofing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.16.1.(1), decking for wood shingled roofs may be continuous or spaced.Decking

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only the active leaf in a multiple leaf door in a barrier-free path of travel need conform to the requirements of this Article.
unique_id: Only the active leaf in a multiple leaf door in a barrier-free path of travel need conform to the requirements of this Article.Power Door Operators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Reinforcement required in Sentence 9.20.9.6. shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.
unique_id: Reinforcement required in Sentence 9.20.9.6. shall be lapped not less than 150 mm.Reinforcing for Glass Block

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10. shall be installed in elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts where a sprinkler system is not installed within the hoistway or shaft.
unique_id: Fire detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.10. shall be installed in elevator hoistways and dumbwaiter shafts where a sprinkler system is not installed within the hoistway or shaft.Fire Detectors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.9.3.1.(2)to 3.9.3.1.(6), the requirements of Section 3.3. shall apply. (See Note A-3.9.3.1.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.9.3.1.(2)to 3.9.3.1.(6), the requirements of Section 3.3. shall apply. (See Note A-3.9.3.1.(1).)Safety Requirements Within Floor Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence 9.33.8.2. shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), insulation and coverings on piping located in rooms and spaces other than the service spaces described in Sentence 9.33.8.2. shall have a flame-spread rating not more than that required for the interior finish for the ceiling of the room or space.Insulation and Coverings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Firewalls shall be designed to resist the maximum effect due to the appropriate lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in this Section, or a factored lateral load of 0.5 kPa under fire conditions, as described in Sentence 4.1.5.17.(2).
unique_id: Firewalls shall be designed to resist the maximum effect due to the appropriate lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in this Section, or a factored lateral load of 0.5 kPa under fire conditions, as described in Sentence 4.1.5.17.(2).Firewalls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Waterproof finish shall consist of ceramic, plastic or metal tile, sheet vinyl, tempered hardboard, laminated thermosetting decorative sheets or linoleum.
unique_id: Waterproof finish shall consist of ceramic, plastic or metal tile, sheet vinyl, tempered hardboard, laminated thermosetting decorative sheets or linoleum.Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving buildings of Group D, E or F major occupancy that are not more than 2 storeys in building height.
unique_id: No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving buildings of Group D, E or F major occupancy that are not more than 2 storeys in building height.Floors of Exterior Passageways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing.
unique_id: Unit masonry walls to be dampproofed shall be parged on the exterior face below ground level with not less than 6 mm of mortar conforming to Section 9.20. coved over the footing.Preparation of Surface

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that they resist snow loads.
unique_id: Skylights and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that they resist snow loads.General Performance Expectations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Coal-tar products and asphalt products shall not be used together in built-up roof construction.
unique_id: Coal-tar products and asphalt products shall not be used together in built-up roof construction.Coal-Tar and Asphalt Products

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For walls other than those described in Sentence 9.20.1.1.(1), or where the masonry walls or insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground are designed for specified loads on the basis of ultimate and serviceability limit states, Subsection 4.3.2. shall apply. (See Note A-9.20.1.2.)
unique_id: For walls other than those described in Sentence 9.20.1.1.(1), or where the masonry walls or insulating concrete form walls not in contact with the ground are designed for specified loads on the basis of ultimate and serviceability limit states, Subsection 4.3.2. shall apply. (See Note A-9.20.1.2.)General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC equipment and components shall comply with the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.3.10. (See Note A-9.36.3.10.(1).)
unique_id: HVAC equipment and components shall comply with the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.3.10. (See Note A-9.36.3.10.(1).)Equipment Efficiency

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives or specifically designed with a fire stop. (See Note A-3.1.9.)
unique_id: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the fire stop requirements of Sentence 9.10.9.6.(1), provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives or specifically designed with a fire stop. (See Note A-3.1.9.)Penetration of Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements of Article 3.2.3.14. shall apply to the external walls of 2 buildings that meet at a firewall at an angle less than 135°.
unique_id: The requirements of Article 3.2.3.14. shall apply to the external walls of 2 buildings that meet at a firewall at an angle less than 135°.Exposure Protection for Adjacent Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and Subsection 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around window frames.)
unique_id: Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and Subsection 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around window frames.)Flashing and Caulking

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the beam referred to in Sentence 9.15.5.2. is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.
unique_id: Where the beam referred to in Sentence 9.15.5.2. is supported below the top of the foundation walls, the ends of such beams shall be protected from the weather.Support of Beams

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.
unique_id: In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.Termite and Decay Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The clear height over stairs that are located under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall not be less than 1 850 mm. (See Notes A-9.8.3.1.and A-9.8.4.)
unique_id: The clear height over stairs that are located under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall not be less than 1 850 mm. (See Notes A-9.8.3.1.and A-9.8.4.)Height over Stairs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(8)and 9.20.9.4.(9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.
unique_id: Except as required in Sentences 9.20.9.4.(8)and 9.20.9.4.(9), where the inner and outer wythes of cavity walls are tied with individual wire ties, the ties shall be spaced not more than 900 mm apart horizontally and 400 mm apart vertically.Tying

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2.
unique_id: Combustible outlet boxes are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3), provided the opening through the membrane into the box does not exceed 160 cm2.Penetration of Fire Separations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.79. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.79. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.Group F, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered

ARTICLE_TITLE: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.9.1.(2)and 9.9.9.1.(3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.9.1.(2)and 9.9.9.1.(3), every dwelling unit containing more than 1 storey shall have exits or egress doors located so that it shall not be necessary to travel up or down more than 1 storey to reach a level served by an egress door to a public corridor, enclosed exit stair or exterior passageway, or an exit doorway not more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.13.6.(3), required interior braced wall panels shall be sheathed or finished on both sides with a wood-based material, or finished on both sides with gypsum board.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.13.6.(3), required interior braced wall panels shall be sheathed or finished on both sides with a wood-based material, or finished on both sides with gypsum board.Materials in Braced Wall Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3. shall consist of at least Type S smooth roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.
unique_id: The bottom layer of roofing required in Sentence 9.26.4.3. shall consist of at least Type S smooth roll roofing or Type M mineral surface roll roofing (mineral surface not less than 457 mm wide, centred in the valley and fastened with nails spaced not more than 450 mm o.c. located 25 mm away from the edges.Valley Flashing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences 9.10.17.1.(1)and 9.10.17.1.(2).
unique_id: Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences 9.10.17.1.(1)and 9.10.17.1.(2).Flame-Spread Rating of Interior Surfaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.
unique_id: Where climatic conditions permit, buildings containing occupancies other than residential occupancies may be ventilated by natural ventilation methods in lieu of mechanical ventilation where engineering data demonstrates that such a method will provide the required ventilation for the type of occupancy.Natural Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.
unique_id: A subsurface investigation shall be carried out to the depth and extent to which the building or excavation will significantly change the stress in the soil or rock, or to such a depth and extent as to provide all the necessary information for the design and construction of the excavation or the foundations.Subsurface Investigation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a heat-recovery ventilator is installed in the reference house, the energy model calculations shall only account for the recovery of sensible heat using the efficiency ratings in Sentence 9.36.3.9.(3). (See Note A-9.36.5.15.(8).)
unique_id: Where a heat-recovery ventilator is installed in the reference house, the energy model calculations shall only account for the recovery of sensible heat using the efficiency ratings in Sentence 9.36.3.9.(3). (See Note A-9.36.5.15.(8).)Modeling HVAC System of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A single top plate is permitted to be used in a section of a loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the top plate forms a tie across the lintel.
unique_id: A single top plate is permitted to be used in a section of a loadbearing wall containing a lintel provided the top plate forms a tie across the lintel.Top Plates

ARTICLE_TITLE: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5. and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5. and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1. shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.
unique_id: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1. shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.Corbelling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.
unique_id: Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.Hold-Open Devices

ARTICLE_TITLE: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.
unique_id: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where instructions are necessary to describe the maintenance and care required for smoke alarms to ensure continuing satisfactory performance, they shall be posted in a location where they will be readily available to the occupants for reference.
unique_id: Where instructions are necessary to describe the maintenance and care required for smoke alarms to ensure continuing satisfactory performance, they shall be posted in a location where they will be readily available to the occupants for reference.Instructions for Maintenance and Care

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4. is not connected to an outdoor air supply fan, it shall be connected downstream of all return branch connections.
unique_id: Where the outdoor air supply duct required by Sentence 9.32.3.4. is not connected to an outdoor air supply fan, it shall be connected downstream of all return branch connections.Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing for built-up roofs shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.
unique_id: Flashing for built-up roofs shall conform to Subsection 9.26.4.Flashing

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Separations for Horizontal Service Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., a horizontal service space that penetrates a required vertical fire separation shall be separated from the remainder of the building it serves in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2.(2).
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 3.6.3.5., a horizontal service space that penetrates a required vertical fire separation shall be separated from the remainder of the building it serves in conformance with Sentence 3.6.4.2.(2).Fire Separations for Horizontal Service Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustiblestage flooring supported on noncombustible structural members is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Combustiblestage flooring supported on noncombustible structural members is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.Combustible Flooring Elements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.
unique_id: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.Basements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aggregate used for surfacing built-up roofs shall be clean, dry and durable and shall consist of particles of gravel, crushed stone or air-cooled blast furnace slag having a size of from 6 mm to 15 mm.
unique_id: Aggregate used for surfacing built-up roofs shall be clean, dry and durable and shall consist of particles of gravel, crushed stone or air-cooled blast furnace slag having a size of from 6 mm to 15 mm.Aggregate Surfacing

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.61. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 14 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 7 200 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, or 4 800 m2 if 3 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.61. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 14 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 7 200 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, or 4 800 m2 if 3 storeys in building height.Group D, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered

ARTICLE_TITLE: External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For sawtooth roofs, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6. for roofs with a slope less than or equal to 10°, and Figure 4.1.7.6. for roofs with a slope greater than 10°.
unique_id: For sawtooth roofs, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6. for roofs with a slope less than or equal to 10°, and Figure 4.1.7.6. for roofs with a slope greater than 10°.External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A contained use area shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
unique_id: A contained use area shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.Contained Use Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.
unique_id: If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.Door Swing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.
unique_id: Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.Ventilation of Unheated Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The use of materials or assemblies having a greater fire-resistance rating than required shall impose no obligation to exceed in whole or in part the minimum fire-resistance ratings required by this Part.
unique_id: The use of materials or assemblies having a greater fire-resistance rating than required shall impose no obligation to exceed in whole or in part the minimum fire-resistance ratings required by this Part.Minimum Fire-Resistance Rating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.
unique_id: A walkway between buildings shall be not more than 9 m wide.Walkway between Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
unique_id: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..Defined Words

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.
unique_id: Central vacuum cleaning systems serving more than one suite or storey in buildings equipped with a fire alarm system shall be designed to shut down upon activation of the fire alarm system.Central Vacuum Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.9.and 9.10. shall also apply.
unique_id: Where a stair, ramp or landing forms part of an exit, the appropriate requirements in Sections 9.9.and 9.10. shall also apply.Exit Stairs, Ramps and Landings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads. (See Note A-9.8.4.6.)
unique_id: Where tapered treads are located at the bottom of a mixed-tread flight, the run of the tapered treads when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail is permitted to exceed the run of the rectangular treads. ARTICLE_TITLE: Group E, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.67. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a fire separation shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the fire separation.
unique_id: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.67. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting a fire separation shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the fire separation.Group E, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sentence 3.3.1.25. shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.
unique_id: Sentence 3.3.1.25. shall not apply to industrial occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.Welding and Cutting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.6.(3), where an exhaust-only system is installed, the principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3. shall be wired in such a way that, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the circulation fan of the forced air distribution system required by Clause 9.32.3.6.(1) at its rated capacity.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.32.3.6.(3), where an exhaust-only system is installed, the principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3. shall be wired in such a way that, where applicable, activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the circulation fan of the forced air distribution system required by Clause 9.32.3.6.(1) at its rated capacity.Exhaust-Only Ventilation Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building and its structural components shall be designed to have sufficient strength and stability so that the factored resistance,  R, is greater than or equal to the effect of factored loads, which shall be determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.3.2.(2).
unique_id: A building and its structural components shall be designed to have sufficient strength and stability so that the factored resistance,  R, is greater than or equal to the effect of factored loads, which shall be determined in accordance with Sentence 4.1.3.2.(2).Strength and Stability

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations, and where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(1).)
unique_id: Audible signal devices forming part of a fire alarm system shall be installed in a building so that alarm signals are clearly audible throughout the floor area, and alert signals are clearly audible in continuously staffed locations, and where there are no continuously staffed locations, throughout the floor area. FRAG_DOCUMENT: Materials referred to in Sentence 9.36.2.10. shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and free of holes and cracks. (See Note A-9.36.2.10.(5)(b).)
unique_id: Materials referred to in Sentence 9.36.2.10. shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and free of holes and cracks. (See Note A-9.36.2.10.(5)(b).)Construction of Air Barrier Details

ARTICLE_TITLE: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Crane runway structures shall be designed to resist a horizontal force applied normal to the top of the rails equal to not less than 20% of the sum of the weights of the lifted load and the crane trolley (excluding other parts of the crane).
unique_id: Crane runway structures shall be designed to resist a horizontal force applied normal to the top of the rails equal to not less than 20% of the sum of the weights of the lifted load and the crane trolley (excluding other parts of the crane).Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment

unique_id: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..Defined Terms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.Support of Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness provided the staples are not less than 29 mm long with a shank diameter of 1.19 mm and with 4.7 mm crowns.
unique_id: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness provided the staples are not less than 29 mm long with a shank diameter of 1.19 mm and with 4.7 mm crowns.Staples

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.
unique_id: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.Clearance to the Fireplace Opening

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S107-10 Fire Tests of Roof Coverings
unique_id: A roof covering classification shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S107-10 Fire Tests of Roof CoveringsRoof Covering Classification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4. that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4. do not apply.
unique_id: In the case of a soffit described in Sentence 9.10.12.4. that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in Sentence 9.10.12.4. do not apply.Protection of Soffits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction is permitted to be of heavy timber construction provided not less than 50% of the area of any enclosing perimeter walls is open to the outdoors, and the walkway is at ground level.
unique_id: A walkway connected to a building required to be of noncombustible construction is permitted to be of heavy timber construction provided not less than 50% of the area of any enclosing perimeter walls is open to the outdoors, and the walkway is at ground level.Walkway between Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5. shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2.
unique_id: Individual panes of glass described in Sentence 9.10.13.5. shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2.Wired Glass as a Closure

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification of a material or assembly shall be determined on the basis of not less than three tests conducted in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies if the material or assembly is designed for use in a relatively horizontal position with only its top surface exposed to air, cannot be tested in conformance with Sentence 3.1.12.1. without the use of supporting material that is not representative of the intended installation, or is thermoplastic.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance.
unique_id: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to a natural-gas- or propane-fired appliance.Chimney Flue Limitations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The internal gust effect factor, Cgi, shall be 2.0, except it is permitted to be calculated using the following equation for large structures enclosing a single large unpartitioned volume that does not have numerous overhead doors or openings: Cgi=1+11+V06950AwhereV0= internal volume, in m3, and A= total area of all exterior openings of the volume, in m2. (See Note A-4.1.7.3.(10).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.
unique_id: Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.Items under Part 3 Jurisdiction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service water heating systems that use solar thermal technology shall be installed in accordance with the NPC.
unique_id: Service water heating systems that use solar thermal technology shall be installed in accordance with the NPC.Solar Thermal Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall meet the requirements of the appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal legislation or, in the absence of such legislation, shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
unique_id: Electrical installations, including the service capacity of the installation and the number and distribution of circuits and receptacles, shall meet the requirements of the appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal legislation or, in the absence of such legislation, shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part IStandard for Electrical Installations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
unique_id: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.Elements of the Second Plane of Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.
unique_id: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.Protection of Interior Finish

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of water away from building assemblies, and the provision of means for drainage.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to the location of buildings, the grading of building sites, the directing of water away from building assemblies, and the provision of means for drainage.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
unique_id: The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and EquipmentApplicable Standard

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A firewall is permitted to be supported on the structural frame of a building of noncombustible construction provided the supporting frame has a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the firewall.
unique_id: A firewall is permitted to be supported on the structural frame of a building of noncombustible construction provided the supporting frame has a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the firewall.Prevention of Firewall Collapse

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.
unique_id: Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.Portable Fire Extinguishers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences 5.8.1.4.(1)to 5.8.1.4. have been determined based on the type of construction, the apparent sound reduction index shall then be determined in accordance with ISO 15712-1:2005 Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between Rooms
unique_id: Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences 5.8.1.4.(1)to 5.8.1.4. have been determined based on the type of construction, the apparent sound reduction index shall then be determined in accordance with ISO 15712-1:2005 Building Acoustics - Estimation of Acoustic Performance of Buildings From the Performance of Elements - Part 1: Airborne Sound Insulation Between RoomsDetailed Method for Calculating ASTC

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Hardboard shall be not less than 3 mm thick where applied over continuous backing, 6 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 9 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
unique_id: Hardboard shall be not less than 3 mm thick where applied over continuous backing, 6 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 9 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: To calculate the effect of heating and cooling consumption, the energy model calculations shall be performed using climatic data measured at time intervals no greater than one hour for one year (8 760 based on the average of at least 10 years of measured data collected at the weather station nearest to the region in which the proposed house is located. (See Note A-9.36.5.5.(1).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In occupancies other than dwelling units, plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains, and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to Subsection 3.7.2. (See also Section 3.8. regarding barrier-free plumbing facilities.)
unique_id: In occupancies other than dwelling units, plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains, and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to Subsection 3.7.2. (See also Section 3.8. regarding barrier-free plumbing facilities.)Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Light diffusers and lenses having flame-spread ratings that exceed those permitted for the ceiling finish, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.4.(1).
unique_id: Light diffusers and lenses having flame-spread ratings that exceed those permitted for the ceiling finish, shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.4.(1).Light Diffusers and Lenses

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
unique_id: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.1.1. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.Separation of Suites

unique_id: The fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.13. is not required if the book storage room is sprinklered.Libraries

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In basements or crawl spaces where the perimeter foundation walls extend from the footings to the underside of the supported floor, braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels shall be spaced not more than 15 m from the perimeter foundation walls, 15 m from interior foundation walls, and 15 m from adjacent braced wall bands constructed with braced wall panels. (See Note A-9.23.13.5.(2).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The hatch required in Sentence 9.19.2.1. shall be not less than 550 mm by 900 mm except that, where the hatch serves not more than one dwelling unit, the hatch may be reduced to 0.32 m2 in area with no dimension less than 500 mm.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)
unique_id: Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)Limits to Smoke Movement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-Aand 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)
unique_id: Materials listed in Tables 9.26.2.1.-Aand 9.26.2.1.-B shall be installed in conformance with the manufacturer’s written instructions. (See Sentence 1.5.1.2.(1).)Installation of Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.2.(2), steel columns shall be fitted with not less than 100 mm by 100 mm by 6.35 mm thick steel plates at each end, and where the column supports a wooden beam, the top plate shall extend across the full width of the beam.End Bearing Plates

ARTICLE_TITLE: Access to Parking Areas and Exterior Passenger-Loading Zones
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exterior passenger-loading zones shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.
unique_id: Exterior passenger-loading zones shall comply with Subsection 3.8.3.Access to Parking Areas and Exterior Passenger-Loading Zones

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.
unique_id: A rooftop enclosure which is more than 200 m2 in area shall be provided with at least 2 means of egress.Means of Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the run shall comply with Table 9.8.4.2.
unique_id: Except for stairs serving areas only used as service rooms or service spaces, the run shall comply with Table 9.8.4.2.Dimensions for Rectangular Treads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5. shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.
unique_id: Except in the case of bleacher seats, the minimum clear width of aisles referred to in Sentence 3.3.2.5. shall be measured at the point farthest from an exit, cross aisle or foyer and shall be increased by 25 mm for each metre of distance toward the exit, cross aisle or foyer.Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A barrier-free path of travel is permitted to include ramps, passenger elevators or other platform-equipped passenger-elevating devices to overcome a difference in level.
unique_id: A barrier-free path of travel is permitted to include ramps, passenger elevators or other platform-equipped passenger-elevating devices to overcome a difference in level.Barrier-Free Path of Travel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or a means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.1.(2), where a building component or assembly will be subjected to an intended temperature differential, the component or assembly shall include materials to resist heat transfer or a means to dissipate transferred heat in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection.Required Resistance to Heat Transfer

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When floor drains are required (see Section 9.31.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.
unique_id: When floor drains are required (see Section 9.31.), the floor surface shall be sloped so that no water can accumulate.Floor Drains

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When work on a construction site is suspended or ceases so that it will not be occupied during normal working hours, the hazardous part of the construction site shall be protected by covering all windows, doors and other openings located within 3 m of the ground which may give access to the building with a securely fastened barricade, or a fence or barricade constructed according to the requirements of Article 8.2.1.3.
unique_id: When work on a construction site is suspended or ceases so that it will not be occupied during normal working hours, the hazardous part of the construction site shall be protected by covering all windows, doors and other openings located within 3 m of the ground which may give access to the building with a securely fastened barricade, or a fence or barricade constructed according to the requirements of Article 8.2.1.3.Work Shutdown

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to industrial occupancies.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to industrial occupancies.Scope

unique_id: Staples used with asphalt shingles shall be not less than 19 mm long, 1.6 mm diam or thickness, with not less than a 25 mm crown, except that an 11 mm crown may be used as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2).Staples

ARTICLE_TITLE: Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms and Contained
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a roof is intended for an occupant load of more than 60 persons, at least 2 separate means of egress shall be provided from the roof to stairs designed in conformance with the requirements for exit stairs and located remote from each other.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and no pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).
unique_id: Granular material used to drain the bottom of a foundation shall consist of a continuous layer of crushed stone or other coarse clean granular material containing not more than 10% of material that will pass a 4 mm sieve, and no pyritic material in a concentration that will damage the building to a degree that would adversely affect its stability or the performance of assemblies (see Note A-9.4.4.4.(1)).Type of Granular Material

unique_id: Buildings and their structural members made of cold-formed steel shall conform to CSA S136-16 North American Specification for the Design of Cold-Formed Steel Structural Members (using the Appendix B provisions applicable to (See Note A-4.3.4.2.(1).) unique_id: Mortar types shall be in accordance with Table 9.20.3.2.-A.Mortar and Grout Mixes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required by Subsection 3.6.3. for a shaft penetrating a roof assembly, a shaft, including an exit enclosure, that penetrates a fire separation, shall extend through any horizontal service space or any other concealed space, and terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where the shaft abuts on or intersects a floor, a roof slab, or a roof deck.
unique_id: Except as required by Subsection 3.6.3. for a shaft penetrating a roof assembly, a shaft, including an exit enclosure, that penetrates a fire separation, shall extend through any horizontal service space or any other concealed space, and terminate so that smoke-tight joints are provided where the shaft abuts on or intersects a floor, a roof slab, or a roof deck.Continuity of Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Openings through materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1)to 3.1.11.7. shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.
unique_id: Openings through materials referred to in Sentences 3.1.11.7.(1)to 3.1.11.7. shall be protected to maintain the integrity of the construction.Fire Block Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area of a wall or ceiling finish that is required by Sentence 3.1.13.2. to have a flame-spread rating less than 150 is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, except that up to 25% of the total wall area of lobbies described in Sentence 3.4.4.2. is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.
unique_id: Up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area of a wall or ceiling finish that is required by Sentence 3.1.13.2. to have a flame-spread rating less than 150 is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, except that up to 25% of the total wall area of lobbies described in Sentence 3.4.4.2. is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.Flame-Spread Rating

unique_id: Except where it can be shown to be unnecessary, the ingress of water into a crawl space shall be controlled by grading or drainage.Drainage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of 2 corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 200 mm or less in height, and installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 200 mm.
unique_id: Glass block shall have horizontal joint reinforcement of 2 corrosion-resistant bars of not less than 3.76 mm diam or expanded metal strips not less than 75 mm wide spaced at vertical intervals of not more than 600 mm for units 200 mm or less in height, and installed in every horizontal joint for units higher than 200 mm.Reinforcing for Glass Block

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.
unique_id: Maximum spacing of supports for gypsum board applied as a single layer shall conform to Table 9.29.5.3.Maximum Spacing of Supports

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimneyflues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry.
unique_id: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimneyflues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry.Support of Joists or Beams

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An exit shall not be used as a plenum for a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system.
unique_id: An exit shall not be used as a plenum for a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system.Integrity of Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(2).
unique_id: Only pipes or ducts necessary for fire protection or the proper operation of the electrical installation shall penetrate the fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7.(2).Electrical Equipment Vaults

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion thereof in which they are installed. (See Note A-3.2.4.19.(2).)
unique_id: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall be installed so that the signal from at least one device is visible throughout the floor area or portion thereof in which they are installed. (See Note A-3.2.4.19.(2).)Visual Signals

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.9.1.(2)and 3.1.9.1.(3), noncombustible outlet boxes that penetrate a vertical fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating need not conform to Sentence 3.1.9.4.(1), provided they do not exceed 0.016 m2 in area, and an aggregate area of 0.065 m2 in any 9.3 m2 of surface area, and the annular space between the membrane and the noncombustible electrical outlet boxes does not exceed 3 mm.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.9.1.(2)and 3.1.9.1.(3), noncombustible outlet boxes that penetrate a vertical fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating need not conform to Sentence 3.1.9.4.(1), provided they do not exceed 0.016 m2 in area, and an aggregate area of 0.065 m2 in any 9.3 m2 of surface area, and the annular space between the membrane and the noncombustible electrical outlet boxes does not exceed 3 mm.Penetration by Outlet Boxes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(5), fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(5), fire separations separating fire compartments required by Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.Compartments and Fire Separations

(see Note A-3.2.6.5.(6)(b)).
