FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tests referred to in Sentence 5.9.3.5. shall be carried out at the driving rain wind pressure as calculated in accordance with CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-5.9.3.5.(3).)
unique_id: Tests referred to in Sentence 5.9.3.5. shall be carried out at the driving rain wind pressure as calculated in accordance with CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (See Note A-5.9.3.5.(3).)Water Penetration

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.19.4.(2)and 9.10.19.4.(3), smoke alarms described in Sentence 9.10.19.1. shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.19.4.(2)and 9.10.19.4.(3), smoke alarms described in Sentence 9.10.19.1. shall be installed with permanent connections to an electrical circuit (see Note A-3.2.4.20.(7)(a)), have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the smoke alarm, and in case the regular power supply to the smoke alarm is interrupted, be provided with a battery as an alternative power source that can continue to provide power to the smoke alarm for a period of no less than 7 days in the normal condition, followed by 4 minutes of alarm.Power Supply

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.63. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.63. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.Group D, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The gross wall area and the area of fenestration and doors of the reference house shall be determined in accordance with Article 9.36.2.3.
unique_id: The gross wall area and the area of fenestration and doors of the reference house shall be determined in accordance with Article 9.36.2.3.Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.5.2.(2), where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of the probable assembly of persons, the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and the probable storage of materials.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.5.2.(2), where the use of an area of floor or roof is not provided for in Article 4.1.5.3., the specified live loads due to the use and occupancy of the area shall be determined from an analysis of the loads resulting from the weight of the probable assembly of persons, the probable accumulation of equipment and furnishings, and the probable storage of materials.Uses Not Stipulated

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service rooms containing incinerators shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
unique_id: Service rooms containing incinerators shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.Incinerators

ARTICLE_TITLE: Air Leakage Control in Underground Roofs
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Waterproofing systems for roofs of underground structures shall be sealed to the air barrier in the walls. (See Note A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6.)
unique_id: Waterproofing systems for roofs of underground structures shall be sealed to the air barrier in the walls. (See Note A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6.)Air Leakage Control in Underground Roofs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Nails shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.
unique_id: Nails shall be located not less than 10 mm from the side or edge of the board.Spacing of Nails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
unique_id: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.Hearth Extension

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.
unique_id: Every exit sign shall be visible on approach to the exit, consist of a green and white or lightly tinted graphical symbol meeting the colour specifications referred to in ISO 3864-1:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Part 1: Design principles for safety signs and safety markings and conform to ISO 7010:2011 Graphical symbols – Safety colours and safety signs – Registered safety signs for the following symbols (see Note A-3.4.5.1.(2)(c)): E001 emergency exit left, E002 emergency exit right, E005 90-degree directional arrow, and E006 45-degree directional arrow.Exit Signs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(3), in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.14.(3), in a building having elevators that serve storeys above the first storey and that are equipped with an automatic emergency recall feature, smoke detectors shall be installed in the elevator lobbies on the recall level so that when these smoke detectors are actuated, the elevators will automatically return directly to an alternate floor level.Elevator Emergency Return

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on both jambs of passenger elevator hoistway entrances in conformance with Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators
unique_id: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on both jambs of passenger elevator hoistway entrances in conformance with Appendix E of ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and EscalatorsFloor Numbering

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Earthquake forces shall be assumed to act horizontally and independently about any two orthogonal axes.
unique_id: Earthquake forces shall be assumed to act horizontally and independently about any two orthogonal axes.Analysis

ARTICLE_TITLE: Trade-off Options for Above-ground Building Envelope Components
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The effective thermal resistance of windows shall be determined using one of the following equations, as applicable: RSI = 1/U, where the U-value is known, or RSI = 20/(57-ER), where the energy rating is known.
unique_id: The effective thermal resistance of windows shall be determined using one of the following equations, as applicable: RSI = 1/U, where the U-value is known, or RSI = 20/(57-ER), where the energy rating is known.Trade-off Options for Above-ground Building Envelope Components

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
unique_id: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.Thickness

ARTICLE_TITLE: Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-B and Sentences 9.15.4.2.(5)to 9.15.4.2.(8), where the walls are laterally supported at the top, average stable soils are encountered, and wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.
unique_id: The thickness and reinforcing of foundation walls made of reinforced concrete block and subject to lateral earth pressure shall conform to Table 9.15.4.2.-B and Sentences 9.15.4.2.(5)to 9.15.4.2.(8), where the walls are laterally supported at the top, average stable soils are encountered, and wind loads on the exposed portion of the foundation are no greater than 0.70 kPa.Foundation Wall Thickness and Required Lateral Support

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated, it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.
unique_id: A fire alarm system shall be designed so that when an alarm signal is actuated, it cannot be silenced automatically before a period of time has elapsed that is not less than 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 20 min for any other building.Silencing of Alarm Signals

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall have sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to the intended use of the building, and the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected.
unique_id: Building materials, components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments or are exposed to the exterior shall have sufficient capacity and integrity to resist or accommodate all environmental loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected having regard to the intended use of the building, and the environment to which the materials, components and assemblies are subject, and all structural loads, and effects of those loads, that may reasonably be expected.Structural and Environmental Loads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a building or structural member can be expected to be subjected to loads, forces or other effects not listed in Article 4.1.2.1., such effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most appropriate information available. (See Note A-4.1.3.)
unique_id: Where a building or structural member can be expected to be subjected to loads, forces or other effects not listed in Article 4.1.2.1., such effects shall be taken into account in the design based on the most appropriate information available. (See Note A-4.1.3.)Loads Not Listed

FRAG_DOCUMENT: One handrail shall be provided on each side of stairs that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights of any width, and ramps.
unique_id: One handrail shall be provided on each side of stairs that are 1 100 mm or more in width, curved flights of any width, and ramps.Handrails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.
unique_id: An interconnected floor space in a Group B, Division 1 occupancy need not conform to the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. provided the interconnected floor space does not interconnect more than 2 adjacent storeys.Exceptions to Special Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)
unique_id: A mechanical exhaust system shall be provided to remove air from an interconnected floor space at a rate of 4 air changes per hour. (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.8.7.(1).)Mechanical Exhaust System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the only exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in that kitchen.
unique_id: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the only exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in that kitchen.Supplemental Exhaust

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
unique_id: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.Venting of Laundry-Drying Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A party wall shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
unique_id: A party wall shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)Party Wall

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for devices on doors serving a contained use area or an impeded egress zone designed to be remotely released in conformance with Article 3.3.1.13., and except as permitted by Sentences 3.4.6.16.(4)and 3.4.6.16. and Article 3.4.6.17., locking, latching and other fastening devices on a principal entrance door to a building as well as those on every exit door shall include release hardware complying with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1) to permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(1).)

(See Note A-3.4.6.16.(1).)Door Release Hardware

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3), a floor area described in Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall be divided into not less than 2 fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.3.5.(3), a floor area described in Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall be divided into not less than 2 fire compartments, each not more than 1 000 m2 in area.Compartments and Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8.(2)and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.8.8.(2)and 9.10.8.8.(3), the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.Floors of Exterior Passageways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b).
unique_id: Except as required in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b).Wiring and Cables

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17.and 3.2.5.18.
unique_id: Fire pumps shall be installed in conformance with Articles 3.2.5.17.and 3.2.5.18.Items under Part 3 Jurisdiction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access panels above the first storey shall be readily openable from both inside and outside, or the opening shall be glazed with plain glass.
unique_id: Access panels above the first storey shall be readily openable from both inside and outside, or the opening shall be glazed with plain glass.Access to Above-Grade Storeys

ARTICLE_TITLE: Freeze Protection of Fire Protection Systems
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.
unique_id: Equipment forming part of a fire protection system that may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures and that is located in an unheated area shall be protected from freezing.Freeze Protection of Fire Protection Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Laying Temperature of Mortar and Masonry
FRAG_DOCUMENT: No frozen material shall be used in mortar mix.
unique_id: No frozen material shall be used in mortar mix.Laying Temperature of Mortar and Masonry

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.
unique_id: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.Clearance from Combustible Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electromagnetic locks that do not incorporate latches, pins or other similar devices to keep the door in the closed position are permitted to be installed on doors, other than those leading directly from a high-hazard industrial occupancy, provided the building is equipped with a fire alarm system, the locking device releases upon actuation of the alarm signal from the building’s fire alarm system, the locking device releases immediately upon loss of power controlling the electromagnetic locking mechanism and its associated auxiliary controls, except for locking devices installed in conformance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(5), the locking device releases immediately upon actuation of a manually operated switch readily accessible only to authorized personnel, except as provided in Clause 3.4.6.16.(4)(k), a force of not more than 90 N applied to the door opening hardware initiates an irreversible process that will release the locking device within 15 s and not re-lock until the door has been opened, upon release, the locking device must be reset manually by the actuation of the switch referred to in Clause 3.4.6.16.(4)(d), a legible sign is permanently mounted on the door to indicate that the locking device will release within 15 s of applying pressure to the door-opening hardware, the total time delay for all electromagnetic locks in any path of egress to release is not more than 15 s, where a bypass switch is installed to allow testing of the fire alarm system, actuation of the switch can prevent the release of the locking device by the fire alarm system, as stated in Clause 3.4.6.16.(4)(b), during the test, and causes an audible and visual signal to be indicated at the fire alarm annunciator panel required by Article 3.2.4.9. and at the monitoring station specified in Sentence 3.2.4.8.(4), emergency lighting is provided at each door, and where they are installed on doors providing emergency crossover access to floor areas from exit stairs in accordance with Article 3.4.6.18., the locking device releases immediately upon the operation of a manual station for the fire alarm system located on the wall on the exit stair side not more than 600 mm from the door, and a legible sign with the words "re-entry door unlocked by fire alarm" written in letters at least 25 mm high with a stroke of at least 5 mm is permanently mounted on the door on the exit stair side. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(4).)

indicate that the locking device will release within 15 s of applying pressure to the door-opening hardware, the total time delay for all electromagnetic locks in any path of egress to release is not more than 15 s, where a bypass switch is installed to allow testing of the fire alarm system, actuation of the switch can prevent the release of the locking device by the fire alarm system, as stated in Clause 3.4.6.16.(4)(b), during the test, and causes an audible and visual signal to be indicated at the fire alarm annunciator panel required by Article 3.2.4.9. and at the monitoring station with Article 3.4.6.18., the locking device releases immediately upon the operation of a manual station for the fire alarm system located on the wall on the exit stair side not more than 600 mm from stair side. (See Note A-3.4.6.16.(4).)Door Release Hardware

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units conforming to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.
unique_id: Unit masonry columns shall be built of masonry units conforming to CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units and having a compressive strength over the net area of the block of not less than 15 MPa.Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.
unique_id: Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.Termite and Decay Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.
unique_id: The return-air system shall be designed to handle the entire air supply.Return-Air System

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.59. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
unique_id: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.59. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.Group D, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.
unique_id: Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in Article 9.10.8.1.Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A vapour barrier is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled vapour diffusion will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.)
unique_id: A vapour barrier is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled vapour diffusion will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.)Required Resistance to Vapour Diffusion

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The length of end bearing of joists and rafters shall be not less than 38 mm.
unique_id: The length of end bearing of joists and rafters shall be not less than 38 mm.End Bearing Length

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
unique_id: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.Storage Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.
unique_id: Where water, snow or ice can accumulate on a building, provision shall be made to minimize the likelihood of hazardous conditions arising from such accumulation.Accumulation and Disposal

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
unique_id: If a storey is sprinklered throughout, no fire-resistance rating is required for a fire separation between a public corridor and the remainder of the storey, provided the corridor does not serve a care, treatment or detention occupancy or a residential occupancy. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)Public Corridor Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.7.12.(2)and 4.1.7.12.(3), wind tunnel tests on scale models to determine wind loads on buildings shall be conducted in accordance with ASCE ASCE/SEI 49-12 Wind Tunnel Testing for Buildings and Other Structures
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.7.12.(2)and 4.1.7.12.(3), wind tunnel tests on scale models to determine wind loads on buildings shall be conducted in accordance with ASCE ASCE/SEI 49-12 Wind Tunnel Testing for Buildings and Other StructuresWind Tunnel Procedure

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Fenestration, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Skylights shall have an overall thermal transmittance not greater than the values listed in Table 9.36.2.7.-B for the applicable heating-degree day category. (See Note A-9.36.2.7. and .)
unique_id: Skylights shall have an overall thermal transmittance not greater than the values listed in Table 9.36.2.7.-B for the applicable heating-degree day category. (See Note A-9.36.2.7. and .)Thermal Characteristics of Fenestration, Doors and Skylights

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The thermal characteristics of materials shall be determined by calculation or by testing in accordance with the applicable product standards listed in the Code or, in the absence of such standards or where such standards do not address the determination of thermal resistance, in accordance with ASTM C 177-13 Steady-State Heat Flux Measurements and Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Guarded-Hot-Plate Apparatus or ASTM C 518-10 Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter Apparatus (See Table A-9.36.2.4.(1)-F for the thermal characteristics of commonly used materials.)
unique_id: The thermal characteristics of materials shall be determined by calculation or by testing in accordance with the applicable product standards listed in the Code or, in the absence of such standards or where such standards do not address the determination of thermal resistance, in accordance with ASTM C 177-13 Steady-State Heat Flux Measurements and Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Guarded-Hot-Plate Apparatus or ASTM C 518-10 Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter Apparatus (See Table A-9.36.2.4.(1)-F for the thermal characteristics of commonly used materials.)Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In applying Sentence 9.20.10.1.(2), the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or the thickness of the thicker wythe.
unique_id: In applying Sentence 9.20.10.1.(2), the thickness of cavity walls shall be taken as the greater of two-thirds of the sum of the thicknesses of the wythes, or the thickness of the thicker wythe.Lateral Support Required

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Excavations in streets or public property shall be adequately barricaded, and have warning signs or lights installed on each section of the barricades referred to in Clause 8.2.3.3.(1)(a).
unique_id: Excavations in streets or public property shall be adequately barricaded, and have warning signs or lights installed on each section of the barricades referred to in Clause 8.2.3.3.(1)(a).Barricades

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A balcony required by Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) shall have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.
unique_id: A balcony required by Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) shall have direct barrier-free access from the suite or floor area be not less than 1.5 m deep from the outside face of the exterior wall to the inside edge of the balcony, and provide not less than 1.5 m2 of balcony space for each non-ambulatory occupant and 0.5 m2 for each ambulatory occupant.Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
unique_id: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..Definitions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A passenger-elevating device referred to in Article 3.8.2.3. shall conform to CSA B355-09 Lifts for Persons with Physical Disabilities
unique_id: A passenger-elevating device referred to in Article 3.8.2.3. shall conform to CSA B355-09 Lifts for Persons with Physical DisabilitiesPassenger-Elevating Devices

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(11), for garages or accessory buildings that serve a single dwelling unit only and are detached from any building, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings shall comply with the requirements for unprotected openings.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.14.4.(11), for garages or accessory buildings that serve a single dwelling unit only and are detached from any building, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings shall comply with the requirements for unprotected openings.Openings in Exposing Building Face

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.7.3.1.(2)to 9.7.3.1.(4), windows, doors and skylights and their components separating conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist the ingress of precipitation into interior space (see Note A-9.7.4.2.(1)), resist wind loads, control air leakage, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, where required, resist forced entry, and are easily operable when not intended to be fixed.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6. where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.
unique_id: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6. where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.Face Sealed Cladding

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1)to 3.1.13.2.(3).
unique_id: The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences 3.1.13.2.(1)to 3.1.13.2.(3).Protection of Foamed Plastics

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required by Sentences 3.4.3.2.(5)and 3.4.3.2.(6), the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving 2 or more floor areas located one above the other.
unique_id: Except as required by Sentences 3.4.3.2.(5)and 3.4.3.2.(6), the required exit width need not be cumulative in an exit serving 2 or more floor areas located one above the other.Exit Width

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Capping required in Sentence 9.20.8.1. may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.
unique_id: Capping required in Sentence 9.20.8.1. may be omitted where the roof framing is supported on a wood plate not less than 38 mm by 89 mm.Capping of Hollow Masonry Walls

ARTICLE_TITLE: Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In exit and egress facilities referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(4), at least one door at each exit and egress location shall be operable in conformance with Sentence 3.4.6.16.(1), or be equipped with locks conforming to Sentence 3.4.6.16. that release immediately if an alert signal or alarm signal is initiated in the fire alarm system, or the sprinkler system is actuated.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 6.3.2.7.(3)and 6.3.2.10.(6), air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the building.

unique_id: Clear heights under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.85 m.Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces

ARTICLE_TITLE: Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for Dwelling
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8.
unique_id: Except as required in Article 3.3.4.8., stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within a dwelling unit shall conform to the appropriate requirements in Section 9.8.Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards for Dwelling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.
unique_id: Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.Required Installation of Granular Material

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Lumber roof sheathing shall be installed diagonally, where the seismic spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.70 but not greater than 1.2, or the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.80 kPa but less than 1.20 kPa.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and 7.5 mm thick when applied over furring or framing members not more than 400 mm o.c.
unique_id: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and 7.5 mm thick when applied over furring or framing members not more than 400 mm o.c.Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All obstructions on sidewalks, streets or other public property shall be removed when the need for such obstructions is ended.
unique_id: All obstructions on sidewalks, streets or other public property shall be removed when the need for such obstructions is ended.Restoration and Repair

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices to indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If Sentence 3.2.2.16. permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.
unique_id: If Sentence 3.2.2.16. permits a roof assembly to be of heavy timber construction, structural members in the storey immediately below the roof assembly are permitted to be of heavy timber construction.Heavy Timber Roof Permitted

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Insulation in factory-built buildings shall be installed so that it will not become dislodged during transportation.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the backing is not continuous.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.68. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Metal ties of the individual rod type shall extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall, be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and be staggered from course to course.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Article 3.1.8.19., the maximum area of glass block and wired glass panels not in a door, used in the locations shown in Table 3.1.8.17., shall conform to the Table.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3. that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.
unique_id: In doorways described in Sentence 9.9.6.3. that have multiple-leaf doors installed, no active leaf shall be less than 810 mm wide where only one leaf is active, and no single leaf shall be less than 610 mm wide where two leaves are active.Clear Opening Width at Doorways

ARTICLE_TITLE: Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required Landings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: No flight of stairs shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight of stairs serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.
unique_id: No flight of stairs shall have a vertical rise of more than 3.7 m between floors or landings, except that a flight of stairs serving as an exit in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy shall have a vertical rise not more than 2.4 m between floors or landings.Maximum Vertical Rise of Stair Flights and Required Landings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If any part of a return duct will be exposed to radiation from the furnace heat exchanger or other radiating part within the furnace, that part of a return duct directly above or within 600 mm of the outside furnace casing shall be noncombustible.
unique_id: If any part of a return duct will be exposed to radiation from the furnace heat exchanger or other radiating part within the furnace, that part of a return duct directly above or within 600 mm of the outside furnace casing shall be noncombustible.Return-Air System

ARTICLE_TITLE: Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.8.2.3.(2), a barrier-free path of travel from the entrances required by Sentences 3.8.2.2.(1)and 3.8.2.2. to be barrier-free shall be provided throughout the entrance storey and within all other normally occupied floor areas served by a passenger elevator, escalator, inclined moving walk, or other platform-equipped passenger-elevating device. (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.) (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.)
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.8.2.3.(2), a barrier-free path of travel from the entrances required by Sentences 3.8.2.2.(1)and 3.8.2.2. to be barrier-free shall be provided throughout the entrance storey and within all other normally occupied floor areas served by a passenger elevator, escalator, inclined moving walk, or other platform-equipped passenger-elevating device. (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.) (See Article 3.3.1.7. for additional requirements regarding floor areas above or below the first storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required.)Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In no case shall the minimum length of end bearing of beams supported on masonry be less than 90 mm.
unique_id: In no case shall the minimum length of end bearing of beams supported on masonry be less than 90 mm.Bearing of Beams and Joists

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5. provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.
unique_id: Passenger elevators are permitted to open onto the lobby referred to in Sentence 9.9.8.5. provided the elevator doors are designed to remain closed except while loading and unloading passengers.Exiting through a Lobby

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The exposure factor for internal pressures, Cei, shall be determined as follows: for buildings whose height is greater than 20 m and that have a dominant opening, Cei shall be equal to the exposure factor for external pressures, Ce, calculated at the mid-height of the dominant opening, and for other buildings, Cei shall be the same as the exposure factor for external pressures, Ce, calculated for a reference height, h, equal to the mid-height of the building or 6 m, whichever is greater.
unique_id: The exposure factor for internal pressures, Cei, shall be determined as follows: for buildings whose height is greater than 20 m and that have a dominant opening, Cei shall be equal to the exposure factor for external pressures, Ce, calculated at the mid-height of the dominant opening, and for other buildings, Cei shall be the same as the exposure factor for external pressures, Ce, calculated for a reference height, h, equal to the mid-height of the building or 6 m, whichever is greater.Static Procedure

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the exterior walls of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry or concrete not less than 25 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 10 min (see Note A-3.1.5.14.(5)(d)) (see also Article 3.2.3.7.).
unique_id: Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the exterior walls of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry or concrete not less than 25 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S101-14 Fire Endurance Tests of Building Construction and Materials does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 10 min (see Note A-3.1.5.14.(5)(d)) (see also Article 3.2.3.7.).Foamed Plastic Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All form ties shall be removed at least flush with the concrete surface.
unique_id: All form ties shall be removed at least flush with the concrete surface.Form Ties

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The effective thermal resistance and overall thermal transmittance values, as applicable, used in the energy model calculations for the reference house shall be determined for the applicable heating degree-day zone in accordance with Table 9.36.2.6.-A for walls, ceilings below attics, roof assemblies and rim joists, Table 9.36.2.7.-A for doors, and Table 9.36.2.8.-A for below-grade walls and slabs-on-ground.
unique_id: The effective thermal resistance and overall thermal transmittance values, as applicable, used in the energy model calculations for the reference house shall be determined for the applicable heating degree-day zone in accordance with Table 9.36.2.6.-A for walls, ceilings below attics, roof assemblies and rim joists, Table 9.36.2.7.-A for doors, and Table 9.36.2.8.-A for below-grade walls and slabs-on-ground.Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The heating system and, where installed, the cooling system shall be sized in accordance with Article 9.33.5.1. with regard to total heat output capacity and nominal cooling capacity. (See Note A-9.36.5.15.(5).)
unique_id: The heating system and, where installed, the cooling system shall be sized in accordance with Article 9.33.5.1. with regard to total heat output capacity and nominal cooling capacity. (See Note A-9.36.5.15.(5).)Modeling HVAC System of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.Built-up Wood Beams

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a party wall meets the plane of airtightness, that junction shall be constructed airtight by sealing any voids within the party wall at the perimeter to the adjacent air barrier material and by sealing all junctions between the structural components, or covering the structural components with an air barrier material and sealing it to the adjacent air barrier material.
unique_id: Where a party wall meets the plane of airtightness, that junction shall be constructed airtight by sealing any voids within the party wall at the perimeter to the adjacent air barrier material and by sealing all junctions between the structural components, or covering the structural components with an air barrier material and sealing it to the adjacent air barrier material.Construction of Air Barrier Details

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If heavy timber construction is permitted, it shall conform to Article 3.1.4.7.
unique_id: If heavy timber construction is permitted, it shall conform to Article 3.1.4.7.Heavy Timber Construction Alternative

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
unique_id: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separations referred to in Clause 3.3.1.7.(1) is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group C, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group C is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.50.(2), provided it is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and it has a building area not more than 9 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 4 500 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 3 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, 2 250 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, 1 800 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or 1 500 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group C is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.50.(2), provided it is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and it has a building area not more than 9 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 4 500 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 3 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, 2 250 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, 1 800 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or 1 500 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.Group C, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that will cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable, may corrode or deteriorate by reason of contact with the ammonium nitrate, or will become impregnated with the ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.3.6.6.(6).)
unique_id: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that will cause the ammonium nitrate to become unstable, may corrode or deteriorate by reason of contact with the ammonium nitrate, or will become impregnated with the ammonium nitrate. (See Note A-3.3.6.6.(6).)Ammonium Nitrate Storage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The outer covering of ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems used within an assembly of combustible construction are permitted to have an exposed surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, and a smoke developed classification greater than 50.
unique_id: The outer covering of ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems used within an assembly of combustible construction are permitted to have an exposed surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, and a smoke developed classification greater than 50.Coverings, Linings, Adhesives and Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
unique_id: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and FireplacesCombustion Air

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.
unique_id: Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.Exhaust Ducts and Outlets

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height and clear height are not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. or Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2)or 9.5.3.1. shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.
unique_id: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height and clear height are not less than the minimum specified in Table 9.5.3.1. or Sentence 9.5.3.1.(2)or 9.5.3.1. shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.
unique_id: Flanking wall and ceiling assemblies connected to a separating wall assembly shall be constructed with concrete or concrete block having a mass per area greater than 300 kg/m2, or gypsum board finish that is supported on wood or steel framing, and ends or is interrupted where it meets the structure of the separating wall assembly or, for double-stud walls, where it meets the space between the two lines of studs.Adjoining Constructions

ARTICLE_TITLE: Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Travel distance to an exit referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17. shall not exceed the travel distance determined in accordance with Subsection 3.4.2.
unique_id: Travel distance to an exit referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17. shall not exceed the travel distance determined in accordance with Subsection 3.4.2.Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations for the reference house shall include the same features as those used for the proposed house with regard to the principal heating and cooling energy sources, which are gas, electricity, oil, propane, wood or a heat pump, the primary and secondary energy sources, which are gas, electricity, oil, propane, wood or a heat pump, and the ventilation rate (see Sentence 9.36.5.11.(6)).
unique_id: The energy model calculations for the reference house shall include the same features as those used for the proposed house with regard to the principal heating and cooling energy sources, which are gas, electricity, oil, propane, wood or a heat pump, the primary and secondary energy sources, which are gas, electricity, oil, propane, wood or a heat pump, and the ventilation rate (see Sentence 9.36.5.11.(6)).Modeling HVAC System of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The depth of a tapered treadshall be not less than its run at any point and not more than its run at any point plus 25 mm.
unique_id: The depth of a tapered treadshall be not less than its run at any point and not more than its run at any point plus 25 mm.Dimensions of Tapered Treads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.
unique_id: Where a door at the top of a stair within a dwelling unit swings away from the stair, no landing is required between the doorway and the stair.Required Landings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.
unique_id: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.Materials

ARTICLE_TITLE: Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The rough-in referred to in Clause 9.13.4.3.(1) shall include a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space, an inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2) and (b)(i)), and an outlet in the conditioned space that permits connection to depressurization equipment, is sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and is clearly labeled to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.
unique_id: The rough-in referred to in Clause 9.13.4.3.(1) shall include a gas-permeable layer installed in the space between the air barrier and the ground to allow the depressurization of that space, an inlet that allows for the effective depressurization of the gas-permeable layer (see Note A-9.13.4.3.(2) and (b)(i)), and an outlet in the conditioned space that permits connection to depressurization equipment, is sealed to maintain the integrity of the air barrier system, and is clearly labeled to indicate that it is intended only for the removal of radon from below the floor-on-ground.Providing for the Rough-in for a Subfloor Depressurization

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A concealed space in an exterior cornice, a mansard-style roof, a balcony or a canopy in which exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. at locations where the concealed space extends across the ends of required vertical fire separations, and so that the maximum dimension in the concealed space is not more than 20 m.
unique_id: A concealed space in an exterior cornice, a mansard-style roof, a balcony or a canopy in which exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. at locations where the concealed space extends across the ends of required vertical fire separations, and so that the maximum dimension in the concealed space is not more than 20 m.Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.10.(5), 64 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in a standpipe system.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.10.(5), 64 mm diam hose connections shall be installed in a standpipe system.Hose Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where lumber wall sheathing is required to provide bracing according to Article 9.23.10.2., it shall be applied with end joints staggered.
unique_id: Where lumber wall sheathing is required to provide bracing according to Article 9.23.10.2., it shall be applied with end joints staggered.Lumber Sheathing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.
unique_id: In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.Makeup Air

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
unique_id: Interior vertical fire separations required to have fire-resistance ratings shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.Fire Exposure

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
FRAG_DOCUMENT: All connections between the ventilation system and the heating system shall be in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1.and 9.33.5.2. (See Note A-9.32.3.5.)
unique_id: All connections between the ventilation system and the heating system shall be in accordance with Articles 9.33.4.1.and 9.33.5.2. (See Note A-9.32.3.5.)Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.6.3.(2), nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.6.3.(2), nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.Nails and Staples

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible materials are permitted in systems described in Clause 6.3.4.4.(1) if such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the dangerous goods being used, and their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.
unique_id: Combustible materials are permitted in systems described in Clause 6.3.4.4.(1) if such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the dangerous goods being used, and their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.Enclosure Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every seismically isolated structure and every portion thereof shall be analyzed and designed in accordance with the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.19.(2))
unique_id: Every seismically isolated structure and every portion thereof shall be analyzed and designed in accordance with the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice. (See Note A-4.1.8.19.(2))Seismic Isolation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Waterproofing materials, components, assemblies and systems described in Article 5.7.2.1. shall comply with Article 5.7.3.2.
unique_id: Waterproofing materials, components, assemblies and systems described in Article 5.7.2.1. shall comply with Article 5.7.3.2.Required Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.
unique_id: Coverage shall be not less than 2 thicknesses of shingle over the entire roof, disregarding cutouts.Coverage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Section is concerned with the barrier-free design of buildings.
unique_id: This Section is concerned with the barrier-free design of buildings.Scope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.
unique_id: Mortar, grout, mortar joints, corbelling and protection for unit masonry shall conform to Section 9.20.Unit Masonry Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.4.1.(5), in areas of a building where partitions, other than permanent partitions, are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.4.1.(5), in areas of a building where partitions, other than permanent partitions, are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.Dead Loads

ARTICLE_TITLE: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Strapping described in Sentence 9.23.9.4. and Clause 9.23.9.4.(3) is not required where furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., Subsection 9.29.6., Subsection 9.29.7., Subsection 9.29.8., or Subsection 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.
unique_id: Strapping described in Sentence 9.23.9.4. and Clause 9.23.9.4.(3) is not required where furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., Subsection 9.29.6., Subsection 9.29.7., Subsection 9.29.8., or Subsection 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar or mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.
unique_id: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of high temperature cement mortar conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-10.3-92 Air Setting Refractory Mortar or mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.Mortar for Chimney Liners

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2. shall have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and be sealed and evenly weighted down, or be covered with concrete not less than 50 mm thick.
unique_id: The ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2. shall have its joints lapped not less than 300 mm, and be sealed and evenly weighted down, or be covered with concrete not less than 50 mm thick.Ground Cover in Heated Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).) (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).)
unique_id: Where a foundation is insulated in a manner that will reduce heat flow to the soil beneath the footings, the foundation depth shall conform to that required for foundations containing no heated space. (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).) (See Note A-9.12.2.2.(2).)Minimum Depth of Foundations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible ducts that are part of a duct system carrying only ventilation air and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).
unique_id: Combustible ducts that are part of a duct system carrying only ventilation air and that are contained entirely within a dwelling unit need not comply with the requirements of Sentences 9.33.6.2.(1)to 9.33.6.2.(4).Materials in Air Duct Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Part, the term "storage tank" shall mean a vessel for flammable liquids or combustible liquids having a capacity of more than 230 L and designed to be installed in a fixed location.
unique_id: For the purposes of this Part, the term "storage tank" shall mean a vessel for flammable liquids or combustible liquids having a capacity of more than 230 L and designed to be installed in a fixed location.Use of Term Storage Tank

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.5.9.(5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates. (See Article 9.23.10.2. and Section 9.10.)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.5.9.(5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates. (See Article 9.23.10.2. and Section 9.10.)Spacing of Screws

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wood strip flooring shall not be laid parallel to lumber subflooring unless a separate underlay is provided.
unique_id: Wood strip flooring shall not be laid parallel to lumber subflooring unless a separate underlay is provided.Strip Direction and End Joints

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a heat-recovery ventilator is installed in the proposed house, the energy model calculations shall only account for the recovery of sensible heat using the efficiency ratings in Sentence 9.36.3.9.(3). (See Note A-9.36.5.11.(10).)
unique_id: Where a heat-recovery ventilator is installed in the proposed house, the energy model calculations shall only account for the recovery of sensible heat using the efficiency ratings in Sentence 9.36.3.9.(3). (See Note A-9.36.5.11.(10).)Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House

ARTICLE_TITLE: Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.
unique_id: Where the specified live load exceeds 2.4 kPa, footings shall be designed in accordance with Section 4.2.Application of Footing Width and Area Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.
unique_id: Where the longest horizontal dimension of the roof projection, l0, is less than 3 m, the drift surcharge adjacent to the projection need not be considered.Areas Adjacent to Roof Projections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5.
unique_id: Where the intended use of the interior space will result in high moisture generation, the assembly shall be designed according to Part 5.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The number of water closets required in a suite of mercantile occupancy whose area is not more than 500 m2 is permitted to be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.2.2.-B based solely on the total number of staff.
unique_id: The number of water closets required in a suite of mercantile occupancy whose area is not more than 500 m2 is permitted to be determined in accordance with Table 3.7.2.2.-B based solely on the total number of staff.Water Closets

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.79. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 4 500 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 1 800 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.79. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 4 500 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 1 800 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.Group F, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Hose connections shall be provided with sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.
unique_id: Hose connections shall be provided with sufficient clearance to permit the use of a standard fire department hose key.Hose Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.
unique_id: Wood shingles shall be not less than 400 mm long and not less than 75 mm or more than 350 mm wide.Size

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.15.(2), 9.10.9.15.(3)and 9.10.9.15.(4), public corridors shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.15.(2), 9.10.9.15.(3)and 9.10.9.15.(4), public corridors shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating.Separation of Public Corridors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms and intensive care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.
unique_id: Compartments containing rooms such as operating rooms, recovery rooms, delivery rooms and intensive care units, from which it is impracticable to move patients in an emergency, shall be separated from adjacent spaces by fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and provided with a mechanical air supply so that during a period of 2 h after the start of a fire in another space, the compartments will not contain more than 1% by volume of contaminated air from the fire area.Areas of Refuge

ARTICLE_TITLE: Adjustments to Footing Widths for Interior Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The minimum strip footing widths for interior loadbearing masonry walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 100 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the footing.
unique_id: The minimum strip footing widths for interior loadbearing masonry walls shown in Table 9.15.3.4. shall be increased by 100 mm for each storey of masonry construction supported by the footing.Adjustments to Footing Widths for Interior Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Part applies to the design, construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.
unique_id: This Part applies to the design, construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.Application

ARTICLE_TITLE: Conformance with Regulations or National Plumbing Code
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every plumbing system shall be designed and installed in conformance with appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NPC.
unique_id: Every plumbing system shall be designed and installed in conformance with appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NPC.Conformance with Regulations or National Plumbing Code

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a step is used at the entry to a row of seats from a stepped aisle, an unobstructed platform not less than 800 mm square shall be provided adjacent to the aisle.
unique_id: If a step is used at the entry to a row of seats from a stepped aisle, an unobstructed platform not less than 800 mm square shall be provided adjacent to the aisle.Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings connected by an underground walkway shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
unique_id: Buildings connected by an underground walkway shall be separated from the walkway by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.Underground Walkway

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)
unique_id: This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings and their structural members made of structural steel shall conform to CSA S16-14 Design of Steel Structures (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).) (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).)
unique_id: Buildings and their structural members made of structural steel shall conform to CSA S16-14 Design of Steel Structures (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).) (See Note A-4.3.4.1.(1).)Design Basis for Structural Steel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2. and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.7.2. and Article 9.20.7.4., the depth of any chase or recess shall not exceed one third the thickness of the wall, and the width of the chase or recess shall not exceed 500 mm.Maximum Dimensions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the lintel spanning the opening is more than 3 m long, studs shall be tripled on each side of the opening so that the two inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.
