unique_id: Where the lintel spanning the opening is more than 3 m long, studs shall be tripled on each side of the opening so that the two inner studs on each side extend from the bottom of the supported lintel to the top of the bottom wall plate, and the outer stud on each side extends from the bottom of the top wall plate to the bottom wall plate.Studs at Sides of Openings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meanings stated herein: "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure; "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system; "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system; "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads; "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system; and "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.
unique_id: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.20., the following terms shall have the meanings stated herein: "seismic isolation" is an alternative seismic design concept that consists of installing an isolation system with low horizontal stiffness, thereby substantially increasing the fundamental period of the structure; "isolation system" is a collection of structural elements at the level of the isolation interface that includes all individual isolator units, all structural elements that transfer force between elements of the isolation system, all connections to other structural elements, and may also include a wind-restraint system, energy-dissipation devices, and a displacement restraint system; "seismically isolated structure" includes the upper portion of the structure above the isolation system, the isolation system, and the portion of the structure below the isolation system; "isolator unit" is a structural element of the isolation system that permits large lateral deformations under lateral earthquake design forces and is characterized by vertical-load-carrying capability combined with increased horizontal flexibility and high vertical stiffness, energy dissipation (hysteretic or viscous), self-centering capability, and lateral restraint (sufficient elastic under non-seismic service lateral loads; "isolation interface" is the boundary between the isolated upper portion of the structure above the isolation system and the lower portion of the structure below the isolation system; and "wind-restraint system" is the collection of structural elements of the isolation system that provides restraint of the seismically isolated structure for wind loads and is permitted to be either an integral part of the isolator units or a separate device.Seismic Isolation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that, where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets are permitted to be used.
unique_id: Ducts shall be securely supported by metal hangers, straps, lugs or brackets, except that, where zero clearance is permitted, wooden brackets are permitted to be used.Construction of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The weighted normalized flanking level difference shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms
unique_id: The weighted normalized flanking level difference shall be determined in accordance with ASTM E 413-10 Classification for Rating Sound Insulation using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining RoomsSimplified Method for Calculating ASTC

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Studs shall be doubled on each side of every opening where such openings involve more than one stud space, and shall be tripled where the openings in exterior walls exceed 2.4 m in width.
unique_id: Studs shall be doubled on each side of every opening where such openings involve more than one stud space, and shall be tripled where the openings in exterior walls exceed 2.4 m in width.Framing around Openings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.Combustible Glazing and Skylights

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The ventilation fan power consumption shall be modeled as being 2.32 W/L/s for each ventilation fan on the exhaust side and, where applicable, on the supply side, or as specified, where a heat-recovery ventilator is used.
unique_id: The ventilation fan power consumption shall be modeled as being 2.32 W/L/s for each ventilation fan on the exhaust side and, where applicable, on the supply side, or as specified, where a heat-recovery ventilator is used.Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The heat recovery ventilator and all condensate lines shall be installed in a space where the ambient temperature will not adversely affect the operation of the system.
unique_id: The heat recovery ventilator and all condensate lines shall be installed in a space where the ambient temperature will not adversely affect the operation of the system.Heat Recovery Ventilators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.
unique_id: In a building in which the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular Group or Division is not more than 10% of the floor area of the storey in which they are located, these major occupancies need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of this Subsection, provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies.Exceptions for Major Occupancies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The values of the site coefficient for design spectral acceleration at period T, F(T), and of similar coefficients F and F shall conform to Tables 4.1.8.4.-Bto 4.1.8.4.-I using linear interpolation for intermediate values of PGAref.
unique_id: The values of the site coefficient for design spectral acceleration at period T, F(T), and of similar coefficients F and F shall conform to Tables 4.1.8.4.-Bto 4.1.8.4.-I using linear interpolation for intermediate values of PGAref.Site Properties

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The lower portion of a mansard or gambrel style roof need not be ventilated.
unique_id: The lower portion of a mansard or gambrel style roof need not be ventilated.Mansard or Gambrel Roof

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fastening devices for flashing shall be corrosion-resistant and, where metal flashing is used, shall be compatible with the flashing with respect to galvanic action.
unique_id: Fastening devices for flashing shall be corrosion-resistant and, where metal flashing is used, shall be compatible with the flashing with respect to galvanic action.Fastening of Flashing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the requirements in CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights and CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights
unique_id: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the requirements in CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights and CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and SkylightsApplicable Standards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use (See Note A-9.27.11.1. and .)
unique_id: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-93.2-M91 Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use (See Note A-9.27.11.1. and .)Material Standards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to obstructions and hazards in every means of egress except those within a dwelling unit or serving not more than one dwelling unit.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), no exit from a floor area above or below the first storey shall lead through a lobby.Exits through Lobbies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service water heating systems that use solar thermal technology shall be installed in accordance with the NPC.
unique_id: Service water heating systems that use solar thermal technology shall be installed in accordance with the NPC.Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall continue to emit a visible signal while voice instructions are being transmitted.
unique_id: Visual signal devices required by Sentence 3.2.4.19. shall continue to emit a visible signal while voice instructions are being transmitted.Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1.and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.
unique_id: In a building containing more than one major occupancy, where the aggregate area of all major occupancies in a particular group or division does not exceed 10% of the floor area on the storey on which they are located, they need not be considered as major occupancies for the purposes of Articles 9.10.8.1.and 9.10.2.3. provided they are not classified as Group F, Division 2 occupancies.Buildings Containing More Than One Major Occupancy

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(b)or 9.4.1.1.(1)(c), and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(a), the maximum specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.
unique_id: Where floor framing is designed in accordance with Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(b)or 9.4.1.1.(1)(c), and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings, are designed according to Clause 9.4.1.1.(1)(a), the maximum specified live load on the floor according to Table 4.1.5.3. shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire-resistance rating of a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
unique_id: The fire-resistance rating of a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.Compartments and Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sprinklers shall be installed in a storage room provided for the use of tenants in a residential occupancy within a floor area but not contained within a suite.
unique_id: Sprinklers shall be installed in a storage room provided for the use of tenants in a residential occupancy within a floor area but not contained within a suite.Storage Rooms

ARTICLE_TITLE: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.
unique_id: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to Section 9.9.Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights

ARTICLE_TITLE: Insulating Sheathing in lieu of Sheathing Membrane
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.4.(1), sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, or lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Note A-9.27.3.4.(2).)
unique_id: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.4.(1), sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, or lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Note A-9.27.3.4.(2).)Insulating Sheathing in lieu of Sheathing Membrane

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.5.21. and Article 3.1.5.22., optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables the wires and cables are located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b), or the wires and cables are communication cables used at the service entry to a building and are not more than 3 m long. (See Note A-3.1.5.21.(1).)
unique_id: Except as required by Sentence 3.1.5.21. and Article 3.1.5.22., optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables the wires and cables are located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.23.(1)(b), or the wires and cables are communication cables used at the service entry to a building and are not more than 3 m long. (See Note A-3.1.5.21.(1).)Wires and Cables

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Eave protection is not required over unheated garages, carports and porches, where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.
unique_id: Eave protection is not required over unheated garages, carports and porches, where the roof overhang exceeds 900 mm measured along the roof slope from the edge of the roof to the inner face of the exterior wall, on roofs of asphalt shingles installed in accordance with Subsection 9.26.8., on roofs with slopes of 1 in 1.5 or greater, or in regions with 3 500 or fewer degree-days.Required Eave Protection

ARTICLE_TITLE: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.
unique_id: Evaporative cooling towers, evaporative fluid coolers and evaporative condensers shall be provided with access ports, service platforms, fixed ladders and restraint connections to allow visual inspection, maintenance and testing.Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 3, One Storey, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2.
unique_id: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 7 200 m2.Group A, Division 3, One Storey, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided and where adjacent spaces in the building are less than 50 mm above the garage floor, the garage floor shall be sloped to the outdoors, or where the garage can accommodate not more than 3 vehicles, an airtight curb or partition not less than 50 mm high shall be installed at the edges of the garage floor adjacent to interior space. (See Note A-9.35.2.2.(1).)
unique_id: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided and where adjacent spaces in the building are less than 50 mm above the garage floor, the garage floor shall be sloped to the outdoors, or where the garage can accommodate not more than 3 vehicles, an airtight curb or partition not less than 50 mm high shall be installed at the edges of the garage floor adjacent to interior space. (See Note A-9.35.2.2.(1).)Garage Floor

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.
unique_id: Slab and panel facings of precast concrete and natural or artificial stone shall conform to Subsection 4.3.2.Stone or Concrete Facings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When used with shingles, underlay shall be installed parallel to the eaves with head and end lap of not less than 50 mm.
unique_id: When used with shingles, underlay shall be installed parallel to the eaves with head and end lap of not less than 50 mm.Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to Subsection 3.4.7.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.
unique_id: Subject to the requirements of this Section, an exit from any floor area shall be one of the following, used singly or in combination: an exterior doorway, an exterior passageway, an exterior ramp, an exterior stairway, a fire escape (conforming to Subsection 3.4.7.), a horizontal exit, an interior passageway, an interior ramp, or an interior stairway.Types of Exit

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4. shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.
unique_id: Within 100 mm of the bottom of each floor or roof assembly where the cavity extends below the assemblies, the ties described in Sentence 9.20.9.4. shall be spaced not more than 600 mm apart horizontally.Tying

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
unique_id: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.Stairways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type
unique_id: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather TypeSheathing Membrane Material Standard

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stucco mixes shall conform to Table 9.28.5.1.
unique_id: Stucco mixes shall conform to Table 9.28.5.1.Mixes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.8.2.8.(2), a washroom in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required in accordance with Article 3.8.2.3., shall be barrier-free in accordance with Subsection 3.8.3. (See Note A-3.8.2.8. to .)
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.8.2.8.(2), a washroom in a storey to which a barrier-free path of travel is required in accordance with Article 3.8.2.3., shall be barrier-free in accordance with Subsection 3.8.3. (See Note A-3.8.2.8. to .)Plumbing Facilities

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Major structural penetrations, such as balcony and canopy slabs, beams, columns and ornamentation or appendages that must completely penetrate the building envelope to perform their intended function, need not be taken into account in the calculation of the effective thermal resistance of the penetrated assembly, provided the insulation is installed tight against the outline of the penetration, and the sum of the areas of all such major structural penetrations is limited to a maximum of 2% of the gross wall area calculated as described in Sentence 9.36.2.3.(2). (See Note A-9.36.2.4.(3).)
unique_id: Major structural penetrations, such as balcony and canopy slabs, beams, columns and ornamentation or appendages that must completely penetrate the building envelope to perform their intended function, need not be taken into account in the calculation of the effective thermal resistance of the penetrated assembly, provided the insulation is installed tight against the outline of the penetration, and the sum of the areas of all such major structural penetrations is limited to a maximum of 2% of the gross wall area calculated as described in Sentence 9.36.2.3.(2). (See Note A-9.36.2.4.(3).)Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In calculating the effective thermal resistance of assemblies for the purpose of comparison with the requirements of Articles 9.36.2.6. and 9.36.2.8., the thermal bridging effect of closely spaced, repetitive structural members, such as studs and joists, and of ancillary members, such as lintels, sills and plates, shall be accounted for. (See Note A-9.36.2.4.(1).)
unique_id: In calculating the effective thermal resistance of assemblies for the purpose of comparison with the requirements of Articles 9.36.2.6. and 9.36.2.8., the thermal bridging effect of closely spaced, repetitive structural members, such as studs and joists, and of ancillary members, such as lintels, sills and plates, shall be accounted for. (See Note A-9.36.2.4.(1).)Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Other fenestration assemblies using metal framing that separate interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.
unique_id: Other fenestration assemblies using metal framing that separate interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.Heat Transfer

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.Size of Wall Plates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a door is installed such that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.
unique_id: If a door is installed such that it could damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent the damage.Installation of Closures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements for flame-spread ratings contained in thermal insulation standards shall be applied only as required in Part 3.
unique_id: The requirements for flame-spread ratings contained in thermal insulation standards shall be applied only as required in Part 3.Compliance with Applicable Standards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.7.2.1.(2), if the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 3.7.2.1.(2), if the installation of a sanitary drainage system is not possible because of the absence of a water supply, sanitary privies, chemical closets or other means for the disposal of human waste shall be provided.Plumbing and Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and 9.27.13., or Part 5.
unique_id: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and 9.27.13., or Part 5.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided for in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(6)and 4.1.6.2.(7), the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 where the roof slope,  , is equal to or less than 30°, (70°    )/40° where   is greater than 30° but not greater than 70°, and 0 where   exceeds 70°.
unique_id: Except as provided for in Sentences 4.1.6.2.(6)and 4.1.6.2.(7), the slope factor, Cs, shall be 1.0 where the roof slope,  , is equal to or less than 30°, (70°    )/40° where   is greater than 30° but not greater than 70°, and 0 where   exceeds 70°.Specified Snow Load

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.13.(2), every door in a fire separation, other than doors to freight elevators and dumbwaiters, shall be equipped with a self-closing device designed to return the door to the closed position after each use.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.13.(2), every door in a fire separation, other than doors to freight elevators and dumbwaiters, shall be equipped with a self-closing device designed to return the door to the closed position after each use.Self-closing Devices

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ties referred to in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(2)and 9.23.11.4. shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.
unique_id: Ties referred to in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(2)and 9.23.11.4. shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.Joints in Top Plates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire escapes shall be of metal or concrete, of the stair type extending to ground level, constructed throughout in a strong substantial manner and securely fixed to the building, except that wooden fire escapes are permitted to be used on buildings of combustible construction if all posts and brackets are not less than 89 mm in their least dimension and all other woodwork is not less than 38 mm in its least dimension.
unique_id: Fire escapes shall be of metal or concrete, of the stair type extending to ground level, constructed throughout in a strong substantial manner and securely fixed to the building, except that wooden fire escapes are permitted to be used on buildings of combustible construction if all posts and brackets are not less than 89 mm in their least dimension and all other woodwork is not less than 38 mm in its least dimension.Fire Escape Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
unique_id: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.Curved Flights in Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings shall be equipped with plumbing facilities as required in Subsection 3.7.2. and Article 3.8.2.8.
unique_id: Buildings shall be equipped with plumbing facilities as required in Subsection 3.7.2. and Article 3.8.2.8.All Buildings Except Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where ducts penetrate fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building, they shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.
unique_id: Where ducts penetrate fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building, they shall be in accordance with Article 3.4.4.4.Ducts in Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.2.(2)to 9.8.6.2. and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.2.(2)to 9.8.6.2. and Sentence 9.9.6.6.(2), a landing shall be provided at the top and bottom of each flight of interior and exterior stairs, including stairs in garages, at the top and bottom of every ramp with a slope greater than 1 in 50, where a doorway opens onto a stair or ramp, where a ramp opens onto a stair, and where a stair opens onto a ramp.Required Landings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 3.8.3.18.(2), assistive listening systems required by Article 3.8.2.9. shall encompass the entire seating area.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 3.8.3.18.(2), assistive listening systems required by Article 3.8.2.9. shall encompass the entire seating area.Assistive Listening Devices

ARTICLE_TITLE: Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A sign with the words "This door shall not be locked at any time that the public is present" in letters not less than 50 mm high shall be permanently affixed to both sides of doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1).
unique_id: A sign with the words "This door shall not be locked at any time that the public is present" in letters not less than 50 mm high shall be permanently affixed to both sides of doors referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17.(1).Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of 100 mm, or the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.
unique_id: Footing thickness shall be not less than the greater of 100 mm, or the width of the projection of the footing beyond the supported element.Footing Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.
unique_id: Where the landing in a stairway or ramp does not turn or turns less than 90°, the length of the landing need not be more than the lesser of the required width of the stair or ramp, or 1 100 mm.Dimensions of Landings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Compliance with Clause 5.1.4.1.(1) shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.1. and construction conforming to that design.
unique_id: Compliance with Clause 5.1.4.1.(1) shall be demonstrated by design complying with Subsection 5.2.1. and construction conforming to that design.Structural and Environmental Loads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see Subsection 9.30.3.).
unique_id: Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see Subsection 9.30.3.).Subflooring Required

ARTICLE_TITLE: Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Floor joists and building frames supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.
unique_id: Floor joists and building frames supported on the top of flat insulating concrete form walls shall be anchored in conformance with Article 9.23.6.1.Framing Supported on Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(4), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.14.(4), dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)Separation of Residential Suites

ARTICLE_TITLE: Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet
FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Article applies where a hallway of not less than 860 mm wide serves one or more rooms containing a bathtub, shower or water closet.
unique_id: This Article applies where a hallway of not less than 860 mm wide serves one or more rooms containing a bathtub, shower or water closet.Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.5.21.(3)and 3.1.5.21.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.1.5.21.(3)and 3.1.5.21.(4), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).Wires and Cables

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each elevator for use by firefighters shall be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S104-15 Fire Tests of Door Assemblies be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
unique_id: Each elevator for use by firefighters shall be provided with a closure at each shaft opening so that the interlock mechanism remains mechanically engaged and electrical continuity is maintained in the interlock circuits and associated wiring for a period of not less than 1 h when the assembly is subjected to the standard fire exposure described in ULC CAN/ULC-S104-15 Fire Tests of Door Assemblies be protected with a vestibule containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the floor area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be protected with a corridor containing no occupancy and separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.Elevator for Use by Firefighters

ARTICLE_TITLE: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
unique_id: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every tent and air-supported structure and all tarpaulins and decorative materials used in connection with these structures shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and Films
unique_id: Every tent and air-supported structure and all tarpaulins and decorative materials used in connection with these structures shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S109-14 Flame Tests of Flame-Resistant Fabrics and FilmsFlame Resistance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.9.8.6.(2)and 9.9.8.6.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 9.9.8.6.(2)and 9.9.8.6.(3), the space above a mezzanine shall be served by means of egress leading to exits accessible at the mezzanine level, on the same basis as floor areas.Mezzanine Means of Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.20. and permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.
unique_id: Except as required by Sentence 3.2.4.20. and permitted by Sentence 3.2.4.20.(8), smoke alarms conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S531-14 Smoke Alarms shall be installed in each dwelling unit and, except for care, treatment or detention occupancies required to have a fire alarm system, in each sleeping room not within a dwelling unit or suite of care occupancy.Smoke Alarms

ARTICLE_TITLE: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The force described in Sentence 4.1.5.11. shall be equally distributed on each side of the runway and shall be assumed to act in either direction.
unique_id: The force described in Sentence 4.1.5.11. shall be equally distributed on each side of the runway and shall be assumed to act in either direction.Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.
unique_id: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.Minimum Protection from Precipitation Ingress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a piped water supply is available a hot water supply shall be provided in every dwelling unit.
unique_id: Where a piped water supply is available a hot water supply shall be provided in every dwelling unit.Hot Water Supply

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A wall handrail shall be installed if the fire escape is more than 550 mm wide.
unique_id: A wall handrail shall be installed if the fire escape is more than 550 mm wide.Guards and Railings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Protective guarding devices shall be provided where necessary to prevent damage to the mechanical components of doors in fire separations, and installed so as not to interfere with the proper operation of the doors.
unique_id: Protective guarding devices shall be provided where necessary to prevent damage to the mechanical components of doors in fire separations, and installed so as not to interfere with the proper operation of the doors.Installation of Closures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.
unique_id: Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.Compressive Strength

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Single storeydwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey immediately above, and immediately below. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)
unique_id: Single storeydwelling units in an apartment building need not lead to a public corridor or exterior passageway on the same storey provided the dwelling units are served by private stairways leading directly to a public access to exit on the storey immediately above, and immediately below. (See Note A-3.3.4.4.(1).)Egress from Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.3-07 Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.
unique_id: The flame-spread rating of combustible light diffusers and lenses in all occupancies other than Group A, Division 1 is permitted to be more than the flame-spread rating limits required elsewhere in this Subsection, provided the light diffusers and lenses have a flame-spread rating not more than 250 and a smoke developed classification not more than 600 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.2-10 Test for Surface Burning Characteristics of Flooring, Floor Coverings, and Miscellaneous Materials and Assemblies fall to the bottom of the test apparatus before igniting when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.3-07 Fire Test of Light Diffusers and Lenses are not prevented from falling from the ceiling by construction located beneath the elements, and are not used in a corridor that is required to be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation or in an exit shaft unless individual diffusers or lenses are not more than 1 m2 in area and are not less than 1.2 m apart.Light Diffusers and Lenses

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for a building containing one or 2 dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.
unique_id: Except for a building containing one or 2 dwelling units only, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread and are more than 1 m above ground level, including balconies, platforms, canopies and stairs, shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.Combustible Projections

ARTICLE_TITLE: Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be capable of providing supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following that period, emergency power under full load for not less than 2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building classified as a Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building. (See Note A-3.2.7.8.(3).)
unique_id: The emergency power supply required by Sentence 3.2.7.8. shall be capable of providing supervisory power for not less than 24 h, and immediately following that period, emergency power under full load for not less than 2 h for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building classified as a Group B major occupancy that is not within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6., 1 h for a building constructed in accordance with Article 3.2.2.50.or 3.2.2.58., 5 min for a building not required to be equipped with an annunciator, and 30 min for any other building. (See Note A-3.2.7.8.(3).)Emergency Power for Fire Alarm Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60, and in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.-B.
unique_id: A floor area in a building not more than 2 storeys in building height, is permitted to be served by one exit provided the total occupant load served by the exit is not more than 60, and in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout, the floor area and the travel distance are not more than the values in Table 3.4.2.1.-A, or in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout the travel distance is not more than 25 m, and the floor area is not more than the value in Table 3.4.2.1.-B.Minimum Number of Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where service water heating equipment or techniques other than those described in this Subsection are used, the building shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the energy efficiency requirements of the NECB.
unique_id: Where service water heating equipment or techniques other than those described in this Subsection are used, the building shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the energy efficiency requirements of the NECB.Scope and Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access ladders for chimneys, when provided, shall consist of steel or bronze rungs, built into the walls of the chimneys.
unique_id: Access ladders for chimneys, when provided, shall consist of steel or bronze rungs, built into the walls of the chimneys.Access Ladders

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation provided it is not located in a vertical service space.
unique_id: Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation provided it is not located in a vertical service space.Combustible Piping Penetrations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Post-disaster buildings shall not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 9 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6., have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.
unique_id: Post-disaster buildings shall not have any irregularities conforming to Types 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 9 as described in Table 4.1.8.6., in cases where IEFaSa(0.2) is equal to or greater than 0.35, not have a Type 6 irregularity as described in Table 4.1.8.6., have an SFRS with an Rd of 2.0 or greater, and have no storey with a lateral stiffness that is less than that of the storey above it.Additional System Restrictions

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where measured airtightness is used in the energy model calculations, it shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-149.10-M86 Determination of the Airtightness of Building Envelopes by the Fan Depressurization Method as written, or excluding Clause 6.1.6, which allows intentional openings for mechanical equipment to be left unsealed. (See Note A-9.36.5.10.(11).)
unique_id: Where measured airtightness is used in the energy model calculations, it shall be determined in accordance with CGSB CAN/CGSB-149.10-M86 Determination of the Airtightness of Building Envelopes by the Fan Depressurization Method as written, or excluding Clause 6.1.6, which allows intentional openings for mechanical equipment to be left unsealed. (See Note A-9.36.5.10.(11).)Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The clearance between a handrail and the surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or where said surface is rough or abrasive, 60 mm.
unique_id: The clearance between a handrail and the surface behind it shall be not less than 50 mm, or where said surface is rough or abrasive, 60 mm.Ergonomic Design

ARTICLE_TITLE: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.
unique_id: Solid blocking shall be provided on both sides at the lock height between the jambs for doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. and the structural framing so that the jambs will resist spreading by force.Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.6.(2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one half of the required number of exits from any floor area.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.1.6.(2), horizontal exits shall not comprise more than one half of the required number of exits from any floor area.Restricted Use of Horizontal Exits

ARTICLE_TITLE: Limiting Distance and Area of Unprotected Openings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The area of the unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be the aggregate area of unprotected openings expressed as a percentage of the area of the exposing building face in Table 3.2.3.1.-B, 3.2.3.1.-C, 3.2.3.1.-Dor 3.2.3.1.-E. (See Sentence 3.2.3.2.(1).)
unique_id: The area of the unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall be the aggregate area of unprotected openings expressed as a percentage of the area of the exposing building face in Table 3.2.3.1.-B, 3.2.3.1.-C, 3.2.3.1.-Dor 3.2.3.1.-E. (See Sentence 3.2.3.2.(1).)Limiting Distance and Area of Unprotected Openings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In an assembly occupancy, the number of spaces designated for wheelchair use within rooms or areas with fixed seats shall conform to Table 3.8.2.3. (See also Article 3.8.3.21. for additional requirements.)
unique_id: In an assembly occupancy, the number of spaces designated for wheelchair use within rooms or areas with fixed seats shall conform to Table 3.8.2.3. (See also Article 3.8.3.21. for additional requirements.)Areas Requiring a Barrier-Free Path of Travel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar base or applied with an adhesive.
unique_id: Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar base or applied with an adhesive.Tile Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a single universal washroom is provided in accordance with the requirements of Section 3.8., the total number of persons in the building used to determine the number of water closets to be provided, is permitted to be reduced by 10 before applying Sentence 3.7.2.2.(6), 3.7.2.2.(7), 3.7.2.2.(8), 3.7.2.2.(12), 3.7.2.2.(13)or 3.7.2.2.(14).
unique_id: If a single universal washroom is provided in accordance with the requirements of Section 3.8., the total number of persons in the building used to determine the number of water closets to be provided, is permitted to be reduced by 10 before applying Sentence 3.7.2.2.(6), 3.7.2.2.(7), 3.7.2.2.(8), 3.7.2.2.(12), 3.7.2.2.(13)or 3.7.2.2.(14).Water Closets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where piping forming part of the service water heating system is located outside the building envelope or in an unconditioned space, it shall be insulated to a thermal resistance not less than the effective thermal resistance required for the exterior above-ground walls.
unique_id: Where piping forming part of the service water heating system is located outside the building envelope or in an unconditioned space, it shall be insulated to a thermal resistance not less than the effective thermal resistance required for the exterior above-ground walls.Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls may be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Note A-9.20.5.1.(1).)
unique_id: All masonry shall be supported on masonry, concrete or steel, except that masonry veneer walls may be supported on foundations of wood frame constructed in conformance with Sentence 9.15.2.4.(1). (See Note A-9.20.5.1.(1).)Masonry Support

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).
unique_id: Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S102.4-10 Test for Fire and Smoke Characteristics of Electrical Wiring, Cables and Non-Metallic Raceways (FT6 rating).Non-metallic Raceways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3).
unique_id: Electrical wires or similar wiring enclosed in noncombustible totally enclosed raceways are permitted to partly or wholly penetrate an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required in Sentence 9.10.9.6.(3).Penetration of Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.
unique_id: Duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.Construction of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The distance separating air intakes from building envelope penetrations that are potential sources of contaminants, such as gas vents or oil fill pipes, shall be not less than 900 mm.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 3, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.82. shall be of noncombustible construction, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.82. shall be of noncombustible construction, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.Group F, Division 3, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.2.1.(1)and 3.4.2.1. are permitted to be waived for dwelling units that have an access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1)to 3.3.4.4.(4).
unique_id: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.2.1.(1)and 3.4.2.1. are permitted to be waived for dwelling units that have an access to exit conforming to Sentences 3.3.4.4.(1)to 3.3.4.4.(4).Minimum Number of Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.
unique_id: Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.Sheet Metal Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In a 2-stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.
unique_id: In a 2-stage fire alarm system described in Sentence 3.2.4.4.(2), the same audible signal devices are permitted to be used to sound the alert signals and the alarm signals.Alert and Alarm Signals

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a carport is lighted by a light at the entrance to a dwelling unit, additional carport lighting is not required.
unique_id: Where a carport is lighted by a light at the entrance to a dwelling unit, additional carport lighting is not required.Garages and Carports

ARTICLE_TITLE: Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Note A-9.20.8.5.(1).)
unique_id: Masonry veneer of solid masonry units resting on a bearing support shall not project more than one third of the thickness of the veneer. (See Note A-9.20.8.5.(1).)Projection of Masonry Veneer Beyond Supporting Members

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.
unique_id: Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.Ducts

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting Equipment
unique_id: Where self-contained emergency lighting units are used, they shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 141-10 Emergency Lighting EquipmentEmergency Lighting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained therein.
unique_id: The provisions of this Section apply to horizontal service spaces, vertical service spaces, attic or roof spaces, ducts, crawl spaces, shaft spaces, service rooms, and mechanical penthouses, and facilities contained therein.Scope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where piers are used as a foundation system in a building of 1 storey in building height, the piers shall be installed to support the principal framing members and shall be spaced not more than 3.5 m apart along the framing, unless the piers and their footings are designed for larger spacings.
unique_id: Where piers are used as a foundation system in a building of 1 storey in building height, the piers shall be installed to support the principal framing members and shall be spaced not more than 3.5 m apart along the framing, unless the piers and their footings are designed for larger spacings.Pier-Type Foundations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The slope of landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.
unique_id: The slope of landings shall not exceed 1 in 50.Dimensions of Landings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.
unique_id: Single conductor metal sheathed cables with combustible jacketting that are more than 25 mm in overall diameter are permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating without being incorporated in the assembly at the time of testing as required by Article 3.1.9.2., provided the cables are not grouped and are spaced a minimum of 300 mm apart.Penetration by Wires, Cables and Outlet Boxes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Power door operators required by Sentence 3.8.2.7. shall activate automatically or through the use of controls that are located in a barrier-free path of travel, are marked with the International Symbol of Access, are located clear of the door swing and no more than 1 500 mm from that door swing, comply with subclause 3.8.3.8.(1)(a)(ii), are operable from a height between 150 mm and 300 mm as well as between 900 mm and 1 100 mm above the floor, and are operable by touching or approaching any part of their surface with a fist, arm or foot, and unless equipped with safety sensors, fully open the door in not less than 3 s, and require a force not more than 65 N to stop movement of the door. (See Note A-3.8.3.6. and .)
unique_id: Power door operators required by Sentence 3.8.2.7. shall activate automatically or through the use of controls that are located in a barrier-free path of travel, are marked with the International Symbol of Access, are located clear of the door swing and no more than 1 500 mm from that door swing, comply with subclause 3.8.3.8.(1)(a)(ii), are operable from a height between 150 mm and 300 mm as well as between 900 mm and 1 100 mm above the floor, and are operable by touching or approaching any part of their surface with a fist, arm or foot, and unless equipped with safety sensors, fully open the door in not less than 3 s, and require a force not more than 65 N to stop movement of the door. (See Note A-3.8.3.6. and .)Doorways and Doors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
unique_id: Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.Exposure Conditions for Rating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.5.14.(5)and 3.1.5.14.(6), combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry, or concrete.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.1.5.14.(5)and 3.1.5.14.(6), combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry, or concrete.Combustible Insulation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Interior Finishes, Furnishings and Decorative Materials
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC.
unique_id: Except as otherwise provided by this Subsection, interior finishes, furnishings and decorative materials shall conform to Section 2.3. of Division B of the NFC.Interior Finishes, Furnishings and Decorative Materials

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Blocks between Nailing and Supporting Elements
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, fire blocks conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. shall be provided in the concealed spaces created by the wood members permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.10. so that the maximum area of a concealed space is not more than 10 m 2.
unique_id: In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, fire blocks conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. shall be provided in the concealed spaces created by the wood members permitted by Sentence 3.1.5.10. so that the maximum area of a concealed space is not more than 10 m 2.Fire Blocks between Nailing and Supporting Elements

ARTICLE_TITLE: Size and Spacing of Studs in Exterior Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The size and spacing of non-loadbearing steel studs for exterior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.5.
unique_id: The size and spacing of non-loadbearing steel studs for exterior walls shall conform to Table 9.24.2.5.Size and Spacing of Studs in Exterior Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.
unique_id: A roof-top enclosure for elevator machinery or for a service room shall be constructed in accordance with the type of construction required by Articles 3.2.2.20.to 3.2.2.90.Roof-Top Enclosures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The vapour barrier shall have sufficiently low permeance and shall be positioned in the building component or assembly so as to minimize moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, or reduce moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, to a rate that will not allow sufficient accumulation of moisture to cause deterioration or otherwise adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.5.1.2.(1).)
unique_id: The vapour barrier shall have sufficiently low permeance and shall be positioned in the building component or assembly so as to minimize moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, or reduce moisture transfer by diffusion, to surfaces within the assembly that would be cold enough to cause condensation at the design temperature and humidity conditions, to a rate that will not allow sufficient accumulation of moisture to cause deterioration or otherwise adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.5.1.2.(1).)Vapour Barrier Properties and Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of calculating deflections, it is permitted to use a value for V based on the value for Ta determined in Clause 4.1.8.11.(3) to obtain Vd in Sentences 4.1.8.12.(8)and 4.1.8.12.(9).
unique_id: For the purpose of calculating deflections, it is permitted to use a value for V based on the value for Ta determined in Clause 4.1.8.11.(3) to obtain Vd in Sentences 4.1.8.12.(8)and 4.1.8.12.(9).Dynamic Analysis Procedure

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 2, up to 6 Storeys, Any Area, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group A, Division 2, that is not limited by building area, is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.24.(2), provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, and it is not more than 6 storeys in building height.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group A, Division 2, that is not limited by building area, is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.24.(2), provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, and it is not more than 6 storeys in building height.Group A, Division 2, up to 6 Storeys, Any Area, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Subsection 3.2.3. need not apply between buildings within a group of self-service storage buildings, where the distance between these buildings is at least 6 m.
unique_id: Subsection 3.2.3. need not apply between buildings within a group of self-service storage buildings, where the distance between these buildings is at least 6 m.Spatial Separation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Torsional effects that are concurrent with the effects of the forces mentioned in Sentence 4.1.8.11. and are caused by the simultaneous actions of the following torsional moments shall be considered in the design of the structure according to Sentence 4.1.8.11.(11): torsional moments introduced by eccentricity between the centres of mass and resistance and their dynamic amplification, and torsional moments due to accidental eccentricities.
unique_id: Torsional effects that are concurrent with the effects of the forces mentioned in Sentence 4.1.8.11. and are caused by the simultaneous actions of the following torsional moments shall be considered in the design of the structure according to Sentence 4.1.8.11.(11): torsional moments introduced by eccentricity between the centres of mass and resistance and their dynamic amplification, and torsional moments due to accidental eccentricities.Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All round duct joints shall be tight-fitting and lapped not less than 25 mm.
unique_id: All round duct joints shall be tight-fitting and lapped not less than 25 mm.Construction of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Hot water storage tanks associated with the systems referred to in Sentence 9.36.3.11. shall be installed in a conditioned space.
unique_id: Hot water storage tanks associated with the systems referred to in Sentence 9.36.3.11. shall be installed in a conditioned space.Solar Thermal Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tents and air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), and shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.
unique_id: Tents and air-supported structures shall not be erected closer than 3 m to other structures on the same property except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.6.3.(3)and 3.1.6.3.(4), and shall be sufficiently distant from one another to provide an area to be used as a means of emergency egress.Clearance to Other Structures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tents and air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property provided this spacing does not create a hazard to the public.
unique_id: Tents and air-supported structures not occupied by the public need not be separated from one another, and are permitted to be erected less than 3 m from other structures on the same property provided this spacing does not create a hazard to the public.Clearance to Other Structures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6.(4)(a)or 9.9.8.6.(4)(b).
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.8.6.(2), the maximum travel distance from any point on a mezzanine to the nearest exit shall be not more than 40 m in a business and personal services occupancy, 45 m in a floor area that is sprinklered throughout, provided it does not contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, or 30 m in any floor area not referred to in Clauses 9.9.8.6.(4)(a)or 9.9.8.6.(4)(b).Mezzanine Means of Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doorways in a path of travel to at least one bathroom within a suite of residential occupancy shall have a clear width not less than 800 mm when the doors are open. (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(3).) (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(3).)
unique_id: Doorways in a path of travel to at least one bathroom within a suite of residential occupancy shall have a clear width not less than 800 mm when the doors are open. (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(3).) (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(3).)Doorways and Doors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sentence 3.2.3.14. does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered throughout, but shall apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.
unique_id: Sentence 3.2.3.14. does not apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments within a building that is sprinklered throughout, but shall apply to unprotected openings of fire compartments on opposite sides of a firewall, and exposure from unprotected openings of a fire compartment that is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system.Wall Exposed to Another Wall
