unique_id: OSB and waferboard cladding shall conform to CSA O437.0-93 OSB and WaferboardMaterial Standard

ARTICLE_TITLE: Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level. (See also Article 9.23.2.3.)
unique_id: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level. (See also Article 9.23.2.3.)Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Detached garages of less than 55 m2floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in Section 9.14., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage’s floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.
unique_id: Detached garages of less than 55 m2floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in Section 9.14., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage’s floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.Drainage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirement for a manual switch stated in Sentence 9.32.3.3. can be satisfied by a manual override incorporated in a dehumidistat or other automatic control, provided the automatic control is located within the living area of the dwelling unit, and the manual override is clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN."
unique_id: The requirement for a manual switch stated in Sentence 9.32.3.3. can be satisfied by a manual override incorporated in a dehumidistat or other automatic control, provided the automatic control is located within the living area of the dwelling unit, and the manual override is clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN."Principal Ventilation System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tents not more than 120 m2 in ground area, located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided this does not create a hazard to the public.
unique_id: Tents not more than 120 m2 in ground area, located on fair grounds or similar open spaces, need not be separated from one another provided this does not create a hazard to the public.Clearance to Other Structures

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Ceiling, Wall, Fenestration and Door Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 9.36.2.3.(3), the gross wall area shall be calculated as the sum of the interior surface areas of all exterior building envelope assemblies above the finished ground level that are inclined 60° or more from the horizontal, including rim joists, fenestration and opaque portions of doors, insulated walls extending from finished ground level to the interior side of the insulated ceiling and/or roof assembly, and the exposed areas of below-ground building envelope assemblies, where fenestration or doors are located below the plane of the adjacent finished ground. (See Note A-9.36.2.3. and .)

(See Note A-9.36.2.3. and .)Calculation of Ceiling, Wall, Fenestration and Door Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 9.34.2.
unique_id: Lighting outlets in a building of residential occupancy shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 9.34.2.Minimum Lighting Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)
unique_id: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325-07 Construction Sheathing or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members. FRAG_DOCUMENT: The space required in Sentence 9.21.3.8. shall not be filled with mortar.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.17.3.1.(2), steel pipe columns shall have an outside diameter of not less than 73 mm and a wall thickness of not less than 4.76 mm.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue Liners
unique_id: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue LinersClay Liners

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for stairs and ramps serving only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, at least one handrail at the sides of a stair or ramp shall extend horizontally not less than 300 mm beyond the top and bottom of each flight or ramp. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(2).) (See Note A-9.8.7.4.)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup).
unique_id: Vapour barriers shall have a permeance not greater than 60 ng/(Pa·s·m2) measured in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials using the desiccant method (dry cup).Vapour Barrier Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight and corrosion-, decay-, and mildew-resistant.
unique_id: Ducts in or beneath concrete slabs-on-ground shall be watertight and corrosion-, decay-, and mildew-resistant.Installation of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wall and floor surfaces below the uppermost surfaces of a urinal shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance from the urinal to a point not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the urinal on to the wall or floor.
unique_id: Wall and floor surfaces below the uppermost surfaces of a urinal shall be protected from deterioration by impervious and durable material for a distance from the urinal to a point not less than 900 mm from the projected outline of the urinal on to the wall or floor.Surface Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If the stability of adjoining buildings may be endangered by the work of excavating, adequate underpinning, shoring and bracing shall be provided to prevent damage to, or movement of, any part of the adjoining building, and the creation of a hazard to the public.
unique_id: If the stability of adjoining buildings may be endangered by the work of excavating, adequate underpinning, shoring and bracing shall be provided to prevent damage to, or movement of, any part of the adjoining building, and the creation of a hazard to the public.Protection of Adjoining Property

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinkleredbuildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).
unique_id: The requirements in Table 9.10.8.1. for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinkleredbuildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.9.(3), and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4).Fire-Resistance Ratings in Sprinklered Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The installation of materials to resist heat transfer in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled heat transfer will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. (See Note A-5.3.1.2.)
unique_id: The installation of materials to resist heat transfer in accordance with the remainder of this Subsection is not required where it can be shown that uncontrolled heat transfer will not adversely affect any of the health or safety of building users, the intended use of the building, or the operation of building services. FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doorways to public water-closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high. (See Note A-9.5.5.3.)
unique_id: Doorways to public water-closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high. (See Note A-9.5.5.3.)Doorways to Public Water-Closet Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m. (See Note A-9.8.4.) (See Note A-9.8.4.)
unique_id: The vertical height of any flight of stairs shall not exceed 3.7 m. (See Note A-9.8.4.) (See Note A-9.8.4.)Maximum Height of Stairs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.
unique_id: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.Attachment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Telescopic bleachers shall be provided with locking devices to ensure stability while in use.
unique_id: Telescopic bleachers shall be provided with locking devices to ensure stability while in use.Bleachers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A floor drain shall be provided in a garbage room, incinerator room or boiler room serving more than one dwelling unit.
unique_id: A floor drain shall be provided in a garbage room, incinerator room or boiler room serving more than one dwelling unit.Floor Drains

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Masonry made with cellular concrete shall not be used in contact with the soil or exposed to the weather.
unique_id: Masonry made with cellular concrete shall not be used in contact with the soil or exposed to the weather.Cellular Concrete

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meanings stated herein: "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.
unique_id: For the purposes of this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., the following terms shall have the meanings stated herein: "supplemental energy dissipation device" is a dedicated structural element of the supplemental energy dissipation system that dissipates energy due to relative motion of each of its ends or by alternative means, and includes all pins, bolts, gusset plates, brace extensions and other components required to connect it to the other elements of the structure; a device may be classified as either displacement-dependent or velocity-dependent, or a combination thereof, and may be configured to act in either a linear or non-linear manner, and "supplemental energy dissipation system" is a collection of energy dissipation devices installed in a structure that supplement the energy dissipation of the SFRS.Supplemental Energy Dissipation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.
unique_id: Elements of the supplemental energy dissipation system, except the supplemental energy dissipation devices themselves, shall be designed to remain elastic for the design loads.Supplemental Energy Dissipation Design Considerations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The lateral deflection of buildings due to service wind and gravity loads shall be checked to ensure that structural elements and non-structural elements whose nature is known at the time the structural design is carried out will not be damaged.
unique_id: The lateral deflection of buildings due to service wind and gravity loads shall be checked to ensure that structural elements and non-structural elements whose nature is known at the time the structural design is carried out will not be damaged.Deflection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Subsection 6.3.4., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the requirements of the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to good engineering practice such as that described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the NFC. (See Note A-6.9.1.2.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Subsection 6.3.4., systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the requirements of the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to good engineering practice such as that described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the NFC. (See Note A-6.9.1.2.(1).)Hazardous Gases, Dusts or Liquids

ARTICLE_TITLE: Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet
FRAG_DOCUMENT: At least one doorway in a hallway described in Sentence 9.5.5.3. shall be constructed so that access is provided to not less than 1 of each type of fixture described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1), and to accommodate a door not less than 760 mm wide.
unique_id: At least one doorway in a hallway described in Sentence 9.5.5.3. shall be constructed so that access is provided to not less than 1 of each type of fixture described in Sentence 9.5.5.3.(1), and to accommodate a door not less than 760 mm wide.Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For buildings in rough terrain, as defined in Clause 4.1.7.3.(5)(b), the value of Ce for the design of the main structural system shall be calculated as follows: Ce=0.5h12.7 0.50,but0.5 Ce  2.5 (See Note A-4.1.7.8. and .)
unique_id: For buildings in rough terrain, as defined in Clause 4.1.7.3.(5)(b), the value of Ce for the design of the main structural system shall be calculated as follows: Ce=0.5h12.7 0.50,but0.5 Ce  2.5 (See Note A-4.1.7.8. and .)Dynamic Procedure

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Calculations and tests performed in accordance with Sentence 9.36.2.2. shall be carried out at an average temperature of 24±2°C and under a temperature differential of 22±2°C.
unique_id: Calculations and tests performed in accordance with Sentence 9.36.2.2. shall be carried out at an average temperature of 24±2°C and under a temperature differential of 22±2°C.Determination of Thermal Characteristics of Materials, Components

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).) (See also Article 3.8.3.5.)
unique_id: Except for guards conforming to Article 3.3.5.10., guards that protect a level located more than one storey or 4.2 m above the adjacent level shall be designed so that no member, attachment or opening located between 140 mm and 900 mm above the level being protected by the guard facilitates climbing. (See Note A-9.8.8.6.(1).) (See also Article 3.8.3.5.)Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All nails shall be long enough so that not less than half their required length penetrates into the second member.
unique_id: All nails shall be long enough so that not less than half their required length penetrates into the second member.Length of Nails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Conductors leading from a distribution panel to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10. between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.
unique_id: Conductors leading from a distribution panel to emergency lighting units located on other storeys shall be protected in accordance with Sentence 3.2.7.10. between the distribution panel and the floor area where the emergency lighting units are located.Protection of Electrical Conductors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.
unique_id: Where stair flights or ramps of different widths adjoin a single landing, the minimum width of the landing shall be where one or more of the stair or ramp widths do not exceed their respective required widths, not less than the greater required stair or ramp width, or where all of the widths of the stairs or ramps exceed their respective required widths, not less than the lesser actual stair or ramp width.Dimensions of Landings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Vehicle guardrails shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1). (See Note A-4.1.5.14. and 4.1.5.15.(1).)
unique_id: Vehicle guardrails shall be designed and constructed to withstand the loading values stipulated in Sentence 4.1.5.15.(1). (See Note A-4.1.5.14. and 4.1.5.15.(1).)Guards for Floors and Ramps in Garages

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The interior finish of walls and ceilings in bathrooms within suites of residential occupancy shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
unique_id: The interior finish of walls and ceilings in bathrooms within suites of residential occupancy shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.Walls and Ceilings in Bathrooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.8.2. and Sentence 3.3.4.2.(3), the portions of a floor area or a mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly and extending from the floor assembly to the underside of the floor or roof assembly above, or be protected in conformance with the requirements of Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where special foundation systems are used, such systems shall conform to Subsection 4.2.4., Sentence 4.1.1.5. and Article 1.2.1.1..
unique_id: Where special foundation systems are used, such systems shall conform to Subsection 4.2.4., Sentence 4.1.1.5. and Article 1.2.1.1..General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fire separation is not required between a roof-top appliance and the building it serves.
unique_id: A fire separation is not required between a roof-top appliance and the building it serves.Fire Separations around Service Rooms

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Minor penetrations through assemblies, such as pipes, ducts, equipment with through-the-wall venting, packaged terminal air conditioners or heat pumps, shelf angles, anchors and ties and associated fasteners, and minor structural members that must partially or completely penetrate the building envelope to perform their intended function need not be taken into account in the calculation of the effective thermal resistance of that assembly.
unique_id: Minor penetrations through assemblies, such as pipes, ducts, equipment with through-the-wall venting, packaged terminal air conditioners or heat pumps, shelf angles, anchors and ties and associated fasteners, and minor structural members that must partially or completely penetrate the building envelope to perform their intended function need not be taken into account in the calculation of the effective thermal resistance of that assembly.Calculation of Effective Thermal Resistance of Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access openings through barricades shall be equipped with gates that shall be kept closed and locked when the site is unattended, and maintained in place until completion of the construction or demolition activity.
unique_id: Access openings through barricades shall be equipped with gates that shall be kept closed and locked when the site is unattended, and maintained in place until completion of the construction or demolition activity.Fencing, Boarding or Barricades

ARTICLE_TITLE: External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the design of gabled or hipped, single-ridge roofs with a slope greater than 7°, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6..
unique_id: For the design of gabled or hipped, single-ridge roofs with a slope greater than 7°, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6..External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or 2 layers of roll roofing.
unique_id: Open valleys shall be flashed with at least one layer of sheet metal not less than 600 mm wide, or 2 layers of roll roofing.Valley Flashing

ARTICLE_TITLE: Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5. shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.
unique_id: Flashing required in Sentence 9.26.4.5. shall be installed so that it extends up the wall not less than 75 mm behind the sheathing paper, and extends not less than 75 mm horizontally.Intersection of Shingle Roofs and Walls other than Masonry

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(6), exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection incorporating a capillary break, where the number of degree-days is less than 3400 and the moisture index is greater than 0.90, or the number of degree-days is 3400 or more, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See Sentence 1.1.3.1. and for information on the moisture index.)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.2.2.(6), exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection incorporating a capillary break, where the number of degree-days is less than 3400 and the moisture index is greater than 0.90, or the number of degree-days is 3400 or more, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See Sentence 1.1.3.1. and for information on the moisture index.)Minimum Protection from Precipitation Ingress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Nails for fastening hardboard shall be casing or finishing nails not less than 38 mm long, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.
unique_id: Nails for fastening hardboard shall be casing or finishing nails not less than 38 mm long, spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.Nails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.
unique_id: Where a public sewage system is not available, the building sewer shall discharge into a private sewage disposal system.Discharge of Sewage

ARTICLE_TITLE: Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids and Combustible
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire separations for rooms where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored are required to be constructed with a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. of Division B of the NFC.
unique_id: Fire separations for rooms where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored are required to be constructed with a fire-resistance rating in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. of Division B of the NFC.Storage and Dispensing Rooms for Flammable Liquids and Combustible

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena-type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.
unique_id: If usable space exists under tiers of seats in arena-type buildings, a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min shall be provided between the space and the seats or the space shall be sprinklered.Fire Separations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The performance of the HVAC equipment in the reference house shall be modeled as conforming to Table 9.36.3.10. for the corresponding type, fuel source and capacity of equipment in the proposed house, or where the HVAC equipment for the proposed house is not addressed in Table 9.36.3.10., as a gas warm-air furnace with a minimum performance rating of 92% annual fuel utilization efficiency.
unique_id: The performance of the HVAC equipment in the reference house shall be modeled as conforming to Table 9.36.3.10. for the corresponding type, fuel source and capacity of equipment in the proposed house, or where the HVAC equipment for the proposed house is not addressed in Table 9.36.3.10., as a gas warm-air furnace with a minimum performance rating of 92% annual fuel utilization efficiency.Modeling HVAC System of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A self-closing device need not be provided on a door that is located between a classroom and a corridor providing access to exit from the classroom in a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height, a public corridor and an adjacent room of business and personal services occupancy in a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height provided the door is not located in a dead-end portion of the corridor, a patients’ sleeping room and a corridor serving the patients’ sleeping room, provided the room and corridor are within a fire compartment in a hospital or nursing home with treatment that complies with the requirements of Article 3.3.3.5., or a patients’ sleeping room and an adjacent room that serves the patients’ sleeping room, provided these rooms are within a fire compartment in a hospital or nursing home with treatment that complies with the requirements of Article 3.3.3.5.
unique_id: A self-closing device need not be provided on a door that is located between a classroom and a corridor providing access to exit from the classroom in a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height, a public corridor and an adjacent room of business and personal services occupancy in a building that is not more than 3 storeys in building height provided the door is not located in a dead-end portion of the corridor, a patients’ sleeping room and a corridor serving the patients’ sleeping room, provided the room and corridor are within a fire compartment in a hospital or nursing home with treatment that complies with the requirements of Article 3.3.3.5., or a patients’ sleeping room and an adjacent room that serves the patients’ sleeping room, provided these rooms are within a fire compartment in a hospital or nursing home with treatment that complies with the requirements of Article 3.3.3.5.Self-closing Devices

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Arabic numerals indicating the assigned floor number shall be mounted permanently on the stair side of the wall at the latch side of doors to exit stair shafts, be not less than 60 mm high, raised approximately 0.7 mm above the surface, be located 1 500 mm from the finished floor and not more than 300 mm from the door, and be contrasting in colour with the surface to which they are applied (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d)). (see Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d))

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 1, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.70. shall be of noncombustible construction, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.70. shall be of noncombustible construction, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.Group F, Division 1, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Bleachers shall be checked by the erector after erection to ensure that all structural members, including bracing specified in the design, have been installed.
unique_id: Bleachers shall be checked by the erector after erection to ensure that all structural members, including bracing specified in the design, have been installed.Bleachers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Top plates in walls shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened to reduce the undamaged width to less than 50 mm unless the weakened plates are suitably reinforced.
unique_id: Top plates in walls shall not be notched, drilled or otherwise weakened to reduce the undamaged width to less than 50 mm unless the weakened plates are suitably reinforced.Top Plates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy nor in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.
unique_id: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy nor in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.Carbon Monoxide Alarms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13. shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.
unique_id: Local locking devices permitted by Sentence 3.3.1.13. shall be operable by a key from both sides of the door.Doors and Door Hardware

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall meet the heat transfer performance requirements stated in Section 5.3. (See Note A-5.9.3.3.(1).)

(See Note A-3.4.6.19.(1)(d).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.2.6. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The required exit width for exit stairs that serve interconnected floor space designed in accordance with Articles 3.2.8.3.to 3.2.8.8. shall be cumulative, unless the stairs provide not less than 0.3 m2 of area of treads and landings for each occupant of the interconnected floor space (see Note A-3.4.3.2.(6)(a)), or protected floor spaces conforming to Article 3.2.8.5. are provided at each floor level and the protected floor space on a floor level has not less than 0.5 m2 of space for each occupant of that floor level of the interconnected floor space. ARTICLE_TITLE: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5.(4)to 9.10.14.5. and permitted by Sentence 9.10.14.5.(9), cladding on exposing building faces and on exterior walls located above exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible, where the limiting distance is greater than 5.0 m, the limiting distance is greater than 2.5 m where the area and width-to-height ratio of the exposing building face conform to Table 9.10.14.5.-B, the building or fire compartment is sprinklered, the cladding conforms to Subsections 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8.or 9.27.9., is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), or the cladding conforms to Subsection 9.27.12., is installed with or without furring members over a gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Increased Area, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.75. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or 4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.75. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or 4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.Group F, Division 2, up to 4 Storeys, Increased Area, Sprinklered

ARTICLE_TITLE: Exposure to Exterior Space or the Ground and Separation of
FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Part applies, as described in Subsection 1.3.3., to building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground, including those separating interior space from exterior space or separating interior space from the ground, building materials, components and assemblies separating environmentally dissimilar interior spaces (see Note A-5.8.), and site materials, components, assemblies and grading that may affect environmental loads on building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground. (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
unique_id: This Part applies, as described in Subsection 1.3.3., to building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground, including those separating interior space from exterior space or separating interior space from the ground, building materials, components and assemblies separating environmentally dissimilar interior spaces (see Note A-5.8.), and site materials, components, assemblies and grading that may affect environmental loads on building materials, components and assemblies exposed to exterior space or the ground. (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1).)Exposure to Exterior Space or the Ground and Separation of

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Structures shall be designed with a clearly defined load path, or paths, that will transfer the inertial forces generated in an earthquake to the supporting ground.
unique_id: Structures shall be designed with a clearly defined load path, or paths, that will transfer the inertial forces generated in an earthquake to the supporting ground.General Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.7.2.2.(4)and 3.7.2.2.(7), the number of water closets required for a care or residential occupancy shall be at least one for each 10 persons of each sex.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.7.2.2.(4)and 3.7.2.2.(7), the number of water closets required for a care or residential occupancy shall be at least one for each 10 persons of each sex.Water Closets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A door serving an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7. provided it has a flame-spread rating not more than 200, it has a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and the aggregate area of all doors is not more than 10% of the area of the wall in which they are located.
unique_id: A door serving an exit stairway, a vestibule to an exit stairway, a lobby described in Sentence 3.4.4.2.(2), or a corridor not within a suite need not conform to the flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification requirements of Sentence 3.1.13.7. provided it has a flame-spread rating not more than 200, it has a smoke developed classification not more than 300, and the aggregate area of all doors is not more than 10% of the area of the wall in which they are located.High Buildings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.
unique_id: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.Continuity of the Air Barrier System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7. shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.
unique_id: The openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7. shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.Openings for Fire Dampers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All walls, ceilings and floors separating conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground shall be provided with thermal insulation conforming to Subsection 9.25.2. and Section 9.36., an air barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. and Section 9.36., and a vapour barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.4., and constructed in such a way that the properties and relative position of all materials conform to Subsection 9.25.5.
unique_id: All walls, ceilings and floors separating conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground shall be provided with thermal insulation conforming to Subsection 9.25.2. and Section 9.36., an air barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. and Section 9.36., and a vapour barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.4., and constructed in such a way that the properties and relative position of all materials conform to Subsection 9.25.5.Scope and Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the allowable beam spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
unique_id: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the allowable beam spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-Hto 9.23.4.2.-K shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.Concrete Topping

ARTICLE_TITLE: Access to Storeys Served by Escalators and Moving Walks
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall also be provided to that floor level. (See Note A-3.8.2.4.(1).)
unique_id: In a building in which an escalator or inclined moving walk provides access to any floor level above or below the entrance floor level, an interior barrier-free path of travel shall also be provided to that floor level. (See Note A-3.8.2.4.(1).)Access to Storeys Served by Escalators and Moving Walks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements of Sentence 3.8.2.7. do not apply to an individual suite having an area less than 500 m2 in a building having only suites of assembly, care, business and personal services or mercantile occupancy if the suite is completely separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building.
unique_id: The requirements of Sentence 3.8.2.7. do not apply to an individual suite having an area less than 500 m2 in a building having only suites of assembly, care, business and personal services or mercantile occupancy if the suite is completely separated from the remainder of the building so that there is no access to the remainder of the building.Power Door Operators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).)
unique_id: Handrails shall be terminated in a manner that will not obstruct pedestrian travel or create a hazard. (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.8.7.3.(1).)Termination of Handrails

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.
unique_id: Explosion relief devices, vents or other protective measures conforming to Subsection 6.3.1. and Article 6.9.1.2. shall be provided for a space in which substances or conditions that have the potential to create an explosion hazard are present as a result of the principal use of a building.Exhaust Ventilation and Explosion Venting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.
unique_id: A roof-top enclosure for a stairway need not have a fire-resistance rating nor be constructed as a fire separation.Roof-Top Enclosures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.
unique_id: All tapered treads within a flight shall turn in the same direction.Permitted Configurations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.3.2.(6), mortar shall be used and placed in final position within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25°C or higher, or within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25°C.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.20.3.2.(6), mortar shall be used and placed in final position within 1.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is 25°C or higher, or within 2.5 h after mixing when the air temperature is less than 25°C.Mortar and Grout Mixes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
unique_id: Where there is eccentricity or inclination of loading in foundation units, this effect shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.Eccentric and Inclined Loads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.
unique_id: Exterior areas accessible to vehicular traffic shall be designed for their intended use, including the weight of firefighting equipment, but not for less than the snow and rain loads prescribed in Subsection 4.1.6.Loads on Exterior Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements for a roof assembly to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived for a gymnasium, a swimming pool, an arena, or a rink if no part of the roof assembly is less than 6 m above the main floor or balcony and the roof carries no loads other than normal roof loads, including permanent access walks, and ventilating, sound and lighting equipment, except that the restriction concerning minimum distance shall not apply to an inclined and stepped floor ascending from the main floor which is used for seating purposes only, or a balcony used for seating purposes only.
unique_id: The requirements for a roof assembly to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived for a gymnasium, a swimming pool, an arena, or a rink if no part of the roof assembly is less than 6 m above the main floor or balcony and the roof carries no loads other than normal roof loads, including permanent access walks, and ventilating, sound and lighting equipment, except that the restriction concerning minimum distance shall not apply to an inclined and stepped floor ascending from the main floor which is used for seating purposes only, or a balcony used for seating purposes only.Arena-Type Building Roof Assembly

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.
unique_id: A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.Return-Air System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety Glass
unique_id: A glass door shall be constructed of laminated or tempered safety glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.1-M90 Tempered or Laminated Safety Glass or wired glass conforming to CGSB CAN/CGSB-12.11-M90 Wired Safety GlassTransparent Doors and Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stucco shall be maintained at a temperature of not less than 10°C during application, and for not less than 48 h afterwards.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fire alarm system is not required in a residential occupancy where an exit or public corridor serves not more than 4 suites or where each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.
unique_id: A fire alarm system is not required in a residential occupancy where an exit or public corridor serves not more than 4 suites or where each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.Fire Alarm System Required

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible components, other than those permitted by Article 3.1.5.5., are permitted to be used in an exterior wall assembly of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and the wall assembly meets the requirements of Clause 3.1.5.5.(1)(b), or is protected by masonry or concrete cladding not less than 25 mm thick (see Note A-3.1.5.5.(1)(b)).

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.62. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.83. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, roof assemblies shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, except that in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the fire-resistance rating is permitted to be waived provided the roof assembly is constructed as a fire-retardant-treated wood roof system conforming to Article 3.1.14.1., and the building area is not more than 2 400 m2 if facing one street, 3 000 m2 if facing 2 streets, or 3 600 m2 if facing 3 streets, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Masonry walls required to provide a barrier to the ingress of air from the ground shall include a course of masonry units without voids, or be sealed with flashing material extending across the full width of the masonry.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every structure with a supplemental energy dissipation system and every portion thereof shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the loads and requirements prescribed in this Article and Article 4.1.8.22., other applicable requirements of this Subsection, and appropriate engineering principles and current engineering practice.
