FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3. and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3. and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.Two Separate Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Air duct distribution systems serving one of the dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the house.
unique_id: Air duct distribution systems serving one of the dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the house.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with Subsection 9.27.5.
unique_id: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with Subsection 9.27.5.Fastening

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
unique_id: Guards are not required at loading docks, at floor pits in repair garages, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.Required Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2)and 9.9.6.1.(3).
unique_id: Doors serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.1.(2)and 9.9.6.1.(3).Obstructions by Doors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where precipitation can accumulate on sloped or horizontal assemblies, provision shall be made for drainage conforming with the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with Article 2.4.10.4. of Division B of the NPC.
unique_id: Where precipitation can accumulate on sloped or horizontal assemblies, provision shall be made for drainage conforming with the relevant provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, with Article 2.4.10.4. of Division B of the NPC.Accumulation and Disposal

ARTICLE_TITLE: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a vertical service space contains an exhaust duct that serves more than one fire compartment, the duct shall have a fan located at or near the exhaust outlet to ensure that the duct is under negative pressure.
unique_id: Where a vertical service space contains an exhaust duct that serves more than one fire compartment, the duct shall have a fan located at or near the exhaust outlet to ensure that the duct is under negative pressure.Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment

ARTICLE_TITLE: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that the quality of the air entering the building complies with Sentences 6.2.1.2.(2)and 6.2.1.2.(3), and they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.3.2.9.
unique_id: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that the quality of the air entering the building complies with Sentences 6.2.1.2.(2)and 6.2.1.2.(3), and they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with Table 6.3.2.9.Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(2), where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)
unique_id: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(2), where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)Area and Location of Exposing Building Face

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A smoke alarm shall be installed on or near the ceiling.
unique_id: A smoke alarm shall be installed on or near the ceiling.Smoke Alarms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Particleboard subflooring may be used only where a building is constructed in a factory so that the subfloor will not be exposed to the weather.
unique_id: Particleboard subflooring may be used only where a building is constructed in a factory so that the subfloor will not be exposed to the weather.Material Standards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Drain tile or pipe with butt joints shall be laid with 6 mm to 10 mm open joints.
unique_id: Drain tile or pipe with butt joints shall be laid with 6 mm to 10 mm open joints.Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
unique_id: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.Outdoor Intake and Exhaust Openings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.13. and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.5.13.(5), combustible sprinkler piping may be located above a ceiling provided that the distance between the edge of any ceiling opening that is not protected in conformance with Sentence 3.2.5.13. and the nearest sprinkler is not more than 300 mm.Combustible Sprinkler Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
unique_id: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board ApplicationApplication

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of buildingfoundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(4).)
unique_id: Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of buildingfoundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height. (See Note A-9.3.2.9.(4).)Termite and Decay Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.3.2.4.(4), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats with backs or 20 seats without backs between any seat and the nearest aisle.Fixed Seats

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to screwing at this location.
unique_id: Where the ceiling sheets are supported by the wall sheets around the perimeter of the ceiling, this support may be considered as equivalent to screwing at this location.Spacing of Screws

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall account for the energy consumption of each heating, ventilating and, where installed, cooling system for each hour of the year. (See Note A-9.36.5.7.(1).)
unique_id: The energy model calculations shall account for the energy consumption of each heating, ventilating and, where installed, cooling system for each hour of the year. (See Note A-9.36.5.7.(1).)HVAC System Calculations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.
unique_id: Door release hardware on doors in a means of egress shall be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.Door Latching, Locking and Opening Mechanisms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building intended for use by more than one major occupancy shall be classified according to all major occupancies for which it is used or intended to be used.
unique_id: A building intended for use by more than one major occupancy shall be classified according to all major occupancies for which it is used or intended to be used.Classification of Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2.and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation. (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).)
unique_id: The systems for control of smoke movement and mechanical venting required by Articles 3.2.6.2.and 3.2.6.6. shall be tested to ensure satisfactory operation. (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).) (See Note A-3.2.6.9.(1).)Testing

ARTICLE_TITLE: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire blocks described in Sentence 9.10.16.2. are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.
unique_id: Fire blocks described in Sentence 9.10.16.2. are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In houses that contain a secondary suite, heating-season ventilation need not be provided for exits, public corridors, and ancillary spaces that are not within a dwelling unit, except as provided in Sentence 9.32.1.2.(4). (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)
unique_id: In houses that contain a secondary suite, heating-season ventilation need not be provided for exits, public corridors, and ancillary spaces that are not within a dwelling unit, except as provided in Sentence 9.32.1.2.(4). (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)Required Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway. (See Note A-9.10.19.3.(1).)
unique_id: Within dwelling units, sufficient smoke alarms shall be installed so that there is at least one smoke alarm installed on each storey, including basements, and on any storey of a dwelling unit containing sleeping rooms, a smoke alarm is installed in each sleeping room, and in a location between the sleeping rooms and the remainder of the storey, and if the sleeping rooms are served by a hallway, the smoke alarm shall be located in the hallway. (See Note A-9.10.19.3.(1).)Location of Smoke Alarms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The properties, location and installation of thermal insulation, air barrier systems, vapour barriers, and materials with low air or vapour permeance shall also conform to Section 9.25.
unique_id: The properties, location and installation of thermal insulation, air barrier systems, vapour barriers, and materials with low air or vapour permeance shall also conform to Section 9.25.Scope and Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Western cedar shingles shall be not less than No. 2 grade.
unique_id: Western cedar shingles shall be not less than No. 2 grade.Grade

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a liquid or gas fuel-fired engine or turbine for an emergency electric power supply is dependent on a fuel supply from outside the building, the fuel supply shall be provided with a suitably-identified separate shut-off valve outside the building.
unique_id: If a liquid or gas fuel-fired engine or turbine for an emergency electric power supply is dependent on a fuel supply from outside the building, the fuel supply shall be provided with a suitably-identified separate shut-off valve outside the building.Fuel Supply Shut-off Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible glazing is not permitted in wall or ceiling assemblies or in closures used to construct an exit enclosure.
unique_id: Combustible glazing is not permitted in wall or ceiling assemblies or in closures used to construct an exit enclosure.Combustible Glazing in Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.
unique_id: Where plain or reinforced masonry in foundations or in structures supporting soil or rock may be subject to conditions conducive to deterioration, protection shall be provided to prevent such deterioration.Prevention of Deterioration of Masonry

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units
unique_id: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter UnitsFilters and Odour Removal Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction, and 75 in buildings of combustible construction.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.33.8.2.(6), where combustible insulation is used on piping in a horizontal or vertical service space, the insulation and coverings on such pipes shall have a flame-spread rating throughout the material of not more than 25 in buildings of noncombustible construction, and 75 in buildings of combustible construction.Insulation and Coverings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(10), the top of the nosing of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.6.8.(10), the top of the nosing of stair treads shall have a rounded or beveled edge extending not less than 6 mm and not more than 13 mm measured horizontally from the front of the nosing.Treads and Risers

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall include the effect of part-load performance of equipment using the same modeled part-load performance data used for the reference house as per Clause 9.36.5.15.(6)(a), the default part-load performance characteristics stated in Clause 9.36.5.15.(6)(b), or measured data for the specified equipment. (See Note A-9.36.5.11.(9).)
unique_id: The energy model calculations shall include the effect of part-load performance of equipment using the same modeled part-load performance data used for the reference house as per Clause 9.36.5.15.(6)(a), the default part-load performance characteristics stated in Clause 9.36.5.15.(6)(b), or measured data for the specified equipment. (See Note A-9.36.5.11.(9).)Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1. need not be provided in buildings containing only dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, or houses with a secondary suite.
unique_id: Access panels required in Sentence 9.10.20.1. need not be provided in buildings containing only dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, or houses with a secondary suite.Windows or Access Panels Required

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The electrical system and equipment in a tent or air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.
unique_id: The electrical system and equipment in a tent or air-supported structure, including electrical fuses and switches, shall be inaccessible to the public.Electrical Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where thermal mass is included in the energy model calculations for the proposed house, it shall be set as the specified mass up to the inside edge of insulation in exterior walls, the mass of interior walls, the mass up to the centre-line of party walls, and the mass of floors, as applicable, the specified mass of the building envelope assembly, where the energy model calculations include a transient analysis of thermal transfer of the entire building envelope assembly, or a default value of 0.060 MJ/m2·°C.
unique_id: Where thermal mass is included in the energy model calculations for the proposed house, it shall be set as the specified mass up to the inside edge of insulation in exterior walls, the mass of interior walls, the mass up to the centre-line of party walls, and the mass of floors, as applicable, the specified mass of the building envelope assembly, where the energy model calculations include a transient analysis of thermal transfer of the entire building envelope assembly, or a default value of 0.060 MJ/m2·°C.Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8. is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1.8 m of the plenum, and not less than 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).) (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)
unique_id: Where the plenum clearance required in Sentence 9.33.6.8. is more than 75 mm but not more than 150 mm, the clearance between a supply duct and combustible material shall be equal to the required plenum clearance within a horizontal distance of 1.8 m of the plenum, and not less than 12 mm at a horizontal distance of 1.8 m or more from the plenum, except that this distance may be reduced to zero beyond a bend or offset in the duct sufficiently large to shield the remainder of the duct from direct radiation from the furnace heat exchanger. (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).) (See Note A-3.6.5.6.(3).)Clearances of Ducts and Plenums

ARTICLE_TITLE: Loads on Walls Acting As Guards
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the floor elevation on one side of a wall, including a wall around a shaft, is more than 600 mm higher than the elevation of the floor or ground on the other side, the wall shall be designed to resist the appropriate outward lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in Subsection 4.1.5. or 0.5 kPa acting outward, whichever produces the more critical effect. (See Note A-4.1.5.17.)
unique_id: Where the floor elevation on one side of a wall, including a wall around a shaft, is more than 600 mm higher than the elevation of the floor or ground on the other side, the wall shall be designed to resist the appropriate outward lateral design loads prescribed elsewhere in Subsection 4.1.5. or 0.5 kPa acting outward, whichever produces the more critical effect. (See Note A-4.1.5.17.)Loads on Walls Acting As Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible stairs are permitted in a dwelling unit in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Combustible stairs are permitted in a dwelling unit in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.Combustible Stairs in Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire safety at construction and demolition sites shall conform to Section 5.6. of Division B of the NFC.
unique_id: Fire safety at construction and demolition sites shall conform to Section 5.6. of Division B of the NFC.Scope

ARTICLE_TITLE: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(6))
unique_id: Strikeplates for deadbolts described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. shall be fastened to wood frames with wood screws that penetrate not less than 30 mm into solid wood, or to metal frames with machine screws not smaller than No. 8 and not less than 10 mm long. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(6))Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exterior walls, roofs and exposed floors shall have a solar absorptance of 0.4.
unique_id: Exterior walls, roofs and exposed floors shall have a solar absorptance of 0.4.Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.
unique_id: The force-deformation and force-velocity characteristics and damping values of a representative sample of the supplemental energy dissipation devices installed in the building shall be validated by tests prior to their installation.Supplemental Energy Dissipation Design Considerations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.
unique_id: Metal frames and sash of windows, doors and skylights shall incorporate a thermal break.Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing described in Sentence 9.26.4.8. at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.
unique_id: Flashing described in Sentence 9.26.4.8. at the chimney shall be counterflashed as required by Article 9.26.4.4.Chimney Saddles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M-1979 Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing Membrane
unique_id: Polyvinyl chloride sheet applied roofing membrane shall be installed in accordance with CGSB 37-GP-55M-1979 Application of Sheet Applied Flexible Polyvinyl Chloride Roofing MembraneInstallation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.5.1.(2)to 3.1.5.1. and Articles 3.1.5.2.to 3.1.5.24., Article 3.1.13.4. and Article 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall be constructed with noncombustible materials. (See also Subsection 3.1.13. for the requirements regarding the flame-spread rating of interior finishes.)
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.1.5.1.(2)to 3.1.5.1. and Articles 3.1.5.2.to 3.1.5.24., Article 3.1.13.4. and Article 3.2.2.16., a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall be constructed with noncombustible materials. (See also Subsection 3.1.13. for the requirements regarding the flame-spread rating of interior finishes.)Noncombustible Materials

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 3, Storage Garages up to 22 m High
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building used as a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys and having no other occupancy above it is permitted to have its floor, wall, ceiling and roof assemblies constructed without a fire-resistance rating provided it is of noncombustible construction, not more than 22 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, not more than 10 000 m2 in building area, and designed so that every portion of each floor area is within 60 m of an exterior wall opening. (See Note A-3.2.3.)
unique_id: A building used as a storage garage with all storeys constructed as open-air storeys and having no other occupancy above it is permitted to have its floor, wall, ceiling and roof assemblies constructed without a fire-resistance rating provided it is of noncombustible construction, not more than 22 m high, measured between grade and the ceiling level of the top storey, not more than 10 000 m2 in building area, and designed so that every portion of each floor area is within 60 m of an exterior wall opening. (See Note A-3.2.3.)Group F, Division 3, Storage Garages up to 22 m High

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences 9.32.3.3.(5), 9.32.3.3.(6)and 9.32.3.3.(7). (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(3).)
unique_id: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences 9.32.3.3.(5), 9.32.3.3.(6)and 9.32.3.3.(7). (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(3).)Principal Ventilation System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2.
unique_id: A chimneyflue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2.Chimney Flue Limitations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.
unique_id: Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.Exhaust Ducts and Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fans, including makeup air supply fans, installed to satisfy Articles 9.32.3.3.to 9.32.3.8. with less than 1 m of duct between themselves and the visible interior surfaces of rooms other than unfinished basements, furnace rooms, utility rooms and attics, shall have a sound rating complying with Table 9.32.3.10.-B when operating at the required flow rate.
unique_id: Fans, including makeup air supply fans, installed to satisfy Articles 9.32.3.3.to 9.32.3.8. with less than 1 m of duct between themselves and the visible interior surfaces of rooms other than unfinished basements, furnace rooms, utility rooms and attics, shall have a sound rating complying with Table 9.32.3.10.-B when operating at the required flow rate.Fans

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Plans, specifications and other information for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall conform to Subsection 2.2.6.. (See Note A-6.2.1.1.)
unique_id: Plans, specifications and other information for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall conform to Subsection 2.2.6.. (See Note A-6.2.1.1.)Required Plans and Specifications

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Metal liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.6. shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances. (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).) (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).)
unique_id: Metal liners referred to in Sentence 9.21.3.6. shall only be used in chimneys serving gas- or oil-burning appliances. (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).) (See Note A-9.21.3.6.(2).)Metal Liners

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material.
unique_id: A clearance of not less than 150 mm shall be provided between a cleanout opening and combustible material.Clearance from Combustible Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The width or diameter of a wood column shall be not less than the width of the supported member.
unique_id: The width or diameter of a wood column shall be not less than the width of the supported member.Column Sizes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass blocks shall not be used as loadbearing units or in the construction of fireplaces or chimneys.
unique_id: Glass blocks shall not be used as loadbearing units or in the construction of fireplaces or chimneys.Glass Blocks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service water heaters, boilers, pool heaters and storage tanks shall comply with the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.4.2. (See Note A-9.36.4.2.(1).)
unique_id: Service water heaters, boilers, pool heaters and storage tanks shall comply with the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.4.2. (See Note A-9.36.4.2.(1).)Equipment Efficiency

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation of air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall be of noncombustible material when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources that would result in the exposed surface exceeding a temperature of 120°C.
unique_id: Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation of air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall be of noncombustible material when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources that would result in the exposed surface exceeding a temperature of 120°C.Coverings, Linings, Adhesives and Insulation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Concealed spaces in mansard or gambrel style roofs, exterior cornices, balconies and canopies of combustible construction in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating exceeding 25 shall have vertical fire blocks at intervals of not more than 20 m and at points where such concealed spaces extend across the ends of required vertical fire separations.
unique_id: Concealed spaces in mansard or gambrel style roofs, exterior cornices, balconies and canopies of combustible construction in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating exceeding 25 shall have vertical fire blocks at intervals of not more than 20 m and at points where such concealed spaces extend across the ends of required vertical fire separations.Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1)and 3.2.7.3. shall be not less than 1 lx.
unique_id: The minimum value of the illumination required by Sentences 3.2.7.3.(1)and 3.2.7.3. shall be not less than 1 lx.Emergency Lighting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.4.(6)to 9.10.14.4.(10), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.14.4.-A, conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.4.(6)to 9.10.14.4.(10), the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to Table 9.10.14.4.-A, conform to Subsection 3.2.3., or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.Openings in Exposing Building Face

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Galvanized-steel straps are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.23.3.4.(3), provided they are 50 mm wide, not less than 0.91 mm thick, and fastened at each end with at least four 63 mm nails.
unique_id: Galvanized-steel straps are deemed to comply with Sentence 9.23.3.4.(3), provided they are 50 mm wide, not less than 0.91 mm thick, and fastened at each end with at least four 63 mm nails.Nailing of Framing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electrical equipment vaults shall be secured against unauthorized entry.
unique_id: Electrical equipment vaults shall be secured against unauthorized entry.Electrical Equipment Vaults

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Joints in flashing shall be made watertight.
unique_id: Joints in flashing shall be made watertight.Flashing Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Space under tiers of seats in a building of the arena type shall not be considered as adding to the building height provided the space is used only for dressing rooms, concession stands and similar purposes incidental to the major occupancy of the building.
unique_id: Space under tiers of seats in a building of the arena type shall not be considered as adding to the building height provided the space is used only for dressing rooms, concession stands and similar purposes incidental to the major occupancy of the building.Exceptions in Determining Building Height

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building is considered to face 3 streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.
unique_id: A building is considered to face 3 streets provided not less than 75% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.Streets

ARTICLE_TITLE: Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards in Garages
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where stairs, ramps, landings, handrails or guards are installed in garages that serve a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the garage shall be considered to be part of the dwelling unit and the requirements for stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within dwelling units shall apply.
unique_id: Where stairs, ramps, landings, handrails or guards are installed in garages that serve a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the garage shall be considered to be part of the dwelling unit and the requirements for stairs, ramps, landings, handrails and guards within dwelling units shall apply.Stairs, Ramps, Landings, Handrails and Guards in Garages

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in Sentence 9.10.9.14. where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietor’s residence and do not contain cooking facilities.
unique_id: Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in Sentence 9.10.9.14. where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietor’s residence and do not contain cooking facilities.Separation of Residential Suites

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In addition to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.9.4.(2), outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.
unique_id: In addition to the requirements of Sentence 3.1.9.4.(2), outlet boxes on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, or a fire block conforming to Article 3.1.11.7.Penetration by Outlet Boxes

ARTICLE_TITLE: Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The structure shall be designed to resist overturning effects caused by the earthquake forces determined in Sentence 4.1.8.11. and the overturning moment at level x, Mx, shall be determined using the following equation: Mx=Jxi=xn Fihi-hxwhereJx= 1.0 for hx   0.6hn, and Jx= J + (1 - J)(hx / 0.6hn) for hx < 0.6hn whereJ= base overturning moment reduction factor conforming to Table 4.1.8.11.
unique_id: The structure shall be designed to resist overturning effects caused by the earthquake forces determined in Sentence 4.1.8.11. and the overturning moment at level x, Mx, shall be determined using the following equation: Mx=Jxi=xn Fihi-hxwhereJx= 1.0 for hx   0.6hn, and Jx= J + (1 - J)(hx / 0.6hn) for hx < 0.6hn whereJ= base overturning moment reduction factor conforming to Table 4.1.8.11.Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying

ARTICLE_TITLE: Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wood-frame walls shall be anchored to masonry walls that they intersect with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.
unique_id: Wood-frame walls shall be anchored to masonry walls that they intersect with not less than 4.76 mm diam corrosion-resistant steel rods spaced not more than 900 mm o.c. vertically.Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.
unique_id: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.Lath and Reinforcing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and Section 9.20., or Part 5.
unique_id: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.4., and Section 9.20., or Part 5.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(2), a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.5.3.1.(2), a vertical service space used as an elevator hoistway shall be separated from all other portions of each adjacent storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to Table 3.5.3.1. for the fire-resistance rating required by Subsection 3.2.2. for the floor assembly above the storey, or the floor assembly below the storey, if there is no floor assembly above.Fire Separations for Elevator Hoistways

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The penetration of a floor assembly by an exit or a vertical service space shall conform to the requirements of Sections 3.4., 3.5.and 3.6.
unique_id: The penetration of a floor assembly by an exit or a vertical service space shall conform to the requirements of Sections 3.4., 3.5.and 3.6.Application

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.58.(2), provided it is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and it has a building area not more than 18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, 4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, 3 600 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or 3 000 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.58.(2), provided it is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, it has a height not more than 18 m measured between the floor of the first storey and the uppermost floor level that does not serve a rooftop enclosure for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used only for service to the building, and it has a building area not more than 18 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 9 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 6 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, 4 500 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, 3 600 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or 3 000 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.Group D, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements in Part 3 regarding occupant load shall not apply to self-service storage buildings.
unique_id: The requirements in Part 3 regarding occupant load shall not apply to self-service storage buildings.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Both the proposed and reference houses shall be modeled using the same climatic data, soil conditions, operating schedules in Article 9.36.5.4. and temperature set-points.
unique_id: Both the proposed and reference houses shall be modeled using the same climatic data, soil conditions, operating schedules in Article 9.36.5.4. and temperature set-points.Compliance

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations may include duct and piping losses, taking into account the properties of the specified duct and piping insulation of the proposed house.
unique_id: The energy model calculations may include duct and piping losses, taking into account the properties of the specified duct and piping insulation of the proposed house.Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group B, Division 3, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.43.to 3.2.2.46., a building classified as Group B, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.42.(2).
unique_id: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.43.to 3.2.2.46., a building classified as Group B, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.42.(2).Group B, Division 3, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doors shall be installed so that, when open, they do not diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit.
unique_id: Doors shall be installed so that, when open, they do not diminish nor obstruct the required width of the exit.Exit Width Reduction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Trunk supply ducts shall not be nailed directly to wood members.
unique_id: Trunk supply ducts shall not be nailed directly to wood members.Installation of Ducts and Plenums

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence 3.2.2.9.(1).
unique_id: A floor assembly immediately above a crawl space is not required to be constructed as a fire separation and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating provided the crawl space is not required to be considered as a basement by Sentence 3.2.2.9.(1).Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A single top plate is permitted to be used in loadbearing walls where the concentrated loads from ceilings, floors and roofs are not more than 50 mm to one side of the supporting studs and in all non-loadbearing walls.
unique_id: A single top plate is permitted to be used in loadbearing walls where the concentrated loads from ceilings, floors and roofs are not more than 50 mm to one side of the supporting studs and in all non-loadbearing walls.Top Plates

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For stacked braced wall bands, where the construction of any one braced wall panel is required to be of a wood-based material, a wood-based material shall be installed in all the required braced wall panels in that braced wall band.
unique_id: For stacked braced wall bands, where the construction of any one braced wall panel is required to be of a wood-based material, a wood-based material shall be installed in all the required braced wall panels in that braced wall band.Materials in Braced Wall Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(2), flashing shall be installed at every horizontal junction between cladding elements, every horizontal offset in the cladding, and every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.27.3.8.(2), flashing shall be installed at every horizontal junction between cladding elements, every horizontal offset in the cladding, and every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(1).)Flashing Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Steel-lined chimneys that penetrate the building envelope shall be constructed airtight by blocking the void between required clearances for metal chimneys and surrounding construction with sheet metal and sealant capable of withstanding high temperatures.
unique_id: Steel-lined chimneys that penetrate the building envelope shall be constructed airtight by blocking the void between required clearances for metal chimneys and surrounding construction with sheet metal and sealant capable of withstanding high temperatures.Construction of Air Barrier Details

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.9.1.1. and elsewhere in this Part, materials and components, and their installation, shall conform to the requirements of the applicable standards in Table 5.9.1.1. where those materials or components are incorporated into environmental separators or assemblies exposed to the exterior, and installed to fulfill the requirements of this Part. (See Note A-5.9.1.1.(1).)

(See Note A-5.9.1.1.(1).)Compliance with Applicable Standards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When lath is used with double-course application [see Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4)], it shall be spaced according to the exposure and securely fastened to the framing.
unique_id: When lath is used with double-course application [see Sentence 9.27.5.1.(4)], it shall be spaced according to the exposure and securely fastened to the framing.Fastening to Lath

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where lumber, wood shingles, shakes, fibre-cement shingles, planks and sheets, plywood, OSB, waferboard, hardboard, vinyl, aluminum or steel, including trim and soffits, are installed as cladding on wood-frame walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.27.2.to 9.27.12., or Part 5.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
unique_id: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.One-Way Voice Communication Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.9.3., a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.Continuous Barrier

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Doors that divide a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing in the direction of exit travel.
unique_id: Doors that divide a corridor that is not wholly contained within a suite shall swing in the direction of exit travel.Direction of Door Swing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Shingles shall be fastened in accordance with Article 9.26.7.4.
unique_id: Shingles shall be fastened in accordance with Article 9.26.7.4.Fastening

ARTICLE_TITLE: Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Reinforcing bars described in Sentences 9.20.17.3.(3)and 9.20.17.3. shall extend 600 mm beyond the edges of the opening.
unique_id: Reinforcing bars described in Sentences 9.20.17.3.(3)and 9.20.17.3. shall extend 600 mm beyond the edges of the opening.Openings in Non-Loadbearing Flat Insulating Concrete Form Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any wall, partition or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.1.(2), be constructed as a continuous element, and as required in this Part, have a fire-resistance rating as specified (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)). (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b))
unique_id: Any wall, partition or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.1.(2), be constructed as a continuous element, and as required in this Part, have a fire-resistance rating as specified (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)). (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b))General Requirements

ARTICLE_TITLE: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
unique_id: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heat pumps with a programmable thermostat shall be equipped with setback controls that will temporarily suppress electrical back-up or adaptive anticipation of the recovery point, in order to prevent the activation of supplementary heat during the heat pump’s recovery. (See Note A-9.36.3.6.(7).)
unique_id: Heat pumps with a programmable thermostat shall be equipped with setback controls that will temporarily suppress electrical back-up or adaptive anticipation of the recovery point, in order to prevent the activation of supplementary heat during the heat pump’s recovery. FRAG_DOCUMENT: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.
unique_id: Eave protection shall conform to Subsection 9.26.5.Eave Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high.
unique_id: All guards within dwelling units or within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 900 mm high.Height of Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.
unique_id: Heating of heated crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.33.Heated and Unheated Crawl Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter Units
unique_id: Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S111-13 Fire Tests for Air Filter UnitsFilters

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.2.(2)and 9.8.8.2.(4),guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.8.2.(2)and 9.8.8.2.(4),guards shall be designed to resist the specified loads prescribed in Table 9.8.8.2.Loads on Guards

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction, used singly or in combination, provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 2 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height with no basement, 1 200 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.
unique_id: A building classified as Group A, Division 2 is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction, used singly or in combination, provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 2 400 m2 if 1 storey in building height with no basement, 1 200 m2 if 1 storey in building height, or 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height.Group A, Division 2, up to 2 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Recesses may be constructed in 190 mm walls provided they do not exceed 100 mm in depth, 750 mm in height and 500 mm in width.
unique_id: Recesses may be constructed in 190 mm walls provided they do not exceed 100 mm in depth, 750 mm in height and 500 mm in width.Minimum Wall Thickness

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.
unique_id: Where rock that expands or deteriorates when subjected to unfavourable environmental conditions or to stress release is known to exist, this condition shall be fully investigated and provided for in the design.Expanding and Deteriorating Rock

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pigment shall not exceed 6% of the Portland cement by weight.
unique_id: Pigment shall not exceed 6% of the Portland cement by weight.Pigments

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Steel columns other than those described in Sentence 9.17.3.4. shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.
unique_id: Steel columns other than those described in Sentence 9.17.3.4. shall be designed in accordance with Part 4.Design of Steel Columns

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A fuel-fired appliance installed on the roof of a building or in another location outside the building shall be installed not less than 1.2 m from a property line, measured horizontally, and 3 m from an adjacent wall of the same building if that wall contains any opening within 3 storeys above and 5 m horizontally from the appliance, unless every opening within these limits is protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min determined in accordance with Article 3.1.8.4., or a wired glass assembly permitted for use in a vertical fire separation and described in Note D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.
unique_id: A fuel-fired appliance installed on the roof of a building or in another location outside the building shall be installed not less than 1.2 m from a property line, measured horizontally, and 3 m from an adjacent wall of the same building if that wall contains any opening within 3 storeys above and 5 m horizontally from the appliance, unless every opening within these limits is protected by a closure having a fire-protection rating not less than 45 min determined in accordance with Article 3.1.8.4., or a wired glass assembly permitted for use in a vertical fire separation and described in Note D-2.2.3.15. in Appendix D.Appliances Installed outside a Building

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.12.
unique_id: The depth below ground level for foundations for exterior steps shall conform to the requirements in Section 9.12.Exterior Concrete Stairs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirements for application of gypsum board in this Subsection apply to the single layer application of gypsum board to wood furring or framing using nails or screws.
unique_id: The requirements for application of gypsum board in this Subsection apply to the single layer application of gypsum board to wood furring or framing using nails or screws.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent which has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.
unique_id: An interior linen chute or refuse chute shall extend not less than 1 m above the roof and shall be vented above the roof with a vent which has an unobstructed area not less than the cross-sectional area of the chute, and is equipped with a cover that will open automatically, or that can be opened manually, in the event of a fire in the chute.Linen and Refuse Chutes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.2.(4), water closets shall be provided for each sex assuming that the occupant load is equally divided between males and females, unless the proportion of each sex expected in the building can be determined with reasonable accuracy. (See Note A-3.7.2.2.(1).) (See Note A-3.7.2.2.(1).)
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.7.2.2.(4), water closets shall be provided for each sex assuming that the occupant load is equally divided between males and females, unless the proportion of each sex expected in the building can be determined with reasonable accuracy. FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.60. provided it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.60.
unique_id: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.60. provided it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.60.Group D, up to 3 Storeys

unique_id: The energy model calculations shall account for a thermostatic control that responds to fluctuations of ±0.5°C from the temperature set-point. (See Note A-9.36.5.4.(7).)Calculation Methods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.
unique_id: Permissible deviations from the design alignment and the location of the top of deep foundation units shall be determined by design analysis and shall be indicated on the drawings.Tolerance in Alignment and Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer, any necessary changes made and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..
unique_id: Where a deep foundation unit has not been placed within the permissible deviations referred to in Article 4.2.7.3., the condition of the foundation shall be assessed by the designer, any necessary changes made and action taken as required in Article 2.2.4.7..Incorrect Alignment and Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storm doors for sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist wind loads, control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and be easily operable.
unique_id: Storm doors for sliding doors and their components shall be designed, constructed and installed so that, when in the closed position, they resist wind loads, control air leakage to a minimum allowable 5 m3h/m and a maximum allowable 8.35 m3h/m, resist the ingress of insects and vermin, and be easily operable.General Performance Expectations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Required interior braced wall panels of wood-based material may be sheathed on one side only, provided the sheathing material is plywood, OSB or waferboard, and the maximum spacing of fasteners along the edge is half of the maximum spacing shown in Table 9.23.3.5.-B.
unique_id: Required interior braced wall panels of wood-based material may be sheathed on one side only, provided the sheathing material is plywood, OSB or waferboard, and the maximum spacing of fasteners along the edge is half of the maximum spacing shown in Table 9.23.3.5.-B.Materials in Braced Wall Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.3.5.(9)to 3.3.3.5.(13), walls between patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless one is required by other provisions in this Part. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.3.5.(9)to 3.3.3.5.(13), walls between patients’ or residents’ sleeping rooms and the remainder of the floor area shall be constructed as fire separations but are not required to have a fire-resistance rating unless one is required by other provisions in this Part. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b).)Compartments and Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining Rooms
unique_id: The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of ISO 10848:2006 Acoustics - Laboratory Measurement of the Flanking Transmission of Airborne and Impact Sound Between Adjoining RoomsDetailed Method for Calculating ASTC

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.61. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.61. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations and, if of combustible construction, shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, mezzanines shall have, if of combustible construction, a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches supporting an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or be of noncombustible construction.Group D, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.
unique_id: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.Drips beneath Window Sills

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.1.4.2.(2), materials used in building components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments, or in assemblies exposed to the exterior, shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to any mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature and function of the materials, and the exposure and climatic conditions in which they will be installed.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.1.4.2.(2), materials used in building components and assemblies that separate dissimilar environments, or in assemblies exposed to the exterior, shall be compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to any mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature and function of the materials, and the exposure and climatic conditions in which they will be installed.Resistance to Deterioration

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A material, assembly, or structural member is permitted to be assigned a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification on the basis of .
unique_id: A material, assembly, or structural member is permitted to be assigned a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification on the basis of .Determination of Ratings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Exit stair flights shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).
unique_id: Exit stair flights shall consist solely of straight flights, or curved flights complying with Sentence 3.4.6.9.(2).Curved Flights in Exits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The requirement for fire dampers stated in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for noncombustible branch ducts having a melting point above 760°C that penetrate a fire separation, provided the ducts have a cross-sectional area not more than 0.013 m2 and serve only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air not more than 1.2 m above the floor, or extend not less than 500 mm inside exhaust duct risers that are under negative pressure and in which the airflow is upward as required by Article 3.6.3.4., or where the fire separation separates a vertical service space from the remainder of the building, provided each individual duct exhausts directly to the outdoors at the top of the vertical service space.
unique_id: The requirement for fire dampers stated in Sentence 3.1.8.7. is permitted to be waived for noncombustible branch ducts having a melting point above 760°C that penetrate a fire separation, provided the ducts have a cross-sectional area not more than 0.013 m2 and serve only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air not more than 1.2 m above the floor, or extend not less than 500 mm inside exhaust duct risers that are under negative pressure and in which the airflow is upward as required by Article 3.6.3.4., or where the fire separation separates a vertical service space from the remainder of the building, provided each individual duct exhausts directly to the outdoors at the top of the vertical service space.Fire Dampers Waived

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.
unique_id: Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.Storage Lockers in Residential Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A floor-on-ground shall be sealed around its perimeter to the inner surfaces of adjacent walls using flexible sealant.
unique_id: A floor-on-ground shall be sealed around its perimeter to the inner surfaces of adjacent walls using flexible sealant.Air Barrier Systems in Floors-on-ground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, every door, fire damper, window assembly or glass block used as a closure in a required fire separation shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(2).)
unique_id: Except as otherwise specified in this Part, every door, fire damper, window assembly or glass block used as a closure in a required fire separation shall be installed in conformance with NFPA 80-2013 Fire Doors and Other Opening Protectives (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(2).)Installation of Closures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and Sentence 3.2.4.7. does not apply, a legible notice that is not easily removed shall be affixed to the wall near each manual station stating that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or for the fire department (see Note A-3.2.4.7.(5)(b)).
unique_id: Where a single stage fire alarm system is installed in a building that is not sprinklered throughout and Sentence 3.2.4.7. does not apply, a legible notice that is not easily removed shall be affixed to the wall near each manual station stating that the fire department is to be notified in the event of a fire emergency, and the emergency telephone number for the municipality or for the fire department (see Note A-3.2.4.7.(5)(b)).Signals to Fire Department

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Insulation located in areas where it may be subject to mechanical damage shall be protected by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.
unique_id: Insulation located in areas where it may be subject to mechanical damage shall be protected by a covering such as gypsum board, plywood, particleboard, OSB, waferboard or hardboard.Installation of Thermal Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Saddles shall be flashed where they intersect the roof.
unique_id: Saddles shall be flashed where they intersect the roof.Chimney Saddles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as otherwise required by Sentence 3.2.7.10. and permitted by this Article, electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10. shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2) and (a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.
unique_id: Except as otherwise required by Sentence 3.2.7.10. and permitted by this Article, electrical conductors that are used in conjunction with systems identified in Sentence 3.2.7.10. shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S139-12 Fire Test for Evaluation of Integrity of Electrical Power, Data and Optical Fibre Cables including the hose stream application, to provide a circuit integrity rating of not less than 1 h(see Note A-3.2.7.10.(2) and (a)), or be located in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation that has a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h.Protection of Electrical Conductors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the professional engineer responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.
unique_id: Communication, interaction and coordination between the designer and the professional engineer responsible for the geotechnical aspects of the project shall take place to a degree commensurate with the complexity and requirements of the project.Design Basis

ARTICLE_TITLE: Concrete Blocks Exposed to the Weather
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have density and water absorption characteristics conforming to concrete types A, B, C, or D described in CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units
unique_id: Concrete blocks exposed to the weather shall have density and water absorption characteristics conforming to concrete types A, B, C, or D described in CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry UnitsConcrete Blocks Exposed to the Weather

ARTICLE_TITLE: Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.
unique_id: The installation of windows, doors and skylights shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A440.4-07 Window, Door, and Skylight Installation except that shims used to support windows, doors and skylights are permitted to be made of treated plywood, and protection from precipitation for walls incorporating windows or doors and for roofs incorporating skylights, and the interfaces of these walls with windows or doors and of roofs with skylights, shall conform to Section 9.27.Installation of Windows, Doors and Skylights

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2. may also be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.
unique_id: Access required in Sentence 9.10.20.2. may also be provided by an interior stair accessible from the outdoors.Access to Basements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Controls required by Sentence 9.36.3.6. shall be designed such that lowering the set-point temperature on the thermostat for the heating system will not cause cooling energy to be expended to reach the lowered setting, and raising the set-point temperature on the thermostat for the cooling system will not cause heating energy to be expended to reach the raised setting.
unique_id: Controls required by Sentence 9.36.3.6. shall be designed such that lowering the set-point temperature on the thermostat for the heating system will not cause cooling energy to be expended to reach the lowered setting, and raising the set-point temperature on the thermostat for the cooling system will not cause heating energy to be expended to reach the raised setting.Temperature Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of this Section, the term "fenestration" shall mean all building envelope assemblies, including their frames, that transfer visible light, such as windows, clerestories, skylights, translucent wall panels, glass block assemblies, transoms, sidelights, sliding, overhead or swinging glass doors, and glazed inserts in doors, etc. (See Note A-9.36.1.2.(4).) (See Note A-9.36.1.3.)

(See Note A-9.36.1.3.)Definitions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. vertically and 400 mm o.c. horizontally, or 100 mm o.c. vertically and 600 mm o.c. horizontally.
unique_id: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. vertically and 400 mm o.c. horizontally, or 100 mm o.c. vertically and 600 mm o.c. horizontally.Fastening

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The noncombustible register protection described in Sentence 9.18.7.1. shall extend not less than 300 mm beyond the projection of the register opening, and have up-turned edges. (See Note A-9.18.7.1.(4).)

unique_id: The connection referred to in Sentence 9.21.2.2. for a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall be made below connections for appliances burning other fuels.Connections of More Than One Appliance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sealant material used for the purpose of creating a continuous air barrier system shall be a non-hardening type, or conform to Subsection 9.27.4., ULC CAN/ULC-S710.1-11 Thermal Insulation – Bead-Applied One Component Polyurethane Air Sealant Foam, Part 1: Material Specification or ULC CAN/ULC-S711.1-11 Thermal Insulation – Bead-Applied Two Component Polyurethane Air Sealant Foam, Part 1: Material Specification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.4.(1), bottoms of floor joists shall be restrained from twisting at each end by toe-nailing to the supports, end-nailing to the header joists or by providing continuous strapping, blocking between the joists or cross-bridging near the supports. (See Note A-9.23.4.2.(2).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 3.4.6.5.(8)and Clause 3.8.3.5.(1)(e), the height of handrails on stairs, on aisles with steps and on ramps shall be not less than 865 mm, and not more than 1 070 mm.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.
unique_id: Where the facility is not equipped with staff trained to provide instructions over the loudspeakers, a pre-recorded message shall be provided.Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The permission in Sentence 9.10.18.6. to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.
unique_id: The permission in Sentence 9.10.18.6. to consider separated portions of a building as separate buildings does not apply to service rooms and storage rooms.Portions of Buildings Considered as Separate Buildings
