FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with Article 3.6.5.7.
unique_id: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with Article 3.6.5.7.Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group F, Division 3, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.82. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area that is not limited if the building is not more than 1 storey in building height, not more than 21 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, not more than 14 400 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, not more than 10 800 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, not more than 8 640 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or not more than 7 200 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.82. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area that is not limited if the building is not more than 1 storey in building height, not more than 21 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, not more than 14 400 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, not more than 10 800 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, not more than 8 640 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or not more than 7 200 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.Group F, Division 3, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.5.7.(2), factory-assembled wall and ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group A, Group B, or Group C major occupancy, and the panels do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 3.1.5.7.(2), factory-assembled wall and ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group A, Group B, or Group C major occupancy, and the panels do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S138-06 Test for Fire Growth of Insulated Building Panels in a Full-Scale Room Configuration meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in Subsection 3.1.12., have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.Factory-Assembled Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.19. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.
unique_id: Glass and transparent panels in an exit shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Article 3.3.1.19. for glass and transparent panels in an access to exit.Transparent Doors and Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10.and 3.2.3.11., where the limiting distance in Tables 3.2.3.1.-Bto 3.2.3.1.-E permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of Table 3.2.3.7. shall be met.
unique_id: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.3.10.and 3.2.3.11., where the limiting distance in Tables 3.2.3.1.-Bto 3.2.3.1.-E permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of Table 3.2.3.7. shall be met.Combustible Cladding on Exterior Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.
unique_id: Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.Limits to Smoke Movement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Required braced wall panels shall be clad with panel-type cladding complying with Section 9.27. and Table 9.23.3.4., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.16. and Table 9.23.13.6., and fastened in accordance with Article 9.23.3.5., or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29. and Table 9.23.13.6.
unique_id: Required braced wall panels shall be clad with panel-type cladding complying with Section 9.27. and Table 9.23.3.4., sheathed with plywood, OSB, waferboard or diagonal lumber sheathing complying with Subsection 9.23.16. and Table 9.23.13.6., and fastened in accordance with Article 9.23.3.5., or finished on the interior with a panel-type material in accordance with the requirements of Section 9.29. and Table 9.23.13.6.Materials in Braced Wall Panels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(3), where a concealed space in a floor or ceiling assembly is used as a plenum, electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and optical fibre cables installed within the plenum shall conform to Clause 3.6.4.3.(1)(a).

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence 9.10.12.4. do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.
unique_id: Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of Sentence 9.10.12.4. do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in Article 3.2.5.12.Protection of Soffits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also Article 6.3.1.7.)
unique_id: A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also Article 6.3.1.7.)Fire Dampers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flashing described in Sentences 9.27.3.8.(1)and 9.27.3.8. shall extend not less than 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane (see Article 9.27.3.4.), have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, terminate at each end with an end-dam with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 the value of the 1-in-5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and at the height defined in subclause 9.27.3.8.(4)(c)(i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and terminate in a drip offset not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(4).)

unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(3), the combined area of glazing in doors and sidelights shall not exceed 0.8 m2.Wired Glass or Glass Block

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence 9.34.2.7. shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7. (See Article 9.9.12.2. for lighting in means of egress.)

(See Note A-9.8.8.1.)
unique_id: Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side, where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2. (See Note A-9.8.8.1.)Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If any portion of a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and extends more than one storey below that ground level, the following minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be taken: except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.15.(3), the basements shall be sprinklered throughout, a floor assembly below the ground level shall be constructed as a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the basements are used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, or 2 h if the basements are not used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the construction that they support.
unique_id: If any portion of a building is erected entirely below the adjoining finished ground level and extends more than one storey below that ground level, the following minimum precautions against fire spread and collapse shall be taken: except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.15.(3), the basements shall be sprinklered throughout, a floor assembly below the ground level shall be constructed as a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 3 h if the basements are used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, or 2 h if the basements are not used as Group E or Group F, Division 1 or 2 occupancies, and all loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the construction that they support.Storeys below Ground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 9.10.11.2., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 9.10.11.2., a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See Note A-3.2.3.4.(1).)Required Firewalls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Computational fluid dynamics shall not be used to determine the specified wind loads for a building and its components. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(6).) (See Note A-4.1.7.2.)
unique_id: Computational fluid dynamics shall not be used to determine the specified wind loads for a building and its components. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(6).) (See Note A-4.1.7.2.)Specified Wind Load

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with the remainder of this Section, or CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of Buildings
unique_id: Where the superstructure of a detached building conforms to the requirements of the deformation resistance test in CSA Z240.2.1-09 Structural Requirements for Manufactured Homes the foundation shall be constructed in conformance with the remainder of this Section, or CSA Z240.10.1-16 Site Preparation, Foundation, and Installation of BuildingsFoundations for Deformation-Resistant Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in construction camps shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 minfire-resistance rating.
unique_id: Except for sleeping rooms within dwelling units, sleeping rooms in construction camps shall be separated from each other and from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 30 minfire-resistance rating.Separation of Sleeping Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)
unique_id: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)Principal Ventilation System

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where multiple HVAC systems serve a single space, the energy model calculations for the proposed house shall call each system in the order of priority established by the system control in the proposed house.
unique_id: Where multiple HVAC systems serve a single space, the energy model calculations for the proposed house shall call each system in the order of priority established by the system control in the proposed house.Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.
unique_id: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.Required Ventilation

ARTICLE_TITLE: External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the design of the main structural system of the building, which is affected by wind pressures on more than one surface, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6..
unique_id: For the design of the main structural system of the building, which is affected by wind pressures on more than one surface, the values of CpCg are provided in Figure 4.1.7.6..External Pressure Coefficients for Low Buildings

ARTICLE_TITLE: Anchoring Wood-Frame Roof Systems to Masonry Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(2), roof systems of wood-frame construction shall be anchored to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts, spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, embedded not less than 90 mm into the masonry, and fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.20.11.4.(2), roof systems of wood-frame construction shall be anchored to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts, spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, embedded not less than 90 mm into the masonry, and fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.Anchoring Wood-Frame Roof Systems to Masonry Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation – Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density – Application
unique_id: Spray-applied polyurethane insulation shall be installed in accordance with ULC CAN/ULC-S705.2-05 Thermal Insulation – Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density – ApplicationInstallation of Spray-Applied Polyurethane

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Duct linings shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.
unique_id: Duct linings shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.Duct Coverings and Linings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered throughout and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.
unique_id: Except for storeys below the first storey, direct access for firefighting shall be provided from the outdoors to every storey that is not sprinklered throughout and whose floor level is less than 25 m above grade, by at least one unobstructed window or access panel for each 15 m of wall in each wall required to face a street by Subsection 3.2.2.Access to Above-Grade Storeys

ARTICLE_TITLE: Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.4.2.3.(1).)
unique_id: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See Note A-9.4.2.3.(1).)Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.5.14.(5)and 9.36.5.14.(6), the exterior walls, roof-ceiling assembly, doors, walls, exposed floors, and floors of the reference house that are in contact with the ground shall have the same area as those of the proposed house.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 9.36.5.14.(5)and 9.36.5.14.(6), the exterior walls, roof-ceiling assembly, doors, walls, exposed floors, and floors of the reference house that are in contact with the ground shall have the same area as those of the proposed house.Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.
unique_id: Unless the flame-spread rating is referred to herein as a "surface flame-spread rating," it shall apply to any surface of the element being considered that would be exposed by cutting through it as well as to the exposed surface of the element.Flame-Spread Ratings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A refuse chute shall discharge only into a room or bin separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.
unique_id: A refuse chute shall discharge only into a room or bin separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h.Linen and Refuse Chutes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.1. shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses 3.1.5.1.(2)(a)and 3.1.5.1.(2)(b).
unique_id: The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.5.1. shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses 3.1.5.1.(2)(a)and 3.1.5.1.(2)(b).Noncombustible Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Smoke detectors required in Clause 3.2.4.11.(1) shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by the elevator machine room in which the smoke detector is installed.
unique_id: Smoke detectors required in Clause 3.2.4.11.(1) shall, upon actuation, recall the elevators served by the elevator machine room in which the smoke detector is installed.Smoke Detectors

ARTICLE_TITLE: Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The higher mode factor, Mv, and its associated base overturning moment reduction factor, J, shall conform to Table 4.1.8.11.
unique_id: The higher mode factor, Mv, and its associated base overturning moment reduction factor, J, shall conform to Table 4.1.8.11.Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.
unique_id: Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.Heavy Timber Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of this Section, the term "skylight" refers to unit skylights, roof windows and tubular daylighting devices.
unique_id: For the purpose of this Section, the term "skylight" refers to unit skylights, roof windows and tubular daylighting devices.Application

ARTICLE_TITLE: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1).
unique_id: The roofing membrane shall be mopped over the cant strip referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7.(1).Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry

ARTICLE_TITLE: Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22. shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than 10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or 30 s for all other occupancies.
unique_id: The voice communication system referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.22. shall include a means to silence the alert signal and the alarm signal in a 2-stage fire alarm system while voice instructions are being transmitted, but only after the alert signal has initially sounded for not less than 10 s in hospitals that have supervisory personnel on duty for twenty-four hours each day, or 30 s for all other occupancies.Voice Communication Systems for High Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a 2-stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).) (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)
unique_id: If a 2-stage fire alarm system has been installed with an automatic signal silence as described in Sentence 3.2.4.18.(11), the system shall be designed so that any silenced audible signal devices serving dwelling units are reactuated whenever an alarm signal is required to be transmitted as part of the second stage. (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).) (See Note A-3.2.4.18.(7).)Audibility of Alarm Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the slope,  , of a curved roof at its peak is greater than 10°, Ca shall be determined in accordance with the requirements for gable roofs stated in Article 4.1.6.9. using a slope equal to the mean slope of the curved roof.
unique_id: Where the slope,  , of a curved roof at its peak is greater than 10°, Ca shall be determined in accordance with the requirements for gable roofs stated in Article 4.1.6.9. using a slope equal to the mean slope of the curved roof.Arch Roofs, Curved Roofs and Domes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Note A-4.2.4.1.(5).)
unique_id: The foundation of a building shall be designed to satisfy SLS requirements within the limits that the building is designed to accommodate, including total settlement and differential settlement, heave, lateral movement, tilt or rotation. (See Note A-4.2.4.1.(5).)Design Basis

ARTICLE_TITLE: Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.3. shall be fastened to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the anchor.
unique_id: Anchors required in Sentence 9.20.11.3. shall be fastened to the wood framing at one end and shaped to provide a mechanical key at the other end to develop the strength of the anchor.Anchoring Intersecting Wood-Frame Walls to Masonry Walls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.
unique_id: Where storage rooms are required by Part 4 of Division B of the NFC for the storage of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in assembly occupancies, such rooms shall not be located above or below the first storey.Storage Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For buildings having fundamental lateral periods, Ta, of 1.0 s or greater, and where IEFvSa(1.0) is greater than 0.25, shear walls that are other than wood-based and form part of the SFRS shall be continuous from their top to the foundation and shall not have irregularities of Type 4 or 5 as described in Table 4.1.8.6.
unique_id: For buildings having fundamental lateral periods, Ta, of 1.0 s or greater, and where IEFvSa(1.0) is greater than 0.25, shear walls that are other than wood-based and form part of the SFRS shall be continuous from their top to the foundation and shall not have irregularities of Type 4 or 5 as described in Table 4.1.8.6.Additional System Restrictions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3. is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.
unique_id: Where access to a building as required in Sentence 9.10.20.3. is provided by means of a roadway or yard, the design and location of such roadway or yard shall take into account connection with public thoroughfares, weight of firefighting equipment, width of roadway, radius of curves, overhead clearance, location of fire hydrants, location of fire department connections and vehicular parking.Fire Department Access to Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The bottom of an excavation drained by a granular layer shall be graded so that the entire area described in Article 9.14.4.2. is drained to a sump conforming to Article 9.14.5.2.
unique_id: The bottom of an excavation drained by a granular layer shall be graded so that the entire area described in Article 9.14.4.2. is drained to a sump conforming to Article 9.14.5.2.Grading

ARTICLE_TITLE: Operating Schedules, Internal Loads, Service Water Heating Loads and Set-point Temperature
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The reference building’s internal and service water heating loads shall be modeled as being identical to those determined for the proposed building in Sentence 8.4.3.2.(2).
unique_id: The reference building’s internal and service water heating loads shall be modeled as being identical to those determined for the proposed building in Sentence 8.4.3.2.(2).Operating Schedules, Internal Loads, Service Water Heating Loads and Set-point Temperature

ARTICLE_TITLE: Cooling by Direct Use of Outdoor Air (Air Economizer System)
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Systems described in Sentence 5.2.2.8. with cooling capacities of more than 25 kW but less than 70 kW shall incorporate cooling equipment that can operate at less than full capacity, with the lowest stage providing no more than 50% of the full capacity of each system.
unique_id: Systems described in Sentence 5.2.2.8. with cooling capacities of more than 25 kW but less than 70 kW shall incorporate cooling equipment that can operate at less than full capacity, with the lowest stage providing no more than 50% of the full capacity of each system.Cooling by Direct Use of Outdoor Air (Air Economizer System)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heating equipment performance characteristics as a function of part-load shall be modeled in accordance with the part-load performance curves found in Table 8.4.4.21.-A.
unique_id: Heating equipment performance characteristics as a function of part-load shall be modeled in accordance with the part-load performance curves found in Table 8.4.4.21.-A.Heating System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.4.1.(2)and 4.2.4.1.(3), exterior lighting shall be controlled by astronomical time controls, photosensors, a combination of photosensors and timer shut-off switch, or other types of controls that perform the same function as those referred to in Clauses 4.2.4.1.(1)(a)to 4.2.4.1.(1)(c).
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.4.1.(2)and 4.2.4.1.(3), exterior lighting shall be controlled by astronomical time controls, photosensors, a combination of photosensors and timer shut-off switch, or other types of controls that perform the same function as those referred to in Clauses 4.2.4.1.(1)(a)to 4.2.4.1.(1)(c).Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The general lighting in spaces requiring "Bi-Level" lighting control in accordance with Table 4.2.1.6. shall have controls that allow at least one intermediate level of lighting, in addition to "full on" and "full off," that is between 30% and 70% full lighting power, or continuous dimming.
unique_id: The general lighting in spaces requiring "Bi-Level" lighting control in accordance with Table 4.2.1.6. shall have controls that allow at least one intermediate level of lighting, in addition to "full on" and "full off," that is between 30% and 70% full lighting power, or continuous dimming.Interior Lighting Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Operable windows and skylights that act as environmental separators shall have an air leakage rate not greater than 0.5 L/(s·m2) when tested in accordance with CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights at a pressure differential of 75 Pa.
unique_id: Operable windows and skylights that act as environmental separators shall have an air leakage rate not greater than 0.5 L/(s·m2) when tested in accordance with CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights at a pressure differential of 75 Pa.Fenestration

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the duct or opening does not exceed 0.08 m2 in cross-sectional area, air intake dampers required by Sentence 5.2.4.1. are permitted to be manually operated and air outlet dampers required by Sentence 5.2.4.1. are permitted to consist of gravity or spring-operated backflow dampers.
unique_id: Where the duct or opening does not exceed 0.08 m2 in cross-sectional area, air intake dampers required by Sentence 5.2.4.1. are permitted to be manually operated and air outlet dampers required by Sentence 5.2.4.1. are permitted to consist of gravity or spring-operated backflow dampers.Required Dampers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The overall thermal transmittance of fenestration and doors that are not within the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 3.1.1.5. shall be determined from calculations carried out using the procedures described in the ASHRAE 2013 ASHRAE Handbook – Fundamentals or laboratory tests performed in accordance with ASTM C 1363-11 Thermal Performance of Building Materials and Envelope Assemblies by Means of a Hot Box Apparatus using an indoor air temperature of 21±1°C and an outdoor air temperature of –18±1°C measured at the mid-height of the fenestration or door.
unique_id: The overall thermal transmittance of fenestration and doors that are not within the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 3.1.1.5. shall be determined from calculations carried out using the procedures described in the ASHRAE 2013 ASHRAE Handbook – Fundamentals or laboratory tests performed in accordance with ASTM C 1363-11 Thermal Performance of Building Materials and Envelope Assemblies by Means of a Hot Box Apparatus using an indoor air temperature of 21±1°C and an outdoor air temperature of –18±1°C measured at the mid-height of the fenestration or door.Thermal Characteristics of Building Assemblies

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The calculation of allowable fenestration and door area in additions shall be based upon the addition being considered by itself, or the addition being considered together with the existing building, provided that the combined overall thermal transmittance of the addition and existing building meets the prescriptive or trade-off requirements.
unique_id: The calculation of allowable fenestration and door area in additions shall be based upon the addition being considered by itself, or the addition being considered together with the existing building, provided that the combined overall thermal transmittance of the addition and existing building meets the prescriptive or trade-off requirements.Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Insulation on piping conveying chilled fluid shall be provided with vapour barrier protection to prevent condensation, where the surface temperature of the pipe is below the dew point of the air.
unique_id: Insulation on piping conveying chilled fluid shall be provided with vapour barrier protection to prevent condensation, where the surface temperature of the pipe is below the dew point of the air.Protection of Piping Insulation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Daylighted Area Under Roof Monitors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The daylighted area under roof monitors shall refer to the combined daylighted area under each roof monitor without double-counting overlapping areas. (See Note A-4.2.2.4. and 4.2.2.5.(1).)
unique_id: The daylighted area under roof monitors shall refer to the combined daylighted area under each roof monitor without double-counting overlapping areas. (See Note A-4.2.2.4. and 4.2.2.5.(1).)Determination of Daylighted Area Under Roof Monitors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where variable-air-volume fans are used, individual fans having a fan power greater than or equal to 25 kW shall be modeled as forward curved with inlet vanes.
unique_id: Where variable-air-volume fans are used, individual fans having a fan power greater than or equal to 25 kW shall be modeled as forward curved with inlet vanes.Fans

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2), compliance with this Part shall be achieved by following the prescriptive path described in Section 5.2., the trade-off path described in Section 5.3., or the performance path described in Section 5.4. (see Note A-3.1.1.3.(1)(c)). (See Note A-5.1.1.3.(1).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the construction techniques or building components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed by the prescriptive requirements, the performance compliance calculations are permitted to take this increased performance level into account in the determination of the annual energy consumption, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant behaviour.
unique_id: Where the construction techniques or building components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed by the prescriptive requirements, the performance compliance calculations are permitted to take this increased performance level into account in the determination of the annual energy consumption, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant behaviour.General

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Daylighted Area Under Skylights
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The daylighted area under skylights shall refer to the combined daylighted area under each skylight without double-counting overlapping areas. (See Note A-4.2.2.4. and 4.2.2.5.(1).)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Factory-installed plenums and ducts provided as part of equipment tested and rated in accordance with Article 5.2.12.1. need not comply with Sentences 5.2.2.5.(1)and 5.2.2.5.(5), provided they are insulated to a thermal resistance not less than 0.58 m2·°C/W.

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.3.1.(2)and 3.2.3.1.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of walls or portions thereof that are below the exterior ground level and are part of the building envelope shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 18°C.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.3.1.(2)and 3.2.3.1.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of walls or portions thereof that are below the exterior ground level and are part of the building envelope shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 18°C.Thermal Characteristics of Walls in Contact with the Ground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The total annual energy consumption of interior lighting in the proposed building shall be calculated in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2., or except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.3.(4), CSA C873.4-14 Building Energy Estimation Methodology – Part 4 – Energy Consumption for Lighting
unique_id: The total annual energy consumption of interior lighting in the proposed building shall be calculated in accordance with Subsection 4.3.2., or except as provided in Sentence 4.3.1.3.(4), CSA C873.4-14 Building Energy Estimation Methodology – Part 4 – Energy Consumption for LightingCompliance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a component of the building envelope is protected by an enclosed unconditioned space, such as a sun porch, enclosed veranda or vestibule, the unconditioned enclosure may be considered to have an overall thermal transmittance of 6.25 W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.1.1.7.(5).)
unique_id: Where a component of the building envelope is protected by an enclosed unconditioned space, such as a sun porch, enclosed veranda or vestibule, the unconditioned enclosure may be considered to have an overall thermal transmittance of 6.25 W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.1.1.7.(5).)Calculation of Overall Thermal Transmittance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For ducts tested in accordance with Sentence 5.2.2.4.(1), the maximum permitted leakage shall be calculated as follows: Lmax=CL P2490 .65whereLmax= maximum permitted leakage, in L/s/m2 of duct surface area, CL= leakage class taken from Table 5.2.2.4., in L/s per m2, and P= maximum operating static pressure, in Pa.
unique_id: For ducts tested in accordance with Sentence 5.2.2.4.(1), the maximum permitted leakage shall be calculated as follows: Lmax=CL P2490 .65whereLmax= maximum permitted leakage, in L/s/m2 of duct surface area, CL= leakage class taken from Table 5.2.2.4., in L/s per m2, and P= maximum operating static pressure, in Pa.Leakage Testing of Ducts

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Zones with a total heating or cooling capacity requirement of less than 5 kW may be controlled by readily accessible manual controls.
unique_id: Zones with a total heating or cooling capacity requirement of less than 5 kW may be controlled by readily accessible manual controls.Off-hours Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The normalized tank diameter, Dnorm, shall be calculated using the following equation: Dnorm=0.63384STS1/3whereSTS= storage tank size, in m3, as per specification.
unique_id: The normalized tank diameter, Dnorm, shall be calculated using the following equation: Dnorm=0.63384STS1/3whereSTS= storage tank size, in m3, as per specification.Determination of Normalized Tank Diameter

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Section, "total degree-days"  shall mean the sum of heating degree-days  below 18°C and cooling degree-days  above 13°C.
unique_id: For the purposes of this Section, "total degree-days"  shall mean the sum of heating degree-days  below 18°C and cooling degree-days  above 13°C.Definition

FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC piping shall be designed and installed in accordance with the NBC.
unique_id: HVAC piping shall be designed and installed in accordance with the NBC.Design and Installation of Piping

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Effective Annual Operational Times
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The effective annual daytime operational time of the non-daylighted area, teff,day,NDL,i, in h/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: teff,day,NDL,i=tday,i Focc,i F pers,iwheretday,i= annual operational time of the space during daytime, in h, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.6., Focc,i= factor for occupancy control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10., and Fpers,i= factor for personal control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10.
unique_id: The effective annual daytime operational time of the non-daylighted area, teff,day,NDL,i, in h/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: teff,day,NDL,i=tday,i Focc,i F pers,iwheretday,i= annual operational time of the space during daytime, in h, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.6., Focc,i= factor for occupancy control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10., and Fpers,i= factor for personal control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10.Determination of Effective Annual Operational Times

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heat-recovery ventilators used to meet the requirements of Sentence 5.2.10.4. shall have a sensible-heat-recovery efficiency, when tested in conformance with the low-temperature thermal and ventilation test methods described in CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators of at least 65% at an outside air test temperature of 0°C, and not less than that required by Table 5.2.10.4. for the 2.5% January design temperature for the building’s location, as listed in Table A-. (See Note A-5.2.10.4.(2).)
unique_id: Heat-recovery ventilators used to meet the requirements of Sentence 5.2.10.4. shall have a sensible-heat-recovery efficiency, when tested in conformance with the low-temperature thermal and ventilation test methods described in CSA CAN/CSA-C439-09 Rating the Performance of Heat/Energy-Recovery Ventilators of at least 65% at an outside air test temperature of 0°C, and not less than that required by Table 5.2.10.4. for the 2.5% January design temperature for the building’s location, as listed in Table A-. (See Note A-5.2.10.4.(2).)Heat Recovery in Dwelling Units

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Trade-off Value of Components, ToVi
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The trade-off value of component i, ToVi, to be used in the equation in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1), shall be determined in accordance with Table 5.3.2.3.
unique_id: The trade-off value of component i, ToVi, to be used in the equation in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1), shall be determined in accordance with Table 5.3.2.3.Determination of Trade-off Value of Components, ToVi

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The pumping flow rate shall be set considering the cooling tower’s capacity, use of pure water, and a 6°C temperature drop.
unique_id: The pumping flow rate shall be set considering the cooling tower’s capacity, use of pure water, and a 6°C temperature drop.Cooling Tower Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for supply ducts located upstream of zone coils, mixing boxes, variable-air-volume boxes and diffusers with integral variable-air-volume controls, supply ducts located within the conditioned space to which they supply air need not comply with Sentence 5.2.2.3.(1). (See Note A-5.2.2.3.(4).)
unique_id: Except for supply ducts located upstream of zone coils, mixing boxes, variable-air-volume boxes and diffusers with integral variable-air-volume controls, supply ducts located within the conditioned space to which they supply air need not comply with Sentence 5.2.2.3.(1). (See Note A-5.2.2.3.(4).)Duct Sealing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall determine how many hours the primary system, secondary system and terminal device loads are not met.
unique_id: The energy model calculations shall determine how many hours the primary system, secondary system and terminal device loads are not met.HVAC Systems Calculations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 5.2.4.2.(3)and 5.2.4.2.(4), dampers required by Article 5.2.4.1. shall be located as near as possible to the plane of the building envelope, and designed to close automatically when the HVAC system is not in operation.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 5.2.4.2.(3)and 5.2.4.2.(4), dampers required by Article 5.2.4.1. shall be located as near as possible to the plane of the building envelope, and designed to close automatically when the HVAC system is not in operation.Type and Location of Dampers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where it is impractical to control air distribution as described in Sentence 5.2.11.2.(1), individual air distribution systems shall serve airflow control areas no greater than 2 500 m2.
unique_id: Where it is impractical to control air distribution as described in Sentence 5.2.11.2.(1), individual air distribution systems shall serve airflow control areas no greater than 2 500 m2.Airflow Control Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where purchased energy is used for cooling, the equipment used to provide this energy shall be modeled as an electric air-cooled chiller that is sized for the peak cooling load provided by the purchased energy system, and complies with Table 8.4.3.5.
unique_id: Where purchased energy is used for cooling, the equipment used to provide this energy shall be modeled as an electric air-cooled chiller that is sized for the peak cooling load provided by the purchased energy system, and complies with Table 8.4.3.5.Purchased Energy

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dwelling units shall be provided with manually operated or automatic devices as a means to reduce the heating of each room, as appropriate for the heating system used.
unique_id: Dwelling units shall be provided with manually operated or automatic devices as a means to reduce the heating of each room, as appropriate for the heating system used.Temperature Control within Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the reference building contains a furnace, it shall be modeled as follows: the heating capacity of the furnace shall be the sum of the heating loads of the thermal blocks served by the furnace, multiplied by the applicable oversize factor, where the heating capacity is not greater than 66 kW, the furnace shall be modeled with two stages of equal capacity, and where the heating capacity is greater than 66 kW, the furnace shall be modeled with a number of stages equal to its capacity divided by 66 kW and rounded up to the nearest integer.
unique_id: Where the reference building contains a furnace, it shall be modeled as follows: the heating capacity of the furnace shall be the sum of the heating loads of the thermal blocks served by the furnace, multiplied by the applicable oversize factor, where the heating capacity is not greater than 66 kW, the furnace shall be modeled with two stages of equal capacity, and where the heating capacity is greater than 66 kW, the furnace shall be modeled with a number of stages equal to its capacity divided by 66 kW and rounded up to the nearest integer.Heating System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Tables 8.4.4.7.-Aand 8.4.4.7.-B indicate that a heating system is required in the secondary system as well as in a terminal device, the heating capacity of each type of equipment shall be set as follows: the heating capacity of the terminal device shall meet the thermal block’s heating load due to the transfer of energy through the building envelope only, the combined heating capacities of the heating systems in the terminal device and secondary system shall meet the peak heating load of the thermal blocks served by those systems, and the applicable oversize factor shall apply to each type of equipment.
unique_id: Where Tables 8.4.4.7.-Aand 8.4.4.7.-B indicate that a heating system is required in the secondary system as well as in a terminal device, the heating capacity of each type of equipment shall be set as follows: the heating capacity of the terminal device shall meet the thermal block’s heating load due to the transfer of energy through the building envelope only, the combined heating capacities of the heating systems in the terminal device and secondary system shall meet the peak heating load of the thermal blocks served by those systems, and the applicable oversize factor shall apply to each type of equipment.Heating System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Article 5.2.2.7. applies to a proposed building’s HVAC system, the HVAC systems of the corresponding thermal blocks in the reference building shall be modeled in accordance with that Article and Table 8.4.4.12. (See Note A-8.4.4.13.)
unique_id: Where Article 5.2.2.7. applies to a proposed building’s HVAC system, the HVAC systems of the corresponding thermal blocks in the reference building shall be modeled in accordance with that Article and Table 8.4.4.12. (See Note A-8.4.4.13.)Cooling with Outside Air

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of determining the daylighted area under skylights, the calculations shall be performed assuming a single square skylight positioned at the centre of each thermal block that is sized to meet the maximum skylight-to-roof ratio permitted by Article 3.2.1.4., and whose projection onto the floor extends horizontally in all directions for a distance equal to 0.5 times the ceiling height. (See Note A-8.4.4.5.(7).)
unique_id: For the purpose of determining the daylighted area under skylights, the calculations shall be performed assuming a single square skylight positioned at the centre of each thermal block that is sized to meet the maximum skylight-to-roof ratio permitted by Article 3.2.1.4., and whose projection onto the floor extends horizontally in all directions for a distance equal to 0.5 times the ceiling height. (See Note A-8.4.4.5.(7).)Lighting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 8.4.4.5.(2)and 8.4.4.5.(3), the installed interior lighting power of the reference building shall be set at the interior lighting power allowance determined in Article 4.2.1.5.or 4.2.1.6., as applicable.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 8.4.4.5.(2)and 8.4.4.5.(3), the installed interior lighting power of the reference building shall be set at the interior lighting power allowance determined in Article 4.2.1.5.or 4.2.1.6., as applicable.Lighting

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.9.
unique_id: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.9.Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 5.2.2.3.(2)to 5.2.2.3.(5), air-handling ducts and plenums forming part of a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system shall be constructed, installed and sealed as described in the SMACNA ANSI/SMACNA 006-2006 HVAC Duct Construction Standards – Metal and Flexible and in accordance with Table 5.2.2.3. (See Note A-5.2.2.3.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 5.2.2.3.(2)to 5.2.2.3.(5), air-handling ducts and plenums forming part of a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system shall be constructed, installed and sealed as described in the SMACNA ANSI/SMACNA 006-2006 HVAC Duct Construction Standards – Metal and Flexible and in accordance with Table 5.2.2.3. (See Note A-5.2.2.3.(1).)Duct Sealing

ARTICLE_TITLE: Limits to Installed Interior Lighting Power
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The individual power allowances in each space of the building do not have to be met, provided the total installed interior lighting power is not exceeded.
unique_id: The individual power allowances in each space of the building do not have to be met, provided the total installed interior lighting power is not exceeded.Limits to Installed Interior Lighting Power

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pressure booster systems shall be provided with at least one pressure sensor that starts and stops the system or varies the pump speed so that the pressure required for operation of the service water system is maintained. (See Note A-6.2.8.2.(1).)
unique_id: Pressure booster systems shall be provided with at least one pressure sensor that starts and stops the system or varies the pump speed so that the pressure required for operation of the service water system is maintained. (See Note A-6.2.8.2.(1).)Pressure Control

ARTICLE_TITLE: Internal and Service Water Heating Loads
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Miscellaneous equipment located within a conditioned space that affects the energy consumption of one or more of the building systems described in Sentence 8.4.2.2. shall be included in the energy model and its energy consumption shall be calculated.
unique_id: Miscellaneous equipment located within a conditioned space that affects the energy consumption of one or more of the building systems described in Sentence 8.4.2.2. shall be included in the energy model and its energy consumption shall be calculated.Internal and Service Water Heating Loads

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for equipment covered by Article 5.2.12.1. whose performance includes heat rejection energy, this Article applies to standalone heat rejection equipment. (See Note A-5.2.12.2.(1).)
unique_id: Except for equipment covered by Article 5.2.12.1. whose performance includes heat rejection energy, this Article applies to standalone heat rejection equipment. (See Note A-5.2.12.2.(1).)Heat Rejection Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.10.(4), the energy type of the reference building’s cooling system shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building’s cooling system.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.10.(4), the energy type of the reference building’s cooling system shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building’s cooling system.Cooling Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a hydronic system is installed, the cooling plant shall be modeled as follows: the cooling capacity of the cooling plant shall be the sum of the cooling capacities of the systems served by the plant, multiplied by the applicable oversize factor, where the cooling capacity is not greater than 2 100 kW, the cooling plant shall be modeled with one water chiller, where the cooling capacity is greater than 2 100 kW, the cooling plant shall be modeled with two water chillers, each having half the capacity of the cooling plant’s capacity, the water chiller’s pumping system shall be modeled as a primary system with constant speed operation, the water chiller’s pumping flow rate shall be set considering the cooling plant’s capacity, use of pure water, and a 6°C temperature rise, the types of water chillers shall be modeled as being identical to those of the proposed building, the chilled water supply temperature shall be set at 7°C, and each water chiller shall be fully modulating down to 25% of its capacity.
unique_id: Where a hydronic system is installed, the cooling plant shall be modeled as follows: the cooling capacity of the cooling plant shall be the sum of the cooling capacities of the systems served by the plant, multiplied by the applicable oversize factor, where the cooling capacity is not greater than 2 100 kW, the cooling plant shall be modeled with one water chiller, where the cooling capacity is greater than 2 100 kW, the cooling plant shall be modeled with two water chillers, each having half the capacity of the cooling plant’s capacity, the water chiller’s pumping system shall be modeled as a primary system with constant speed operation, the water chiller’s pumping flow rate shall be set considering the cooling plant’s capacity, use of pure water, and a 6°C temperature rise, the types of water chillers shall be modeled as being identical to those of the proposed building, the chilled water supply temperature shall be set at 7°C, and each water chiller shall be fully modulating down to 25% of its capacity.Cooling Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dampers in air intakes and outlets serving air-heating or -cooling equipment located outside of the building envelope are permitted to be located within the equipment.
unique_id: Dampers in air intakes and outlets serving air-heating or -cooling equipment located outside of the building envelope are permitted to be located within the equipment.Type and Location of Dampers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The insulated surface areas of roof assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated along the plane of the insulation using dimensions measured to the exterior surfaces of intersecting exterior walls.
unique_id: The insulated surface areas of roof assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated along the plane of the insulation using dimensions measured to the exterior surfaces of intersecting exterior walls.Building Envelope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for systems whose storage capacity is less than 100 L, each service water heating system shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled shut-off device that allows the system, including any heating elements installed along the pipes to maintain temperature, to be shut-off. (See Note A-6.2.4.2.(1).)
unique_id: Except for systems whose storage capacity is less than 100 L, each service water heating system shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled shut-off device that allows the system, including any heating elements installed along the pipes to maintain temperature, to be shut-off. (See Note A-6.2.4.2.(1).)Shutdown

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Branch circuit conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 3% at design load.
unique_id: Branch circuit conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 3% at design load.Branch Circuits

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Effective Annual Operational Times
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The effective annual daytime operational time of the daylighted area, teff,day,DL,i, in h/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: teff,day,DL,i=tday,i FDL,i F occ,i Fpers,iwheretday,i= annual operational time of the space during daytime, in h, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.6., FDL,i= factor for daylight harvesting determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.7., Focc,i= factor for occupancy control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10., and Fpers,i= factor for personal control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10.
unique_id: The effective annual daytime operational time of the daylighted area, teff,day,DL,i, in h/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: teff,day,DL,i=tday,i FDL,i F occ,i Fpers,iwheretday,i= annual operational time of the space during daytime, in h, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.6., FDL,i= factor for daylight harvesting determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.7., Focc,i= factor for occupancy control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10., and Fpers,i= factor for personal control determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.10.Determination of Effective Annual Operational Times

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Feeder conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 2% at design load.
unique_id: Feeder conductors shall be sized for a maximum voltage drop of 2% at design load.Feeders

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the proposed building uses purchased energy for space heating or cooling or service water heating, Sentences 8.4.3.5.(2)to 8.4.3.5. shall apply.
unique_id: Where the proposed building uses purchased energy for space heating or cooling or service water heating, Sentences 8.4.3.5.(2)to 8.4.3.5. shall apply.Purchased Energy

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Daylighted Area Under Roof Monitors
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The daylighted area under each roof monitor shall be calculated as the product of Clauses 4.2.2.4.(2)(a)and 4.2.2.4.(2)(b): the width of the vertical glazing above the ceiling plus the smallest of the following measurements applied to each side of the glazing: 0.6 m, the distance to any vertical obstruction that is 1.5 m or more in height, or the distance to the edge of any primary sidelighted area, and the smallest of the following measurements applied horizontally from the bottom edge of the glazing: the monitor’s sill height, which is the vertical distance from the floor to the bottom edge of the monitor’s glazing, or the distance to the nearest face of any vertical obstruction where any part of the obstruction is farther away than the difference between the height of the obstruction and the monitor’s sill height. (See Note A-4.2.2.4.(2).)
unique_id: The daylighted area under each roof monitor shall be calculated as the product of Clauses 4.2.2.4.(2)(a)and 4.2.2.4.(2)(b): the width of the vertical glazing above the ceiling plus the smallest of the following measurements applied to each side of the glazing: 0.6 m, the distance to any vertical obstruction that is 1.5 m or more in height, or the distance to the edge of any primary sidelighted area, and the smallest of the following measurements applied horizontally from the bottom edge of the glazing: the monitor’s sill height, which is the vertical distance from the floor to the bottom edge of the monitor’s glazing, or the distance to the nearest face of any vertical obstruction where any part of the obstruction is farther away than the difference between the height of the obstruction and the monitor’s sill height. (See Note A-4.2.2.4.(2).)Determination of Daylighted Area Under Roof Monitors

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Floors in Contact with the Ground
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Floors-on-ground with no embedded heating ducts, cables or heating or cooling pipes that are required to be insulated shall have insulation placed on their top or bottom surface for a distance of not less than 1.2 m from their perimeter or over their full area as shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category.
unique_id: Floors-on-ground with no embedded heating ducts, cables or heating or cooling pipes that are required to be insulated shall have insulation placed on their top or bottom surface for a distance of not less than 1.2 m from their perimeter or over their full area as shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category.Thermal Characteristics of Floors in Contact with the Ground

ARTICLE_TITLE: Loop Temperature Reset for Chilled- and Hot-Water Systems
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Chilled- and hot-water systems described in Sentence 5.2.11.5. that are designed with variable-flow pumping complying with Sentence 5.2.6.2. need not be equipped with loop temperature reset controls.
unique_id: Chilled- and hot-water systems described in Sentence 5.2.11.5. that are designed with variable-flow pumping complying with Sentence 5.2.6.2. need not be equipped with loop temperature reset controls.Loop Temperature Reset for Chilled- and Hot-Water Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Part is concerned with the transfer of heat and air through building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope, and interfaces between building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope.
unique_id: This Part is concerned with the transfer of heat and air through building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope, and interfaces between building materials, components and assemblies forming part of the building envelope.Scope

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Calculations carried out to ensure compliance with this Code and not described in the balance of this Subsection or in other Parts of the Code shall be carried out using procedures recognized for the particular purposes, such as those described in, but not limited to: ASHRAE Handbooks, Standards and Guidelines, HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest Hydronics Institute Manuals, and ISO 13790:2008 Energy performance of buildings – Calculation of energy use for space heating and cooling
unique_id: Calculations carried out to ensure compliance with this Code and not described in the balance of this Subsection or in other Parts of the Code shall be carried out using procedures recognized for the particular purposes, such as those described in, but not limited to: ASHRAE Handbooks, Standards and Guidelines, HRAI SAR-G1 HRAI Digest Hydronics Institute Manuals, and ISO 13790:2008 Energy performance of buildings – Calculation of energy use for space heating and coolingCalculation Procedures

ARTICLE_TITLE: Control of Space Temperature by Reheating or Recooling
FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC systems that are designed to reduce the air supplied to each temperature-control zone to no more than 2 L/s per m2 of floor surface area of the temperature-control zone before reheating, recooling or mixing of supply air takes place need not comply with Sentences 5.2.8.8.(1)to 5.2.8.8.(3).
unique_id: HVAC systems that are designed to reduce the air supplied to each temperature-control zone to no more than 2 L/s per m2 of floor surface area of the temperature-control zone before reheating, recooling or mixing of supply air takes place need not comply with Sentences 5.2.8.8.(1)to 5.2.8.8.(3).Control of Space Temperature by Reheating or Recooling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Article, roof assemblies shall be considered to include all related structural framing.
unique_id: For the purposes of this Article, roof assemblies shall be considered to include all related structural framing.Calculation of Overall Thermal Transmittance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Skylights whose overall thermal transmittance exceeds the values shown in Table 3.2.2.3. are permitted, provided that the total area of such skylights does not exceed 2% of the gross roof area calculated in accordance with Article 3.1.1.6., and the overall thermal transmittance of such skylights is not more than 3.4 W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.2.2.3.(4).)
unique_id: Skylights whose overall thermal transmittance exceeds the values shown in Table 3.2.2.3. are permitted, provided that the total area of such skylights does not exceed 2% of the gross roof area calculated in accordance with Article 3.1.1.6., and the overall thermal transmittance of such skylights is not more than 3.4 W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.2.2.3.(4).)Thermal Characteristics of Fenestration

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The insulated surface areas of wall assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated using dimensions measured horizontally to the exterior surfaces of perimeter wall assemblies in contact with the ground, and vertically from the exterior ground level to the underside of intersecting floors in contact with the ground.
unique_id: The insulated surface areas of wall assemblies in contact with the ground shall be calculated using dimensions measured horizontally to the exterior surfaces of perimeter wall assemblies in contact with the ground, and vertically from the exterior ground level to the underside of intersecting floors in contact with the ground.Building Envelope

ARTICLE_TITLE: Control of Space Temperature by Reheating or Recooling
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.8.8.(4), HVAC systems that control the temperature of a space by mixing heated supply air and cooled supply air shall be equipped with controls that automatically adjust the temperature of the warm supply air to the lowest temperature that will satisfy the temperature-control zone requiring the warmest air, and automatically adjust the temperature of the cool supply air to the highest temperature that will satisfy the temperature-control zone requiring the coolest air.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.8.8.(4), HVAC systems that control the temperature of a space by mixing heated supply air and cooled supply air shall be equipped with controls that automatically adjust the temperature of the warm supply air to the lowest temperature that will satisfy the temperature-control zone requiring the warmest air, and automatically adjust the temperature of the cool supply air to the highest temperature that will satisfy the temperature-control zone requiring the coolest air.Control of Space Temperature by Reheating or Recooling

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All lighting schedule controllers shall be equipped with backup provisions to retain programming and the time setting for at least 10 h during a power outage. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.)
unique_id: All lighting schedule controllers shall be equipped with backup provisions to retain programming and the time setting for at least 10 h during a power outage. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.)Requirements

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Primary and Secondary Sidelighted Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The depth of the primary sidelighted area shall be calculated as the horizontal distance perpendicular to the glazing that is the smaller of the following values: one window head height, which is the distance from the floor to the top of the glazing, or the distance to any vertical obstruction that is 1.5 m or more in height.
unique_id: The depth of the primary sidelighted area shall be calculated as the horizontal distance perpendicular to the glazing that is the smaller of the following values: one window head height, which is the distance from the floor to the top of the glazing, or the distance to any vertical obstruction that is 1.5 m or more in height.Determination of Primary and Secondary Sidelighted Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of compliance calculations, the reference building’s HVAC systems determined in accordance with Article 8.4.4.7. shall be modeled without substituting their components with thermodynamically similar components or using approximated calculations.
unique_id: For the purpose of compliance calculations, the reference building’s HVAC systems determined in accordance with Article 8.4.4.7. shall be modeled without substituting their components with thermodynamically similar components or using approximated calculations.HVAC Systems Calculations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the building envelope components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed in Section 3.2., the trade-off calculation is permitted to take this increased performance level into account, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant interaction.
unique_id: Where the building envelope components used are more energy-efficient than those prescribed in Section 3.2., the trade-off calculation is permitted to take this increased performance level into account, provided it can be quantified and is not dependent on occupant interaction.Application and Limitations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.18.(6), HVAC systems - 1 to 5 and 7 of Table 8.4.4.7.-B shall be modeled with a supply air temperature that is reset according to the thermal block’s load, a supply fan that has a static pressure of 640 Pa and a combined fan-motor efficiency of 40%, and no return fan.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.18.(6), HVAC systems - 1 to 5 and 7 of Table 8.4.4.7.-B shall be modeled with a supply air temperature that is reset according to the thermal block’s load, a supply fan that has a static pressure of 640 Pa and a combined fan-motor efficiency of 40%, and no return fan.Supply Air Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each dwelling unit shall be controlled by at least one thermostatic control device.
unique_id: Each dwelling unit shall be controlled by at least one thermostatic control device.Temperature Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC pumping systems that are used on a seasonal basis shall be equipped with automatic controls, or readily accessible and clearly labeled manual controls that allow them to be shut down when not required.
unique_id: HVAC pumping systems that are used on a seasonal basis shall be equipped with automatic controls, or readily accessible and clearly labeled manual controls that allow them to be shut down when not required.Seasonal Shutdown

ARTICLE_TITLE: Maintaining Temperature of Hot Service Water
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heating elements installed along service water heating system pipes to maintain the water temperature shall incorporate automatic controls that maintain the temperature of the hot water within the range required for the intended use.
unique_id: Heating elements installed along service water heating system pipes to maintain the water temperature shall incorporate automatic controls that maintain the temperature of the hot water within the range required for the intended use.Maintaining Temperature of Hot Service Water

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of the Installed Interior Lighting Power
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Luminaire wattage to be included in installed interior lighting power shall be determined in accordance with the following criteria: except as provided in Clause 4.2.1.4.(3)(b), the wattage of luminaires shall be the design operating input wattage of the lamp/auxiliary combination based on values provided by a recognized testing laboratory or, in the absence of such information, the maximum labeled wattage of the luminaire shall be used (see Note A-4.2.1.4.(3)(a)), the wattage of luminaires with ballasts designed for multiple wattages shall be the maximum labeled wattage of the luminaire, for line-voltage lighting track and plug-in busway designed to allow the addition and/or relocation of luminaires without altering the wiring of the system, the wattage shall be the specified wattage of the luminaires included in the system with a minimum of 98 W/m, the wattage limit of the system’s circuit breaker, or the wattage limit of other permanent current-limiting device on the system, the wattage of low-voltage lighting track, cable conductor, rail conductor, and other flexible lighting systems that allow the addition and/or relocation of luminaires without altering the wiring of the system shall be the specified wattage of the transformer supplying the system, and the wattage of all other miscellaneous lighting equipment shall be the specified wattage of the lighting equipment.
unique_id: Luminaire wattage to be included in installed interior lighting power shall be determined in accordance with the following criteria: except as provided in Clause 4.2.1.4.(3)(b), the wattage of luminaires shall be the design operating input wattage of the lamp/auxiliary combination based on values provided by a recognized testing laboratory or, in the absence of such information, the maximum labeled wattage of the luminaire shall be used (see Note A-4.2.1.4.(3)(a)), the wattage of luminaires with ballasts designed for multiple wattages shall be the maximum labeled wattage of the luminaire, for line-voltage lighting track and plug-in busway designed to allow the addition and/or relocation of luminaires without altering the wiring of the system, the wattage shall be the specified wattage of the luminaires included in the system with a minimum of 98 W/m, the wattage limit of the system’s circuit breaker, or the wattage limit of other permanent current-limiting device on the system, the wattage of low-voltage lighting track, cable conductor, rail conductor, and other flexible lighting systems that allow the addition and/or relocation of luminaires without altering the wiring of the system shall be the specified wattage of the transformer supplying the system, and the wattage of all other miscellaneous lighting equipment shall be the specified wattage of the lighting equipment.Determination of the Installed Interior Lighting Power

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An independent perimeter heating and cooling system designed to offset only building envelope heat losses or gains, or both, is permitted to be used, provided it includes at least one thermostatic control for each building exposure having exterior walls facing only one orientation for an uninterrupted distance of 15 m or more (see Note A-5.2.8.5.(2)(a)), and its heating and cooling energy supply is controlled by thermostat located within the zone it serves.
unique_id: An independent perimeter heating and cooling system designed to offset only building envelope heat losses or gains, or both, is permitted to be used, provided it includes at least one thermostatic control for each building exposure having exterior walls facing only one orientation for an uninterrupted distance of 15 m or more (see Note A-5.2.8.5.(2)(a)), and its heating and cooling energy supply is controlled by thermostat located within the zone it serves.Space Temperature Control

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Peak Daily Flow Ratio
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The peak daily flow ratio, PDR, shall be calculated using the following equation: PDR=ToV7 ToV9+ToV8 ToV 10+AFOU 1-ToV9-ToV105.7 ToV9+7.6 ToV10+AFOU 1-To V9-ToV10whereToV7= average flow of all faucets, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV8= average flow of all showers, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV9= faucet flow ratio, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV10= shower flow ratio, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., and AFOU= average flow of other uses, in L/min, as per specification.
unique_id: The peak daily flow ratio, PDR, shall be calculated using the following equation: PDR=ToV7 ToV9+ToV8 ToV 10+AFOU 1-ToV9-ToV105.7 ToV9+7.6 ToV10+AFOU 1-To V9-ToV10whereToV7= average flow of all faucets, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV8= average flow of all showers, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV9= faucet flow ratio, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., ToV10= shower flow ratio, determined as per Article 6.3.2.5., and AFOU= average flow of other uses, in L/min, as per specification.Determination of Peak Daily Flow Ratio

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A SWH system shall be deemed to comply with Section 6.3. if its SWH trade-off index, SWH-TOI, as calculated in accordance with Subsection 6.3.2., is greater than or equal to 0.
unique_id: A SWH system shall be deemed to comply with Section 6.3. if its SWH trade-off index, SWH-TOI, as calculated in accordance with Subsection 6.3.2., is greater than or equal to 0.Compliance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In variable-air-volume systems, any individual supply, relief or return fan with a power demand equal to or greater than 25 kW, as calculated using the equation in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(1), shall incorporate controls and devices necessary to prevent the fan motor from demanding more than 30% of design wattage at 50% of design air volume, based on the manufacturer’s test data.
unique_id: In variable-air-volume systems, any individual supply, relief or return fan with a power demand equal to or greater than 25 kW, as calculated using the equation in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(1), shall incorporate controls and devices necessary to prevent the fan motor from demanding more than 30% of design wattage at 50% of design air volume, based on the manufacturer’s test data.Variable-Air-Volume Fan Systems
