FRAG_DOCUMENT: Service water systems shall be designed in accordance with the relevant provincial, territorial or municipal building regulations or, in the absence of such regulations, or where service water systems are not covered by such regulations, with the NPC.
unique_id: Service water systems shall be designed in accordance with the relevant provincial, territorial or municipal building regulations or, in the absence of such regulations, or where service water systems are not covered by such regulations, with the NPC.Regulations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Primary and Secondary Sidelighted Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each primary sidelighted area, which is the floor area directly adjacent to vertical glazing below the ceiling, shall be calculated as the product of the width of the primary sidelighted area, as determined in Sentence 4.2.2.3.(3), and its depth, as determined in Sentence 4.2.2.3.(4).
unique_id: Each primary sidelighted area, which is the floor area directly adjacent to vertical glazing below the ceiling, shall be calculated as the product of the width of the primary sidelighted area, as determined in Sentence 4.2.2.3.(3), and its depth, as determined in Sentence 4.2.2.3.(4).Determination of Primary and Secondary Sidelighted Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for overall thermal transmittance, fenestration shall be modeled with thermal and optical properties that are identical to those used for the proposed building. (See Note A-8.4.4.3.(8).)
unique_id: Except for overall thermal transmittance, fenestration shall be modeled with thermal and optical properties that are identical to those used for the proposed building. (See Note A-8.4.4.3.(8).)Building Envelope Components

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If, during construction, the design is found to be altered from the one used in the original performance assessment, the building shall be reassessed for compliance with this Part.
unique_id: If, during construction, the design is found to be altered from the one used in the original performance assessment, the building shall be reassessed for compliance with this Part.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Subsection, the power demand of a fan system shall be the sum of the demand of all fans required to operate at design conditions to supply air to the conditioned space. (See Note A-5.2.3.1.(2).)
unique_id: For the purposes of this Subsection, the power demand of a fan system shall be the sum of the demand of all fans required to operate at design conditions to supply air to the conditioned space. (See Note A-5.2.3.1.(2).)Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: General lighting in the following areas need not comply with Sentence 4.2.2.1.(10): primary sidelighted areas where the vertical projected distance from the top of the windows to the top of any adjacent structure divided by the horizontal distance from the window to the adjacent structure is greater than or equal to 2, sidelighted areas where the total glazing area is less than 2 m2, and retail spaces.
unique_id: General lighting in the following areas need not comply with Sentence 4.2.2.1.(10): primary sidelighted areas where the vertical projected distance from the top of the windows to the top of any adjacent structure divided by the horizontal distance from the window to the adjacent structure is greater than or equal to 2, sidelighted areas where the total glazing area is less than 2 m2, and retail spaces.Interior Lighting Controls

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fenestration and door areas shall be calculated to the rough opening in the wall and shall include all related frame and sash members. (See Note A-3.1.1.6.(1).)
unique_id: Fenestration and door areas shall be calculated to the rough opening in the wall and shall include all related frame and sash members. (See Note A-3.1.1.6.(1).)Calculation of Fenestration and Door Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).
unique_id: This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).Limitations

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Floors in Contact with the Ground
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.3.3.(2)and 3.2.3.3.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of floors separating conditioned space from the ground that are less than 0.6 m below grade shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 18°C.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.3.3.(2)and 3.2.3.3.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of floors separating conditioned space from the ground that are less than 0.6 m below grade shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 18°C.Thermal Characteristics of Floors in Contact with the Ground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where mechanical ducts and chases or electrical system components, such as pipes, ducts, conduits, cabinets, panels, or recessed heaters, are placed within and parallel to the building envelope, the overall thermal transmittance of the building envelope at the projected area of the mechanical or electrical system components shall not be increased.
unique_id: Where mechanical ducts and chases or electrical system components, such as pipes, ducts, conduits, cabinets, panels, or recessed heaters, are placed within and parallel to the building envelope, the overall thermal transmittance of the building envelope at the projected area of the mechanical or electrical system components shall not be increased.Continuity of Insulation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC systems with multiple boilers shall incorporate a means for preventing heat loss through the boilers when they are not operating, such as a device that prevents the flow of heat-carrying fluid through the boilers or dampers installed in the flues.
unique_id: HVAC systems with multiple boilers shall incorporate a means for preventing heat loss through the boilers when they are not operating, such as a device that prevents the flow of heat-carrying fluid through the boilers or dampers installed in the flues.Multiple Boilers

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Installed Interior Lighting Energy
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The annual energy consumption of interior lighting in a space, Ei,proposed, in (W·h)/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: Ei,proposed=pi ADL,i  teff,day,DL,i+teff,night,i +ANDL,i teff,day,NDL,i+teff,nigh t,iwherepi= lighting power density in the space, in W/m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.2., ADL,i= daylighted area, in m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.3., ANDL,i= non-daylighted area, in m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.4., teff,day,DL,i= effective annual daytime operational time of daylighted area, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5., teff,day,NDL,i= effective annual daytime operational time of non-daylighted area, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5., and teff,night,i= effective annual nighttime operational time, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5.
unique_id: The annual energy consumption of interior lighting in a space, Ei,proposed, in (W·h)/a, shall be calculated using the following equation: Ei,proposed=pi ADL,i  teff,day,DL,i+teff,night,i +ANDL,i teff,day,NDL,i+teff,nigh t,iwherepi= lighting power density in the space, in W/m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.2., ADL,i= daylighted area, in m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.3., ANDL,i= non-daylighted area, in m2, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.4., teff,day,DL,i= effective annual daytime operational time of daylighted area, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5., teff,day,NDL,i= effective annual daytime operational time of non-daylighted area, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5., and teff,night,i= effective annual nighttime operational time, in h/a, determined in accordance with Article 4.3.2.5.Determination of Installed Interior Lighting Energy

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The thermal characteristics of building envelope materials shall be determined in accordance with the applicable product standards listed in the NBC or, in the absence of such standards or where such standards do not address the determination of thermal characteristics, in accordance with ASTM C 177-13 Steady-State Heat Flux Measurements and Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Guarded-Hot-Plate Apparatus or ASTM C 518-10 Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter Apparatus
unique_id: The thermal characteristics of building envelope materials shall be determined in accordance with the applicable product standards listed in the NBC or, in the absence of such standards or where such standards do not address the determination of thermal characteristics, in accordance with ASTM C 177-13 Steady-State Heat Flux Measurements and Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Guarded-Hot-Plate Apparatus or ASTM C 518-10 Steady-State Thermal Transmission Properties by Means of the Heat Flow Meter ApparatusThermal Characteristics of Building Assemblies

ARTICLE_TITLE: Cooling by Direct Use of Outdoor Air (Air Economizer System)
FRAG_DOCUMENT: HVAC systems that use less mechanical cooling energy by direct use of outdoor air shall be capable of mixing return air with up to 100% outdoor air to produce the temperature required to condition the space.
unique_id: HVAC systems that use less mechanical cooling energy by direct use of outdoor air shall be capable of mixing return air with up to 100% outdoor air to produce the temperature required to condition the space.Cooling by Direct Use of Outdoor Air (Air Economizer System)

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Variable-speed pressure booster systems shall be provided with a hydro-pneumatic storage tank sized to store a volume of water corresponding to at least 1 min of operation at 10% of the system’s design flow rate and pressure.
unique_id: Variable-speed pressure booster systems shall be provided with a hydro-pneumatic storage tank sized to store a volume of water corresponding to at least 1 min of operation at 10% of the system’s design flow rate and pressure.Size of Water Storage Tank

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 8.4.4.20.(2)to 8.4.4.20.(4), the reference building’s service water heating system shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building as regards the following characteristics: storage capacity, power input, and energy type.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 8.4.4.20.(2)to 8.4.4.20.(4), the reference building’s service water heating system shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building as regards the following characteristics: storage capacity, power input, and energy type.Service Water Heating Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for safety devices, pressure-reducing devices shall not be installed on a pressure booster system. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.)
unique_id: Except for safety devices, pressure-reducing devices shall not be installed on a pressure booster system. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.)Pressure Control

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Doors and Access Hatches
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access hatches that are part of a building envelope shall be insulated to a nominal thermal transmittance of not more than 1.3 W/(m2·K), exclusive of stiffeners or edge construction.
unique_id: Access hatches that are part of a building envelope shall be insulated to a nominal thermal transmittance of not more than 1.3 W/(m2·K), exclusive of stiffeners or edge construction.Thermal Characteristics of Doors and Access Hatches

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Back-up systems shall comply with the prescriptive requirements stated in Section 5.2.(See Note A-5.1.1.3.(2).)
unique_id: Back-up systems shall comply with the prescriptive requirements stated in Section 5.2.(See Note A-5.1.1.3.(2).)Compliance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.9.(2), the heating system serving each thermal block of the reference building shall be determined in accordance with Table 8.4.4.7.-A and this Article.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 8.4.4.9.(2), the heating system serving each thermal block of the reference building shall be determined in accordance with Table 8.4.4.7.-A and this Article.Heating System

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where piping insulation has a thermal conductivity, as determined in accordance with Sentence 6.2.3.1.(4), that is greater than the range given in Table 6.2.3.1., the thickness given in the Table shall be increased by the ratio u2/u1, where u1 is the value at the higher end of the conductivity range for the operating temperature and u2 is the measured thermal conductivity of the insulation at the mean rating temperature. (See Note A-6.2.3.1. and .)
unique_id: Where piping insulation has a thermal conductivity, as determined in accordance with Sentence 6.2.3.1.(4), that is greater than the range given in Table 6.2.3.1., the thickness given in the Table shall be increased by the ratio u2/u1, where u1 is the value at the higher end of the conductivity range for the operating temperature and u2 is the measured thermal conductivity of the insulation at the mean rating temperature. (See Note A-6.2.3.1. and .)Insulation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Walls in Contact with the Ground
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of walls or portions thereof that are below the exterior ground level and are part of the building envelope of semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 15°C.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 3.2.3.1.(4), the overall thermal transmittance of walls or portions thereof that are below the exterior ground level and are part of the building envelope of semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), shall be not greater than that shown in Table 3.2.3.1. for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 15°C.Thermal Characteristics of Walls in Contact with the Ground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Air barrier assemblies are permitted to be tested in accordance with ASTM E 2357-11 Determining Air Leakage of Air Barrier Assemblies to meet the air leakage requirement stated in Sentence 3.2.4.2.(2), provided the building is erected in an area where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressures do not exceed 0.65 kPa, and the air barrier assembly is installed on the warm side of the thermal insulation of the opaque building assembly. (See Note A-3.2.4.2. and .)
unique_id: Air barrier assemblies are permitted to be tested in accordance with ASTM E 2357-11 Determining Air Leakage of Air Barrier Assemblies to meet the air leakage requirement stated in Sentence 3.2.4.2.(2), provided the building is erected in an area where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressures do not exceed 0.65 kPa, and the air barrier assembly is installed on the warm side of the thermal insulation of the opaque building assembly. (See Note A-3.2.4.2. and .)Opaque Building Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).
unique_id: This Section does not apply to back-up HVAC systems, which shall comply with Sentence 5.1.1.3.(2).Application Limitation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The operating schedule, priority of use and other operational characteristics of the purchased energy shall be included in the energy model.
unique_id: The operating schedule, priority of use and other operational characteristics of the purchased energy shall be included in the energy model.Purchased Energy

ARTICLE_TITLE: Operating Schedules, Internal Loads, Service Water Heating Loads and Set-point Temperature
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), the set-point temperature of the proposed building shall be that shown in the specifications.
unique_id: For semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), the set-point temperature of the proposed building shall be that shown in the specifications.Operating Schedules, Internal Loads, Service Water Heating Loads and Set-point Temperature

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of the Daylight Supply Factor for Toplighting
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined using Table 4.3.2.9.-A.
unique_id: For spaces where toplighting is the primary daylight supply, the daylight supply factor, CDL,sup,i, shall be determined using Table 4.3.2.9.-A.Determination of the Daylight Supply Factor for Toplighting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: At airflow rates not less than the system design capacity, the sensible-heat-recovery efficiency of a heat-recovery apparatus referred to in Sentence 5.2.10.1. shall be determined in conformance with the test method described in AHRI 1061 (SI)-2013 Performance Rating of Air-to-Air Exchangers for Energy Recovery Ventilation Equipment or another acceptable test method.
unique_id: At airflow rates not less than the system design capacity, the sensible-heat-recovery efficiency of a heat-recovery apparatus referred to in Sentence 5.2.10.1. shall be determined in conformance with the test method described in AHRI 1061 (SI)-2013 Performance Rating of Air-to-Air Exchangers for Energy Recovery Ventilation Equipment or another acceptable test method.Heat-Recovery Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: General lighting need not be controlled in accordance with Sentence 4.2.2.1. where the lighting power density for the space is not greater than 8.6 W/m2, the space is lit by high-intensity discharge  lamps, and the power for the general lighting in the space reduces automatically by 30% or more within 20 min of the space being unoccupied.
unique_id: General lighting need not be controlled in accordance with Sentence 4.2.2.1. where the lighting power density for the space is not greater than 8.6 W/m2, the space is lit by high-intensity discharge  lamps, and the power for the general lighting in the space reduces automatically by 30% or more within 20 min of the space being unoccupied.Interior Lighting Controls

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Above-ground Opaque Building Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.2.(3)and 3.2.2.2. and in Sentence 3.2.1.3.(1), the overall thermal transmittance of above-ground opaque building assemblies in semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), shall be not more than that shown in Table 3.2.2.2. for the building or part thereof enclosed by the opaque building assembly, for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 15°C.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.2.(3)and 3.2.2.2. and in Sentence 3.2.1.3.(1), the overall thermal transmittance of above-ground opaque building assemblies in semi-heated buildings, as defined in Sentence 1.2.1.2.(2), shall be not more than that shown in Table 3.2.2.2. for the building or part thereof enclosed by the opaque building assembly, for the applicable heating-degree-day category taken at 15°C.Thermal Characteristics of Above-ground Opaque Building Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In calculating the overall thermal transmittance of assemblies for purposes of comparison with the provisions in Section 3.2., the thermal bridging effect of major structural members, such as columns and spandrel beams, that are parallel to the plane of the building envelope and partly penetrate that building envelope assembly need not be taken into account, provided they do not increase the overall thermal transmittance at the projected area of the member to more than twice that permitted in Section 3.2. (See Note A-3.1.1.7.(2).)
unique_id: In calculating the overall thermal transmittance of assemblies for purposes of comparison with the provisions in Section 3.2., the thermal bridging effect of major structural members, such as columns and spandrel beams, that are parallel to the plane of the building envelope and partly penetrate that building envelope assembly need not be taken into account, provided they do not increase the overall thermal transmittance at the projected area of the member to more than twice that permitted in Section 3.2. (See Note A-3.1.1.7.(2).)Calculation of Overall Thermal Transmittance

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Above-ground Opaque Building Assemblies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where radiant heating cables or heating or cooling pipes or membranes are embedded in the surface of an above-ground opaque building assembly, this assembly shall have an overall thermal transmittance no greater than 80% of that required by Sentence 3.2.2.2.(1). (See Note A-3.2.2.2.(4).)
unique_id: Where radiant heating cables or heating or cooling pipes or membranes are embedded in the surface of an above-ground opaque building assembly, this assembly shall have an overall thermal transmittance no greater than 80% of that required by Sentence 3.2.2.2.(1). (See Note A-3.2.2.2.(4).)Thermal Characteristics of Above-ground Opaque Building Assemblies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a storage tank is to be modeled, the service water heating system’s storage temperature shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building. (See Note A-8.4.4.20.(7).)
unique_id: Where a storage tank is to be modeled, the service water heating system’s storage temperature shall be modeled as being identical to that of the proposed building. (See Note A-8.4.4.20.(7).)Service Water Heating Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where insufficient information is known about the building’s components, materials and assemblies, the applicable prescriptive requirements in Sections 3.2., 4.2., 5.2., 6.2.and 7.2. shall apply.
unique_id: Where insufficient information is known about the building’s components, materials and assemblies, the applicable prescriptive requirements in Sections 3.2., 4.2., 5.2., 6.2.and 7.2. shall apply.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where part-load performance curves referred to in Sentence 8.4.3.8. are not available, the performance curves provided in Article 8.4.4.21. shall be used. (See Note A-8.4.3.9.)
unique_id: Where part-load performance curves referred to in Sentence 8.4.3.8. are not available, the performance curves provided in Article 8.4.4.21. shall be used. (See Note A-8.4.3.9.)Part-Load Performance Curves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pool heaters shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled device that allows the heater to be shut off without adjusting the thermostat setting, and where applicable, the heater to be restarted without manually relighting the pilot light.
unique_id: Pool heaters shall be equipped with a readily accessible and clearly labeled device that allows the heater to be shut off without adjusting the thermostat setting, and where applicable, the heater to be restarted without manually relighting the pilot light.Controls

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Interior Lighting Power Allowance Using the Building Area Method
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where 10% or more of the gross lighted area of the building can be classified as being of a building type other than the principal type for the building, the interior lighting power allowance shall be calculated using the space-by-space method described in Article 4.2.1.6.
unique_id: Where 10% or more of the gross lighted area of the building can be classified as being of a building type other than the principal type for the building, the interior lighting power allowance shall be calculated using the space-by-space method described in Article 4.2.1.6.Calculation of Interior Lighting Power Allowance Using the Building Area Method

ARTICLE_TITLE: Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The daylight-dependent control factor for electric lighting, CEL,ctrl,i, shall be selected from Table 4.3.2.7.-B.
unique_id: The daylight-dependent control factor for electric lighting, CEL,ctrl,i, shall be selected from Table 4.3.2.7.-B.Determination of Factor for Daylight Harvesting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The overall thermal transmittance, U1, of building assemblies separating conditioned spaces that are intended to be heated to temperatures that differ by more than 10°C shall not be greater than that obtained with the following equation: U1= t2-t0/ t2-0.5 t1-0.5 t 0 Uwheret1= indoor heating design temperature of the colder conditioned space, in °C, t2= indoor heating design temperature of the warmer conditioned space, in °C, t0= outdoor 2.5% January design temperature as specified in Article 1.1.4.1., in °C, and U= overall thermal transmittance required in Sentences 3.2.2.2.(1), 3.2.2.3.(2)and 3.2.2.4.(1), in W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.2.1.3.(1).)
unique_id: The overall thermal transmittance, U1, of building assemblies separating conditioned spaces that are intended to be heated to temperatures that differ by more than 10°C shall not be greater than that obtained with the following equation: U1= t2-t0/ t2-0.5 t1-0.5 t 0 Uwheret1= indoor heating design temperature of the colder conditioned space, in °C, t2= indoor heating design temperature of the warmer conditioned space, in °C, t0= outdoor 2.5% January design temperature as specified in Article 1.1.4.1., in °C, and U= overall thermal transmittance required in Sentences 3.2.2.2.(1), 3.2.2.3.(2)and 3.2.2.4.(1), in W/(m2·K). (See Note A-3.2.1.3.(1).)Spaces Heated to Different Temperatures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Daylight transition zones and ramps without parking need not comply with the provisions of Sentences 4.2.2.2.(1), 4.2.2.2.(2)and 4.2.2.2.(4). (See Note A-4.2.2.3.)
unique_id: Daylight transition zones and ramps without parking need not comply with the provisions of Sentences 4.2.2.2.(1), 4.2.2.2.(2)and 4.2.2.2.(4). (See Note A-4.2.2.3.)Lighting Controls in Storage Garages

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The energy model calculations shall include a dynamic calculation of space temperatures.
unique_id: The energy model calculations shall include a dynamic calculation of space temperatures.Space Temperature

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Lighting for covered vehicle entrances and exits from storage garages shall be separately controlled by a device that automatically reduces the lighting by at least 50% from sunset to sunrise. (See Note A-4.2.2.2.(3).)
unique_id: Lighting for covered vehicle entrances and exits from storage garages shall be separately controlled by a device that automatically reduces the lighting by at least 50% from sunset to sunrise. (See Note A-4.2.2.2.(3).)Lighting Controls in Storage Garages

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If an in-floor, in-ceiling or in-wall radiant heating and/or cooling system is used in the proposed buildingbut the energy model calculations do not allow for modeling of radiant effects, each conditioned thermal block in the reference building shall be modeled using heating and/or cooling temperature schedules, as applicable, that are 2°C warmer and 2°C cooler respectively than those used for the proposed building in Sentence 8.4.3.2.(1).
unique_id: If an in-floor, in-ceiling or in-wall radiant heating and/or cooling system is used in the proposed buildingbut the energy model calculations do not allow for modeling of radiant effects, each conditioned thermal block in the reference building shall be modeled using heating and/or cooling temperature schedules, as applicable, that are 2°C warmer and 2°C cooler respectively than those used for the proposed building in Sentence 8.4.3.2.(1).Space Temperature Control

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Controls required by Sentence 5.2.11.1. shall be designed so that lowering a heating thermostat setpoint will not cause energy for cooling to be expended to reach the lowered setting and raising a cooling thermostat setpoint will not cause energy for heating to be expended to reach the raised setting.
unique_id: Controls required by Sentence 5.2.11.1. shall be designed so that lowering a heating thermostat setpoint will not cause energy for cooling to be expended to reach the lowered setting and raising a cooling thermostat setpoint will not cause energy for heating to be expended to reach the raised setting.Off-hours Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aviation fuel and oil separators provided in the drainage system shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 7 days to ensure safe operation and shall be serviced when necessary.
unique_id: Aviation fuel and oil separators provided in the drainage system shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 7 days to ensure safe operation and shall be serviced when necessary.Inspection of Separators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Self-contained emergency lighting unit equipment shall be tested at intervals not greater than one month to ensure that the emergency lights will function upon failure of the primary power supply, and at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that the unit will provide emergency lighting for a duration equal to the design criterion under simulated power failure conditions.
unique_id: Self-contained emergency lighting unit equipment shall be tested at intervals not greater than one month to ensure that the emergency lights will function upon failure of the primary power supply, and at intervals not greater than 12 months to ensure that the unit will provide emergency lighting for a duration equal to the design criterion under simulated power failure conditions.Inspection of Unit Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.10.8.1.(2), in maturing warehouses, at least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 4-A:30-B:C shall be located adjacent to each exit.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.10.8.1.(2), in maturing warehouses, at least one portable extinguisher having a rating of 4-A:30-B:C shall be located adjacent to each exit.Portable Extinguishers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Work on ducts involving the use of heat-producing devices for cutting, welding or soldering shall not be undertaken before the system has been shut down, the duct has been cleaned of any accumulations of combustible deposits, and any combustible lining and covering material that could be ignited by such work has been removed.
unique_id: Work on ducts involving the use of heat-producing devices for cutting, welding or soldering shall not be undertaken before the system has been shut down, the duct has been cleaned of any accumulations of combustible deposits, and any combustible lining and covering material that could be ignited by such work has been removed.Repairs and Renovations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection applies to the indoor storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.
unique_id: Except as provided in Subsection 3.1.1., this Subsection applies to the indoor storage of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.1. shall be stored in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10. except that, in laboratories described in Clause 5.5.5.1.(1)(b), the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in such cabinets shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or a room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.
unique_id: Quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in excess of those permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.1. shall be stored in cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10. except that, in laboratories described in Clause 5.5.5.1.(1)(b), the total quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids stored in such cabinets shall not exceed the quantity permitted for one cabinet, or a room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9.Maximum Quantities

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.
unique_id: Piping shall be installed outdoors whenever possible and located so it will not create a hazard to buildings or equipment.Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.12.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
unique_id: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 4.12.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)Attribution to Acceptable Solutions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Spilled or leaked flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be flushed to a location where they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, or any risk to public health or safety, or neutralized or absorbed and cleaned up with the aid of a product that is compatible and non-reactive with the liquid being cleaned up (see Note A-4.1.6.3.(3)(b)), and deposited in a receptacle conforming to Article 2.4.1.3., or disposed of in a manner that does not create a fire or explosion hazard.
unique_id: Spilled or leaked flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be flushed to a location where they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, or any risk to public health or safety, or neutralized or absorbed and cleaned up with the aid of a product that is compatible and non-reactive with the liquid being cleaned up (see Note A-4.1.6.3.(3)(b)), and deposited in a receptacle conforming to Article 2.4.1.3., or disposed of in a manner that does not create a fire or explosion hazard.Spills and Leaks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Streets, yards and roadways provided for fire department access shall be maintained so as to be ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.
unique_id: Streets, yards and roadways provided for fire department access shall be maintained so as to be ready for use at all times by fire department vehicles.Maintenance of Fire Department Access

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence 4.2.1.1.(1).
unique_id: Except as otherwise stated, requirements for containers in this Part shall also apply to portable tanks described in Sentence 4.2.1.1.(1).Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: At fuel-dispensing stations that provide both attended service and self-service, the attendant required in Sentence 4.6.8.1. is permitted to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids at the attended service island, provided that each island has an emergency shut-off switch as described in Article 4.6.4.2., and the attendant is never more than 25 m from the self-service island or control console.
unique_id: At fuel-dispensing stations that provide both attended service and self-service, the attendant required in Sentence 4.6.8.1. is permitted to dispense flammable liquids or combustible liquids at the attended service island, provided that each island has an emergency shut-off switch as described in Article 4.6.4.2., and the attendant is never more than 25 m from the self-service island or control console.Self-service Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.2.1.(2)to 4.6.2.1.(5), the installation of outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.6.2.1.(2)to 4.6.2.1.(5), the installation of outside aboveground storage tanks at fuel-dispensing stations shall be in conformance with Subsection 4.3.2.Outside Aboveground Storage Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the NBC and with this Part.
unique_id: Ventilation shall be provided for hazardous locations and processes in conformance with the NBC and with this Part.Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operable condition at all times.
unique_id: Fire alarm and voice communication systems shall be maintained in operable condition at all times.Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Underground storage tanks shall be provided with vent openings and piping of sufficient cross-sectional area designed to vent the tanks during the maximum filling or withdrawal rate without causing the allowable stress for the tank to be exceeded.
unique_id: Underground storage tanks shall be provided with vent openings and piping of sufficient cross-sectional area designed to vent the tanks during the maximum filling or withdrawal rate without causing the allowable stress for the tank to be exceeded.Vent Design

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Process plants where Class I and II liquids are handled shall not have basements or covered pits.
unique_id: Process plants where Class I and II liquids are handled shall not have basements or covered pits.Basements and Pits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except where the width of storage of dangerous goods is not more than 1.5 m, measured out from the wall, wall clearances of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained.
unique_id: Except where the width of storage of dangerous goods is not more than 1.5 m, measured out from the wall, wall clearances of not less than 400 mm shall be maintained.Storage Arrangements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.
unique_id: Except as provided in Subsection 2.4.2., smoking shall not be permitted in an outdoor storage area.Ignition Sources

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-16 Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.
unique_id: Bolting materials for flanged connections in steel piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be of alloy steel equivalent to ASTM A 193/A 193M-16 Alloy-Steel and Stainless Steel Bolting for High Temperature or High Pressure Service and Other Special Purpose Applications Grade B-7.Bolting Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If a precision leak detection test referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1. detects a leak rate exceeding 0.38 L/h on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking.
unique_id: If a precision leak detection test referred to in Sentence 4.4.2.1. detects a leak rate exceeding 0.38 L/h on an underground storage tank, the tank shall be considered to be leaking.Leak Detection Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.
unique_id: Piping under concrete ceilings shall be suspended with the use of through bolts or expansion shields.Overhead Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping passing under railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC 2001 Standards Respecting Pipeline Crossings Under Railways
unique_id: Piping passing under railway tracks shall be installed in conformance with TC 2001 Standards Respecting Pipeline Crossings Under RailwaysArrangement of Underground Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: At least one portable fire extinguisher shall be provided in the hot work area.
unique_id: At least one portable fire extinguisher shall be provided in the hot work area.Fire Extinguishing Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, have ventilation in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC, and be designed to prevent the ammonium nitrate from coming into contact with building materials that may react with it as described in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.Storage Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
unique_id: Processing equipment where an explosion hazard is present shall be designed to withstand the explosion pressure without damage to the equipment, provided with explosion venting in conformance with NFPA 68-2013 Explosion Protection by Deflagration Venting or provided with an explosion prevention system in conformance with NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention SystemsExplosion Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every person dispensing flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall take precautions to prevent overflow or spillage of the liquid being dispensed, not knowingly overfill the fuel system, except as otherwise stated in Article 4.6.8.5., in the event of spillage, immediately apply an absorbent material to soak up the spillage in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3., not dispense Class I or II liquids in proximity to open sources of ignition, not use any object or device that is not an integral part of the hose nozzle valve assembly to maintain the flow of fuel, and not dispense the liquids into containers that are in a vehicle, watercraft or floatplane.
unique_id: Every person dispensing flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall take precautions to prevent overflow or spillage of the liquid being dispensed, not knowingly overfill the fuel system, except as otherwise stated in Article 4.6.8.5., in the event of spillage, immediately apply an absorbent material to soak up the spillage in conformance with Article 4.1.6.3., not dispense Class I or II liquids in proximity to open sources of ignition, not use any object or device that is not an integral part of the hose nozzle valve assembly to maintain the flow of fuel, and not dispense the liquids into containers that are in a vehicle, watercraft or floatplane.Fuel-Dispensing Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Bulk storage tanks, piping, pumps, valves and associated components shall be designed, installed and maintained to accommodate hydraulic pressure shock on the system.
unique_id: Bulk storage tanks, piping, pumps, valves and associated components shall be designed, installed and maintained to accommodate hydraulic pressure shock on the system.Hydraulic Pressure Shock

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Not more than 30 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 10 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in each dwelling unit. (See Sentence 4.1.1.1. for oil-burning appliances.)
unique_id: Not more than 30 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 10 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in each dwelling unit. (See Sentence 4.1.1.1. for oil-burning appliances.)Dwelling Units

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flame-retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2013 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1).)
unique_id: Flame-retardant treatments shall be renewed as often as is required to ensure that the material will pass the match flame test in NFPA 705-2013 Field Flame Test for Textiles and Films (See Note A-2.3.2.2.(1).)Flame-Retardant Treatments

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in closed containers, in conformance with Article 4.7.2.4., or storage tanks, in conformance with Section 4.3.
unique_id: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in closed containers, in conformance with Article 4.7.2.4., or storage tanks, in conformance with Section 4.3.Storage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Reactive materials shall be stored based on their properties when classified as dangerous goods.
unique_id: Reactive materials shall be stored based on their properties when classified as dangerous goods.Reactive Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where baled raw pulp is stored in a sprinkleredbuilding, the maximum area of any individual storage area shall be 1 000 m2, and the maximum height of storage shall be 6 m.
unique_id: Where baled raw pulp is stored in a sprinkleredbuilding, the maximum area of any individual storage area shall be 1 000 m2, and the maximum height of storage shall be 6 m.Baled Combustible Fibres

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In areas of a building where construction, alteration or demolition operations are taking place, at least one exit shall be accessible and usable at all times.
unique_id: In areas of a building where construction, alteration or demolition operations are taking place, at least one exit shall be accessible and usable at all times.Provision for Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred by water pressure as a result of displacement, such system shall not be used for liquids that are miscible in water.
unique_id: Where flammable liquids or combustible liquids are transferred by water pressure as a result of displacement, such system shall not be used for liquids that are miscible in water.Hydraulic Transfer Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Emergency service features of elevators shall be tested to ensure that they operate in conformance with appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, as provided in Sentence 7.2.2.1.(2).
unique_id: Emergency service features of elevators shall be tested to ensure that they operate in conformance with appropriate provincial, territorial or municipal requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, as provided in Sentence 7.2.2.1.(2).Testing Elevators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Valves on cylinders for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be closed when not in use.
unique_id: Valves on cylinders for dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall be closed when not in use.Compressed Gases

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquid and combustible liquid piping is permitted to be heated by steam lines provided the minimum steam temperature and pressure to make the liquid fluid are used and Sentences 4.5.8.2.(2)and 4.5.8.2. are complied with.
unique_id: Flammable liquid and combustible liquid piping is permitted to be heated by steam lines provided the minimum steam temperature and pressure to make the liquid fluid are used and Sentences 4.5.8.2.(2)and 4.5.8.2. are complied with.Steam Heating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ventilation shafts shall be used only for ventilating purposes.
unique_id: Ventilation shafts shall be used only for ventilating purposes.Ventilation Shafts

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Loudspeakers operated from the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure they can be heard in all parts of the building.
unique_id: Loudspeakers operated from the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure they can be heard in all parts of the building.Voice Communication Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Section shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.
unique_id: This Section shall apply to buildings or parts of buildings where combustible dusts are produced in quantities or concentrations that create an explosion or fire hazard.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The number of occupants permitted to enter a room shall not exceed the maximum occupant load calculated in conformance with Sentence 2.7.1.3.(1).
unique_id: The number of occupants permitted to enter a room shall not exceed the maximum occupant load calculated in conformance with Sentence 2.7.1.3.(1).Occupant Load

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping that has been used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be removed or capped when it is no longer intended to be used.
unique_id: Piping that has been used for the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be removed or capped when it is no longer intended to be used.Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electrical installations shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I except that alternatives to these requirements are permitted as described in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) in areas other than those described in Article 5.1.2.1.
unique_id: Electrical installations shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such regulations, to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I except that alternatives to these requirements are permitted as described in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) in areas other than those described in Article 5.1.2.1.General

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5. shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
unique_id: All pressure vessels for hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5. shall be constructed, installed and tested in conformance with ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel CodeHydraulic Transfer Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Measures in a Fire Safety Plan
FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared in cooperation with the fire department and other applicable regulatory authorities and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.
unique_id: In buildings or areas described in Article 2.8.1.1., a fire safety plan conforming to this Section shall be prepared in cooperation with the fire department and other applicable regulatory authorities and shall include the emergency procedures to be used in case of fire, including sounding the fire alarm (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(i)), notifying the fire department, instructing occupants on procedures to be followed when the fire alarm sounds, evacuating occupants, including special provisions for persons requiring assistance (see Note A-2.8.2.1.(1)(a)(iv)), confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, the appointment and organization of designated supervisory staff to carry out fire safety duties, the training of supervisory staff and other occupants in their responsibilities for fire safety, documents, including diagrams, showing the type, location and operation of the building fire emergency systems, the holding of fire drills, the control of fire hazards in the building, and the inspection and maintenance of building facilities provided for the safety of occupants.Measures in a Fire Safety Plan

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon its disconnection, the hose shall be drained so as not to create a fire or explosion hazard.
unique_id: When transfer operations are completed, the valves on the hose connections shall be closed, and unless the cargo hose is equipped with a device that automatically prevents liquid from draining from the hose upon its disconnection, the hose shall be drained so as not to create a fire or explosion hazard.Spill Control

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.3.3.2.(3)and 3.3.3.2.(4), a clear space of not less than 15 m shall be maintained between stored products and a building on the same property to reduce the risk of fire spreading from the outdoor storage area to the building.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.3.3.2.(3)and 3.3.3.2.(4), a clear space of not less than 15 m shall be maintained between stored products and a building on the same property to reduce the risk of fire spreading from the outdoor storage area to the building.Individual Storage Areas and Clearance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.
unique_id: Connections for all openings in storage tanks in buildings shall be liquid- and vapour-tight.Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In the case of underground storage tanks or piping, the test referred to in Sentence 4.4.3.2. shall be conducted prior to covering the tank or piping system.
unique_id: In the case of underground storage tanks or piping, the test referred to in Sentence 4.4.3.2. shall be conducted prior to covering the tank or piping system.Pneumatic Leak Detection Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Conveying equipment bearings shall be accessible for inspection and maintenance, lubricated to prevent overheating, and kept free of accumulation of combustible dusts.
unique_id: Conveying equipment bearings shall be accessible for inspection and maintenance, lubricated to prevent overheating, and kept free of accumulation of combustible dusts.Conveying Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Operating personnel shall be trained on how to summon the nearest fire department in the event of fire.
unique_id: Operating personnel shall be trained on how to summon the nearest fire department in the event of fire.Training

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any access route required in Article 3.3.2.5. shall be located so that a clear space of not less than 6 m is provided between stored rubber tires and the nearest side of the access route.
unique_id: Any access route required in Article 3.3.2.5. shall be located so that a clear space of not less than 6 m is provided between stored rubber tires and the nearest side of the access route.Rubber Tires

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tests to ensure operation in conformance with ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators shall be performed on in-car emergency service switches, manual key-operated recall switches located outside an elevator shaft, and automatic emergency recall systems.
unique_id: Tests to ensure operation in conformance with ASME/CSA ASME A17.1-2010/CSA B44-10 Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators shall be performed on in-car emergency service switches, manual key-operated recall switches located outside an elevator shaft, and automatic emergency recall systems.Testing Elevators

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Section shall not apply to storage tanks that have been taken out of service in compliance with the applicable provisions of Subsection 4.3.16.
unique_id: This Section shall not apply to storage tanks that have been taken out of service in compliance with the applicable provisions of Subsection 4.3.16.Application

ARTICLE_TITLE: Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A clear space of not less than 2.4 m shall be maintained between the oxidizing substances identified in Sentence 3.2.7.18. and any other dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.1.2.6.)
unique_id: A clear space of not less than 2.4 m shall be maintained between the oxidizing substances identified in Sentence 3.2.7.18. and any other dangerous goods. (See Note A-3.1.2.6.)Storage of Oxidizers in Mercantile Occupancies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Main access aisles shall be accessible from at least 2 fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.
unique_id: Main access aisles shall be accessible from at least 2 fire department access points, which shall be located such that, in the event one becomes unusable due to fire, the other will still allow emergency responders to access the building.Access Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where equipment for handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids has to be repaired, it shall be removed and taken to maintenance areas when possible.
unique_id: Where equipment for handling flammable liquids or combustible liquids has to be repaired, it shall be removed and taken to maintenance areas when possible.Maintenance

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any combustible and flammable material, dust or residue shall be removed from the area where hot work is carried out, or except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(2), protected against ignition by the use of noncombustible materials.
unique_id: Any combustible and flammable material, dust or residue shall be removed from the area where hot work is carried out, or except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.2.(2), protected against ignition by the use of noncombustible materials.Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An area where smoking is not permitted in Sentence 2.4.2.1. shall be identified by signs conforming to Article 2.4.2.2.
unique_id: An area where smoking is not permitted in Sentence 2.4.2.1. shall be identified by signs conforming to Article 2.4.2.2.Smoking Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where rooms or spaces within a building contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, such occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations in conformance with this Code and the NBC.
unique_id: Where rooms or spaces within a building contain a high-hazard industrial occupancy, such occupancy shall be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations in conformance with this Code and the NBC.Fire Separations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.4.(2), a dust collector having a capacity greater than 2.36 m3/s shall be located outside of a building, and be equipped with explosion venting to the outdoors of not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.3.1.4.(2), a dust collector having a capacity greater than 2.36 m3/s shall be located outside of a building, and be equipped with explosion venting to the outdoors of not less than 0.1 m2 of vent area for each cubic metre of dust collector enclosure volume.Dust Collectors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for fires used for cooking in fireplaces, grills or barbecues, open air fires shall not be set unless appropriate measures are taken to limit their spread. (See Note A-2.4.5.1.(1).)
unique_id: Except for fires used for cooking in fireplaces, grills or barbecues, open air fires shall not be set unless appropriate measures are taken to limit their spread. (See Note A-2.4.5.1.(1).)Open Air Fires

FRAG_DOCUMENT: At least one stairway conforming to Sentence 5.6.3.7. shall be extended upward as each floor is installed in new construction, or maintained for each floor still remaining during demolition. (See also Article 8.2.1.3. of Division B of the NBC.)
unique_id: At least one stairway conforming to Sentence 5.6.3.7. shall be extended upward as each floor is installed in new construction, or maintained for each floor still remaining during demolition. (See also Article 8.2.1.3. of Division B of the NBC.)Construction Access

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.3.(7), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases of pyrophoric materials shall be located in a gas storage cabinet that is continuously mechanically ventilated, and sprinklered.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 5.5.5.3.(7), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases of pyrophoric materials shall be located in a gas storage cabinet that is continuously mechanically ventilated, and sprinklered.Compressed Gases

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.1.(2), hot work shall be carried out in an area free of combustible and flammable contents, with walls, ceilings and floors of noncombustible construction or lined with noncombustible materials.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.3.1.(2), hot work shall be carried out in an area free of combustible and flammable contents, with walls, ceilings and floors of noncombustible construction or lined with noncombustible materials.Location of Operations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Protective guarding devices shall be provided where necessary to prevent damage to the mechanical components of doors in fire separations, and installed so as not to interfere with the proper operation of the doors.
unique_id: Protective guarding devices shall be provided where necessary to prevent damage to the mechanical components of doors in fire separations, and installed so as not to interfere with the proper operation of the doors.Protective Guarding Devices

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Defects that interfere with the operation of closures in fire separations shall be corrected, and such closures shall be maintained to ensure that they are operable at all times by keeping fusible links and other heat-actuated devices undamaged and free of paint and dirt, keeping guides, bearings and stay rolls clean and lubricated, making necessary adjustments and repairs to door hardware and accessories to ensure proper closing and latching, and repairing or replacing inoperative parts of hold-open devices and automatic releasing devices.
unique_id: Defects that interfere with the operation of closures in fire separations shall be corrected, and such closures shall be maintained to ensure that they are operable at all times by keeping fusible links and other heat-actuated devices undamaged and free of paint and dirt, keeping guides, bearings and stay rolls clean and lubricated, making necessary adjustments and repairs to door hardware and accessories to ensure proper closing and latching, and repairing or replacing inoperative parts of hold-open devices and automatic releasing devices.Inspection and Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Existing gas, electrical, water, steam and other services are permitted to be left within the area of the excavation provided that before work begins, the service company concerned has approved the proposed method of operation, the location of the services is determined before excavation commences, a suitable method of excavation is adopted that will ensure that the services are not damaged, and the services are provided with suitable temporary supports.
unique_id: Existing gas, electrical, water, steam and other services are permitted to be left within the area of the excavation provided that before work begins, the service company concerned has approved the proposed method of operation, the location of the services is determined before excavation commences, a suitable method of excavation is adopted that will ensure that the services are not damaged, and the services are provided with suitable temporary supports.Maintaining Existing Services

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure B is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that dampers in air-handling systems that serve more than 2 storeys close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure B, and closures to vent openings in vertical service spaces that are required by Sentences  and  of Measure B open automatically and remain open, switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure B, closures in openings to the outdoors in vertical service spaces that are required by Sentence  of Measure B shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that they will operate as required, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when air is being injected into the stairshaft as required by Sentence  of Measure B.
unique_id: Where Measure B is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that dampers in air-handling systems that serve more than 2 storeys close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure B, and closures to vent openings in vertical service spaces that are required by Sentences  and  of Measure B open automatically and remain open, switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure B, closures in openings to the outdoors in vertical service spaces that are required by Sentence  of Measure B shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that they will operate as required, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when air is being injected into the stairshaft as required by Sentence  of Measure B.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purpose of applying this Code, every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(1).)
unique_id: For the purpose of applying this Code, every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-2.1.2.1.(1).)Classification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storage tanks with an individual capacity exceeding 2 500 L but not exceeding 20 000 L that are used in conformance with Table 4.3.13.4.-B shall be of double-walled construction in conformance with Clause 4.3.1.2.(1) or a minimum of 300 deg. secondarily contained construction, and monitored for leakage in conformance with Sentence 4.4.2.1.(7).
unique_id: Storage tanks with an individual capacity exceeding 2 500 L but not exceeding 20 000 L that are used in conformance with Table 4.3.13.4.-B shall be of double-walled construction in conformance with Clause 4.3.1.2.(1) or a minimum of 300 deg. secondarily contained construction, and monitored for leakage in conformance with Sentence 4.4.2.1.(7).Storage Tank Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Products classified as dangerous goods shall display appropriate identifying labels from the time they enter a facility until they are issued as finished products or waste material. (See Note A-3.2.7.13.(1).)
unique_id: Products classified as dangerous goods shall display appropriate identifying labels from the time they enter a facility until they are issued as finished products or waste material. (See Note A-3.2.7.13.(1).)Labels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pipelines for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be marked with the contents of the line, and these markings shall be maintained in a clearly legible form.
unique_id: Pipelines for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be marked with the contents of the line, and these markings shall be maintained in a clearly legible form.Identification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.5.5.3.(2), flanged joints for piping shall be made with forged or cast steel flanges designed, constructed and installed in conformance with ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch StandardFlanged Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.
unique_id: Pump houses and pump rooms shall not be used for any purpose other than to serve the pumping equipment.Pump Houses and Pump Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In every hotel and motel bedroom, the fire safety rules for occupants shall be posted showing the locations of exits and the paths of travel to exits.
unique_id: In every hotel and motel bedroom, the fire safety rules for occupants shall be posted showing the locations of exits and the paths of travel to exits.Posting of Fire Emergency Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.8.3.(3), storage tanks subjected to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.
unique_id: Except as required in Sentence 4.3.8.3.(3), storage tanks subjected to vehicular traffic shall be installed not less than 1 m below finished ground level.Ground Cover

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.1.1.(2), this Section shall apply to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids that are in containers conforming to Clauses 4.2.3.1.(1)(a)to 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 230 L, portable tanks conforming to Clause 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 2 500 L, or intermediate bulk containers conforming to Clause 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 3 000 L.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.1.1.(2), this Section shall apply to the storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids that are in containers conforming to Clauses 4.2.3.1.(1)(a)to 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 230 L, portable tanks conforming to Clause 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 2 500 L, or intermediate bulk containers conforming to Clause 4.2.3.1.(1) having an individual capacity of not more than 3 000 L.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aboveground outdoor piping shall be supported and arranged to prevent excessive vibration and stress on equipment connected to it.
unique_id: Aboveground outdoor piping shall be supported and arranged to prevent excessive vibration and stress on equipment connected to it.Supports for Aboveground Outdoor Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Coal and wood bins shall be located not less than 1.2 m from the appliance served.
unique_id: Coal and wood bins shall be located not less than 1.2 m from the appliance served.Coal and Wood Bins

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in conformance with Part 4..
unique_id: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be stored in conformance with Part 4..Storage Arrangements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The storage site shall be level, and solid ground or paved with asphalt, concrete or other hard surface material.
unique_id: The storage site shall be level, and solid ground or paved with asphalt, concrete or other hard surface material.Site Preparation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.3.2. and Article 4.2.3.1., containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be distinctly marked or labelled in easily legible type that is in contrast to any other printed matter on the label with a warning to indicate that the material in the container is flammable, it should be kept away from heat, sparks and open flames, and it should be kept closed when not in use.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.3.2. and Article 4.2.3.1., containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be distinctly marked or labelled in easily legible type that is in contrast to any other printed matter on the label with a warning to indicate that the material in the container is flammable, it should be kept away from heat, sparks and open flames, and it should be kept closed when not in use.Markings or Labels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in portions of a building under construction or alteration that are not occupied, the following shall apply: a permanent or temporary standpipe system is permitted in accordance with Clauses 5.6.1.6.(2)(b)and 5.6.1.6.(2)(c), the standpipe system shall be provided with conspicuously marked and readily accessible fire department connections on the outside of the building at street level and shall have at least one hose outlet at each floor, the pipe size, hose valves and water supply shall conform to Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC, the standpipe system shall, as a minimum, be securely supported and restrained on alternate floors, at least one hose valve for attaching fire department hose shall be provided at each intermediate landing or floor level in the exit stairway, valves shall be kept closed at all times and guarded against mechanical damage, the standpipe shall be not more than one floor below the highest forms, staging, and similar combustible elements at all times, and temporary standpipe systems shall remain in service until the permanent standpipe installation is complete.
unique_id: Where a standpipe system is to be installed in portions of a building under construction or alteration that are not occupied, the following shall apply: a permanent or temporary standpipe system is permitted in accordance with Clauses 5.6.1.6.(2)(b)and 5.6.1.6.(2)(c), the standpipe system shall be provided with conspicuously marked and readily accessible fire department connections on the outside of the building at street level and shall have at least one hose outlet at each floor, the pipe size, hose valves and water supply shall conform to Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC, the standpipe system shall, as a minimum, be securely supported and restrained on alternate floors, at least one hose valve for attaching fire department hose shall be provided at each intermediate landing or floor level in the exit stairway, valves shall be kept closed at all times and guarded against mechanical damage, the standpipe shall be not more than one floor below the highest forms, staging, and similar combustible elements at all times, and temporary standpipe systems shall remain in service until the permanent standpipe installation is complete.Standpipe Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except at distilleries covered in Section 4.10., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.5.2., 4.5.3. and 4.5.5.
unique_id: Except at distilleries covered in Section 4.10., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.5.2., 4.5.3. and 4.5.5.Materials and Construction

ARTICLE_TITLE: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Inventory reconciliation referred to in this Section shall for the time period designated, determine product loss or gain based on the reconciliation of change in physical inventory, inventory additions (deliveries), inventory removals (sales), and miscellaneous inventory alterations, and determine the level of water in the tank. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(2).)
unique_id: Inventory reconciliation referred to in this Section shall for the time period designated, determine product loss or gain based on the reconciliation of change in physical inventory, inventory additions (deliveries), inventory removals (sales), and miscellaneous inventory alterations, and determine the level of water in the tank. (See Note A-4.4.2.1.(2).)Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Areas described in Article 4.1.1.1. shall be kept clean and free of ground vegetation and accumulations of combustible materials not essential to operations.
unique_id: Areas described in Article 4.1.1.1. shall be kept clean and free of ground vegetation and accumulations of combustible materials not essential to operations.Removal of Combustibles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In addition to the separation requirements in Sentence 3.2.7.6.(1), dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with the information provided in the Safety Data Sheet for the specific dangerous good. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(3).)
unique_id: In addition to the separation requirements in Sentence 3.2.7.6.(1), dangerous goods shall be stored in conformance with the information provided in the Safety Data Sheet for the specific dangerous good. (See Note A-3.2.7.6.(3).)Separation from Other Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the NBC.
unique_id: Piping and steam lines shall be enclosed in insulation conforming to the NBC.Steam Heating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The storage cabinets referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall not be located above or below the first storey.
unique_id: The storage cabinets referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall not be located above or below the first storey.Storage Cabinets and Storage Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as required in Sentence 5.6.1.3.(2), prior to the commencement of construction, alteration or demolition operations, a fire safety plan shall be prepared for the site and shall include the designation and organization of site personnel to carry out fire safety duties, including a fire watch service if applicable, the emergency procedures to be followed in the event of a fire, including initiating a fire warning, notifying the fire department, instructing site personnel on the procedures to be followed once the warning has been initiated, and confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, measures for controlling fire hazards in and around the building (see Note A-5.6.1.3.(1)(c)), and a maintenance procedure for firefighting measures required in Section 5.6.
unique_id: Except as required in Sentence 5.6.1.3.(2), prior to the commencement of construction, alteration or demolition operations, a fire safety plan shall be prepared for the site and shall include the designation and organization of site personnel to carry out fire safety duties, including a fire watch service if applicable, the emergency procedures to be followed in the event of a fire, including initiating a fire warning, notifying the fire department, instructing site personnel on the procedures to be followed once the warning has been initiated, and confining, controlling and extinguishing the fire, measures for controlling fire hazards in and around the building (see Note A-5.6.1.3.(1)(c)), and a maintenance procedure for firefighting measures required in Section 5.6.Fire Safety Plan

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Emergency lighting and exit signs shall be maintained in operating condition, in conformance with Section 6.5.
unique_id: Emergency lighting and exit signs shall be maintained in operating condition, in conformance with Section 6.5.Installation and Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a sign, notice, placard or information is required to be posted, it shall be clearly legible, and except as provided in Sentence 2.1.4.1.(2), permanently mounted in a conspicuous or prominent location in proximity to the situation to which it refers.
unique_id: Where a sign, notice, placard or information is required to be posted, it shall be clearly legible, and except as provided in Sentence 2.1.4.1.(2), permanently mounted in a conspicuous or prominent location in proximity to the situation to which it refers.Posting
