FRAG_DOCUMENT: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product Identification
unique_id: A storage tank and its filling and emptying connections shall be identified in conformance with CFA 1990 Using the Canadian Fuels Colour-Symbol System to Mark Equipment and Vehicles for Product IdentificationIdentification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An ignition source that is an integral part of an operation involving flammable vapours shall be permitted provided the supply of flammable liquids or combustible liquids for this operation is controlled and kept to a strict minimum, flammable vapours and combustion fumes are exhausted in conformance with Article 5.5.4.2., there is no other source of ignition capable of igniting the flammable vapours in an uncontrolled manner, and there is no combustible material in the immediate vicinity of this operation.
unique_id: An ignition source that is an integral part of an operation involving flammable vapours shall be permitted provided the supply of flammable liquids or combustible liquids for this operation is controlled and kept to a strict minimum, flammable vapours and combustion fumes are exhausted in conformance with Article 5.5.4.2., there is no other source of ignition capable of igniting the flammable vapours in an uncontrolled manner, and there is no combustible material in the immediate vicinity of this operation.Ignition Sources

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)
unique_id: Unless controlled in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard, a device, operation or activity that produces open flames, sparks or heat shall not be permitted. (See Note A-4.1.5.2.(1).)Ignition Sources

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Staff members of daycare centres in which more than 10 children are cared for shall conduct fire prevention inspections in conformance with the fire safety plan at intervals not greater than one month.
unique_id: Staff members of daycare centres in which more than 10 children are cared for shall conduct fire prevention inspections in conformance with the fire safety plan at intervals not greater than one month.Fire Prevention Inspections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.11.4.(2), where vent piping connects 2 or more storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.3.11.4.(2), where vent piping connects 2 or more storage tanks, pipe sizes shall be designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected underground storage tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks when being filled simultaneously.Interconnection of Vent Pipes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In industrial occupancies, quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids greater than those specified in Sentence 4.2.10.3. are permitted in a single fire compartment if the total quantity stored in a group of cabinets is not more than the quantity permitted for 3 cabinets, and the distance between groups of cabinets described in Clause 4.2.10.3.(2) is not less than 30 m.
unique_id: In industrial occupancies, quantities of flammable liquids and combustible liquids greater than those specified in Sentence 4.2.10.3. are permitted in a single fire compartment if the total quantity stored in a group of cabinets is not more than the quantity permitted for 3 cabinets, and the distance between groups of cabinets described in Clause 4.2.10.3.(2) is not less than 30 m.Maximum Quantity per Fire Compartment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure J is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that closures in openings in the walls and roofs of the central core and in shafts within the core will close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure J, and return-air fans are stopped and supply fans will provide air to the central core as provided in Sentence  of Measure J.
unique_id: Where Measure J is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that closures in openings in the walls and roofs of the central core and in shafts within the core will close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure J, and return-air fans are stopped and supply fans will provide air to the central core as provided in Sentence  of Measure J.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be classified, stored and handled in conformance with Part 4..
unique_id: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall be classified, stored and handled in conformance with Part 4..Flammable and Combustible Liquids

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.4.3.(2), the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. shall conform to Article 6.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.4.3.(2), the ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required in Article 5.5.4.2. shall conform to Article 6.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.Enclosure Exhaust Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fixed dispensers for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be installed inside a building when the building is not open to the public, the dispensers are located on the first storey, drainage is provided, and ventilation is provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7. and with the requirements for storage garages in Subsection 6.3.1. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Fixed dispensers for Class II or IIIA liquids are permitted to be installed inside a building when the building is not open to the public, the dispensers are located on the first storey, drainage is provided, and ventilation is provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.7. and with the requirements for storage garages in Subsection 6.3.1. of Division B of the NBC.Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C558-14 Guide for the Investigation of Internal Combustion Engine-Powered Industrial Trucks
unique_id: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C558-14 Guide for the Investigation of Internal Combustion Engine-Powered Industrial TrucksIndustrial Trucks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.
unique_id: The use of cam-locking connections up to 100 mm in size shall be permitted.Hose Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A portable extinguisher shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine producing wood dust, particles or shavings.
unique_id: A portable extinguisher shall be provided within 7.5 m of any machine producing wood dust, particles or shavings.Fire Extinguishers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Combustible contents in interconnected floor spaces in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, shall not exceed the limit specified in Subsection 3.2.8. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Combustible contents in interconnected floor spaces in which the ceiling is more than 8 m above the floor, shall not exceed the limit specified in Subsection 3.2.8. of Division B of the NBC.Interconnected Floor Spaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The ventilation system described in Sentence 5.5.4.3. shall not be interlocked with a fire detection, fire alarm or make-up air system.
unique_id: The ventilation system described in Sentence 5.5.4.3. shall not be interlocked with a fire detection, fire alarm or make-up air system.Enclosure Exhaust Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.5.3.(7), where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as toxic gases are used in a laboratory, they shall be located in a continuously mechanically ventilated gas storage cabinet, all exhaust shall be directed to a treatment system designed to process the accidental release of gas (see Note A-5.5.5.3.(5) and (b)), and the gas levels in the air shall be monitored by a gas detection system designed to emit an audible and visual signal within the laboratory and at a central station when gas levels exceed the exposure limit values established by provincial or territorial regulations or municipal by-laws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, when they exceed the exposure limit values stated in the Safety Data Sheet.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 5.5.5.3.(7), where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as toxic gases are used in a laboratory, they shall be located in a continuously mechanically ventilated gas storage cabinet, all exhaust shall be directed to a treatment system designed to process the accidental release of gas (see Note A-5.5.5.3.(5) and (b)), and the gas levels in the air shall be monitored by a gas detection system designed to emit an audible and visual signal within the laboratory and at a central station when gas levels exceed the exposure limit values established by provincial or territorial regulations or municipal by-laws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, when they exceed the exposure limit values stated in the Safety Data Sheet.Compressed Gases

ARTICLE_TITLE: Clearances from Liquefied Petroleum Gas Cylinders and Tanks
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Secondary containments for flammable liquid and combustible liquidstorage tanks shall not contain any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or tank, and the centre line of the secondary containment wall shall be not less than 3 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas cylinder, and 6 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas tank.
unique_id: Secondary containments for flammable liquid and combustible liquidstorage tanks shall not contain any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or tank, and the centre line of the secondary containment wall shall be not less than 3 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas cylinder, and 6 m away from a liquefied petroleum gas tank.Clearances from Liquefied Petroleum Gas Cylinders and Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where construction, alteration or demolition operations occur in an existing building that is required to have a fire safety plan conforming to Section 2.8., the fire safety plan shall take into account the changes occurring to the building.
unique_id: Where construction, alteration or demolition operations occur in an existing building that is required to have a fire safety plan conforming to Section 2.8., the fire safety plan shall take into account the changes occurring to the building.Fire Safety Plan

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.
unique_id: In the design of piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids, provision shall be made for the expansion and contraction of the piping system and of the product it conveys.Provision for Expansion and Contraction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.9.1.(2)and 4.2.9.1.(3), where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored in a room required in this Part, the storage densities averaged over the total room area and the total quantities of such liquids shall conform to Table 4.2.9.1.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.9.1.(2)and 4.2.9.1.(3), where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are stored in a room required in this Part, the storage densities averaged over the total room area and the total quantities of such liquids shall conform to Table 4.2.9.1.Maximum Quantities

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Signs prohibiting smoking shall have black lettering not less than 50 mm high with a 12 mm stroke on a yellow background, except that symbols of not less than 150 mm by 150 mm are permitted to be used in lieu of lettering.
unique_id: Signs prohibiting smoking shall have black lettering not less than 50 mm high with a 12 mm stroke on a yellow background, except that symbols of not less than 150 mm by 150 mm are permitted to be used in lieu of lettering.Signs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
unique_id: Metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S667-11 Metallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible LiquidsMaterials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.10.2.1.(2), buildings or parts of buildings in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high-hazard industrial occupancies.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.10.2.1.(2), buildings or parts of buildings in which distilled beverage alcohol is distilled, processed or stored in bulk shall be classified as high-hazard industrial occupancies.Building Classification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wall clearances of not less than 600 mm shall be maintained where stored products may swell or expand with the absorption of water.
unique_id: Wall clearances of not less than 600 mm shall be maintained where stored products may swell or expand with the absorption of water.Clearances

ARTICLE_TITLE: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with API 620-2013 Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code
unique_id: Low pressure storage tanks shall be constructed in conformance with API 620-2013 Design and Construction of Large, Welded, Low-Pressure Storage Tanks or ASME BPVC-2017 Boiler and Pressure Vessel CodeLow Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A device to shut off power to all dispensers and pumps shall be provided at a remote location on the site of the fuel-dispensing station and shielded from any fire that might occur in the dispensing area.
unique_id: A device to shut off power to all dispensers and pumps shall be provided at a remote location on the site of the fuel-dispensing station and shielded from any fire that might occur in the dispensing area.Location and Identification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Hoods, ducts and filters subject to accumulations of combustible deposits shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 7 days, and shall be cleaned if the accumulation of such deposits creates a fire hazard.
unique_id: Hoods, ducts and filters subject to accumulations of combustible deposits shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 7 days, and shall be cleaned if the accumulation of such deposits creates a fire hazard.Hoods, Ducts and Filters

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.
unique_id: When nonfixed seats are provided in assembly occupancies, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), the seats shall be arranged in rows having an unobstructed passage of not less than 400 mm between rows measured horizontally between plumb lines from the backs of the seats in one row and the edges of the furthest forward projection of the seats in the next row behind in the unoccupied position, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), aisles shall be located so that there are not more than 7 seats between every seat and the nearest aisle, except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(2), the clear width of an aisle in millimetres shall be not less than the greater of 1 100 or the product of the number of seats served by that aisle and 6.1, the width of an aisle is permitted to be reduced to not less than 750 mm when serving 60 seats or fewer, dead-end aisles shall not be longer than 6 m, and except as provided in Sentence 2.7.1.5.(3), when the occupant load exceeds 200 persons, the seats in a row shall be fastened together in units of no fewer than 8 seats, or where there are 7 seats or fewer in a row, all the seats in the row shall be fastened together.Nonfixed Seating

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(2), the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids outside of a cabinet or storage room required in Article 4.2.6.2. is permitted, provided such storage does not exceed 10 L, including not more than 5 L of Class I liquids, in a single room, or 250 L, including not more than 60 L of Class II liquids, or 10 L of Class I liquids, in a single fire compartment with a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.2.6.3.(2), the storage of flammable liquids and combustible liquids outside of a cabinet or storage room required in Article 4.2.6.2. is permitted, provided such storage does not exceed 10 L, including not more than 5 L of Class I liquids, in a single room, or 250 L, including not more than 60 L of Class II liquids, or 10 L of Class I liquids, in a single fire compartment with a fire-resistance rating of at least 45 min.Maximum Quantities

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or storage rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.
unique_id: Flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored in cabinets or storage rooms shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 4.2.2.3.Separation of Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Unless the use of fuel-fired appliances and electrical heating elements is controlled in a manner such that they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, they shall not be permitted in a storage area for combustible fibres.
unique_id: Unless the use of fuel-fired appliances and electrical heating elements is controlled in a manner such that they will not create a fire or explosion hazard, they shall not be permitted in a storage area for combustible fibres.Heating Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All ashes shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same container.
unique_id: All ashes shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. and combustible materials shall not be stored with ashes in the same container.Waste Receptacles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for Class I commodities, dangerous goods shall not be stored in the same individual storage area with other products listed in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(1).
unique_id: Except for Class I commodities, dangerous goods shall not be stored in the same individual storage area with other products listed in Sentence 3.2.1.1.(1).Separation from Combustible Products

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where combustible or reactive deposits can accumulate in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard, provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or an automatic fire suppression system shall be provided.
unique_id: Where combustible or reactive deposits can accumulate in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system and create a fire or explosion hazard, provisions shall be made to remove such deposits so they do not create a fire or explosion hazard, or an automatic fire suppression system shall be provided.Enclosure Exhaust Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The fire safety plan required in Sentence 3.3.2.9. shall identify the location and classification of the products currently stored, as described in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1), the method of storage, including the clear spaces required and the maximum permitted size of individual storage areas, the location of fire alarm systems and firefighting equipment, and the control of fire hazards in and around the outdoor storage area.
unique_id: The fire safety plan required in Sentence 3.3.2.9. shall identify the location and classification of the products currently stored, as described in Sentence 3.3.1.1.(1), the method of storage, including the clear spaces required and the maximum permitted size of individual storage areas, the location of fire alarm systems and firefighting equipment, and the control of fire hazards in and around the outdoor storage area.Fire Safety Plan

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any building located in an outdoor storage area shall be provided with portable extinguishers.
unique_id: Any building located in an outdoor storage area shall be provided with portable extinguishers.Portable Extinguishers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of calculating permissible quantities in Sentences 4.2.5.2.(2)and 4.2.5.2.(3), mercantile occupancies of less than 250 m2floor area shall be assumed to be 250 m2 in area.
unique_id: For the purposes of calculating permissible quantities in Sentences 4.2.5.2.(2)and 4.2.5.2.(3), mercantile occupancies of less than 250 m2floor area shall be assumed to be 250 m2 in area.Maximum Quantities

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practicable to the tank.
unique_id: Connections to storage tanks through which liquid can flow shall be provided with valves located as close as practicable to the tank.Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electrical equipment, mechanical systems, piping, valves, and automatic and manual control and safety devices shall be inspected, tested and maintained in good operating condition at all times.
unique_id: Electrical equipment, mechanical systems, piping, valves, and automatic and manual control and safety devices shall be inspected, tested and maintained in good operating condition at all times.Inspection and Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a dispenser referred to in Sentence 4.7.3.2. is supplied from an aboveground storage tank an automatically operated valve that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated shall be provided at the tank outlet, and an emergency valve shall be provided for the dispenser in conformance with Sentence 4.6.6.3.(1).
unique_id: Where a dispenser referred to in Sentence 4.7.3.2. is supplied from an aboveground storage tank an automatically operated valve that is designed to open only when the dispenser is being operated shall be provided at the tank outlet, and an emergency valve shall be provided for the dispenser in conformance with Sentence 4.6.6.3.(1).Dispensing into Vehicles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure G is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below gradefloor areas that are required by Sentence  of Measure G open automatically and remain open, and the mechanical air supply to stairshafts and elevator shafts is initiated as provided in Sentences ,  and  of Measure G, and closures in openings to the outdoors in stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when the air supply to the stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure G.
unique_id: Where Measure G is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below gradefloor areas that are required by Sentence  of Measure G open automatically and remain open, and the mechanical air supply to stairshafts and elevator shafts is initiated as provided in Sentences ,  and  of Measure G, and closures in openings to the outdoors in stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when the air supply to the stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure G.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storage tanks installed underground shall be of double-walled construction and shall be built in conformance with the underground storage tank standards identified in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).
unique_id: Storage tanks installed underground shall be of double-walled construction and shall be built in conformance with the underground storage tank standards identified in Sentence 4.3.1.2.(1).Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every aboveground storage tank containing unstable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa  shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 7.5 m, where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or 3 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 15 m, where protection referred to in Clause 4.3.2.1.(3) is not provided.
unique_id: Every aboveground storage tank containing unstable liquids and having a working pressure of not more than 17 kPa  shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 7.5 m, where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or 3 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., but not less than 15 m, where protection referred to in Clause 4.3.2.1.(3) is not provided.Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Buildings altered or occupied for purposes of providing accommodation for boarders, lodgers or roomers shall conform to the NBC.
unique_id: Buildings altered or occupied for purposes of providing accommodation for boarders, lodgers or roomers shall conform to the NBC.Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Indoor storage of combustible pallets is permitted in a building that is not sprinklered, provided the height of storage of combustible pallets is not more than 1.2 m, the width of an individual storage area is not more than 7.5 m, and the aggregate area of storage is not more than 100 m2 for wood or solid deck non-expanded polyethylene pallets, or 50 m2 for plastic pallets not designated in subclause 3.2.2.4.(2)(c)(i).
unique_id: Indoor storage of combustible pallets is permitted in a building that is not sprinklered, provided the height of storage of combustible pallets is not more than 1.2 m, the width of an individual storage area is not more than 7.5 m, and the aggregate area of storage is not more than 100 m2 for wood or solid deck non-expanded polyethylene pallets, or 50 m2 for plastic pallets not designated in subclause 3.2.2.4.(2)(c)(i).Combustible Pallets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Main access aisles shall extend the length of the storage area where only one main access aisle is provided, or the length or width of the storage area where 2 or more main access aisles are provided.
unique_id: Main access aisles shall extend the length of the storage area where only one main access aisle is provided, or the length or width of the storage area where 2 or more main access aisles are provided.Access Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air shall not be performed on storage tanks and piping systems having once contained flammable liquids or combustible liquids.
unique_id: Pneumatic leak detection tests using compressed air shall not be performed on storage tanks and piping systems having once contained flammable liquids or combustible liquids.Pneumatic Leak Detection Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentences 4.6.5.1.(3)and 4.6.5.1.(4), hose through which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are dispensed at a fuel-dispensing station shall be restricted to a maximum extended length of 4.5 m.
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentences 4.6.5.1.(3)and 4.6.5.1.(4), hose through which flammable liquids or combustible liquids are dispensed at a fuel-dispensing station shall be restricted to a maximum extended length of 4.5 m.Delivery Hose

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dangerous goods classified as flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.
unique_id: Dangerous goods classified as flammable gases shall not be used to inflate balloons.Flammable Gases

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access to fire department connections for sprinkler or standpipe systems by firefighters and their equipment shall be maintained free of obstructions at all times.
unique_id: Access to fire department connections for sprinkler or standpipe systems by firefighters and their equipment shall be maintained free of obstructions at all times.Access to Fire Department Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tight-filled storage tanks shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing a positive shut-off device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (See Note A-4.3.1.8.(2).)
unique_id: Tight-filled storage tanks shall be prevented from being overfilled by providing a positive shut-off device conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S661-10 Overfill Protection Devices for Flammable and Combustible Liquid Storage Tanks (See Note A-4.3.1.8.(2).)Overfill Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping in trenches referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.9. shall be covered with noncombustible material.
unique_id: Piping in trenches referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.9. shall be covered with noncombustible material.Indoor Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Materials for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.
unique_id: Materials for piping systems containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be suitable for the maximum anticipated working pressures and operating temperatures and for the chemical properties of the contained liquid.Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings except dwelling units.
unique_id: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings except dwelling units.Selection and Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Subsection 2.6.2., the burning of materials in an outdoor storage area shall be performed only in a burner that is designed, constructed and maintained in conformance with good engineering practice, and located not less than 15 m from a building or stored products.
unique_id: Except as provided in Subsection 2.6.2., the burning of materials in an outdoor storage area shall be performed only in a burner that is designed, constructed and maintained in conformance with good engineering practice, and located not less than 15 m from a building or stored products.Ignition Sources

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ventilation required in Sentence 5.4.4.3. is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.
unique_id: Ventilation required in Sentence 5.4.4.3. is permitted to be provided by mechanical systems if their use does not constitute a source of ignition.Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Facilities shall be provided to enable the watcher referred to in Sentences 5.6.1.14.(1)and 5.6.1.14. to ensure a fire warning is sounded to notify occupants, and communicate with the fire department.
unique_id: Facilities shall be provided to enable the watcher referred to in Sentences 5.6.1.14.(1)and 5.6.1.14. to ensure a fire warning is sounded to notify occupants, and communicate with the fire department.Watch

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A membrane providing the level of impermeability required in Clause 4.3.7.2.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S668-12 Liners Used for Secondary Containment of Aboveground Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tanks and if it is combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material that will prevent the membrane from failing in the event that the secondary containment is exposed to fire.
unique_id: A membrane providing the level of impermeability required in Clause 4.3.7.2.(1) shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S668-12 Liners Used for Secondary Containment of Aboveground Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tanks and if it is combustible, be covered with a noncombustible material that will prevent the membrane from failing in the event that the secondary containment is exposed to fire.Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Investigative action shall be undertaken if the inventory reconciliation described in Sentence 4.4.2.1. indicates the following inexplicable conditions: a monthly loss of 0.5 percent or more of the throughput from an underground storage tank, or 1.0 percent or more of the throughput from an aboveground storage tank, three consecutive losses greater than 200 L/day, and a water level greater than 50 mm.
unique_id: Investigative action shall be undertaken if the inventory reconciliation described in Sentence 4.4.2.1. indicates the following inexplicable conditions: a monthly loss of 0.5 percent or more of the throughput from an underground storage tank, or 1.0 percent or more of the throughput from an aboveground storage tank, three consecutive losses greater than 200 L/day, and a water level greater than 50 mm.Inventory Reconciliation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ventilation referred to in Clause 4.1.7.2.(1) need not be provided for the storage of Class I liquids if storage consists of only closed containers, and no dispensing operations are performed.
unique_id: Ventilation referred to in Clause 4.1.7.2.(1) need not be provided for the storage of Class I liquids if storage consists of only closed containers, and no dispensing operations are performed.Ventilation Measures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.8.2.(2)and 4.2.8.2. and in Article 4.2.8.4., the quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted to be located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsections 4.2.7., 4.2.9.or 4.3.14., or storage cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10., in any one fire compartment of a building, shall not be more than 600 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in closed containers, of which not more than 100 L shall be Class IA liquids, and 5 000 L of Class IB, IC, II and IIIA liquids in storage tanks or portable tanks.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.2.8.2.(2)and 4.2.8.2. and in Article 4.2.8.4., the quantity of flammable liquids and combustible liquids permitted to be located outside of storage rooms conforming to Subsections 4.2.7., 4.2.9.or 4.3.14., or storage cabinets conforming to Subsection 4.2.10., in any one fire compartment of a building, shall not be more than 600 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in closed containers, of which not more than 100 L shall be Class IA liquids, and 5 000 L of Class IB, IC, II and IIIA liquids in storage tanks or portable tanks.Maximum Quantities

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The clearances required in Sentence 4.2.11.1. do not apply where not more than 5 000 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored adjacent to a building on the same property, provided that either the building is limited to 1 storey in building height and is used primarily for the storage or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or the exposed wall has a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h and has no openings within 3 m of such outdoor storage.
unique_id: The clearances required in Sentence 4.2.11.1. do not apply where not more than 5 000 L of flammable liquids or combustible liquids are stored adjacent to a building on the same property, provided that either the building is limited to 1 storey in building height and is used primarily for the storage or handling of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, or the exposed wall has a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h and has no openings within 3 m of such outdoor storage.Quantities and Clearances

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.
unique_id: Equipment required to have a dust-collecting system shall be interlocked to prevent it from operating if the dust-collecting system is not in operation.Electrical Interlocks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Operations or machines that generate sparks or combustible vapours shall not be served by exhaust systems connected to woodworking machines referred to in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1).
unique_id: Operations or machines that generate sparks or combustible vapours shall not be served by exhaust systems connected to woodworking machines referred to in Sentence 5.3.2.1.(1).Exhaust Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Chain link fencing referred to in Sentence 3.2.5.6. shall be not lighter than 2.9 mm steel wire woven into a 50 mm diamond mesh.
unique_id: Chain link fencing referred to in Sentence 3.2.5.6. shall be not lighter than 2.9 mm steel wire woven into a 50 mm diamond mesh.Type A Dedicated Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only trained and authorized personnel shall be permitted to operate industrial trucks, replace or refuel propane cylinders for fuel-fired industrial trucks, refuel fuel-fired industrial trucks, or charge batteries for battery-powered industrial trucks.
unique_id: Only trained and authorized personnel shall be permitted to operate industrial trucks, replace or refuel propane cylinders for fuel-fired industrial trucks, refuel fuel-fired industrial trucks, or charge batteries for battery-powered industrial trucks.Training

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where continuous mechanical ventilation is installed in order to meet the conditions of Sentence 4.1.7.2.(1), it shall be provided with automatic interlocks so that the activity generating flammable vapours cannot be performed when the ventilation system is not in operation, sound an audible alarm in an attended area upon shut-down of the ventilation system, and conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate Solids
unique_id: Where continuous mechanical ventilation is installed in order to meet the conditions of Sentence 4.1.7.2.(1), it shall be provided with automatic interlocks so that the activity generating flammable vapours cannot be performed when the ventilation system is not in operation, sound an audible alarm in an attended area upon shut-down of the ventilation system, and conform to NFPA 91-2010 Exhaust Systems for Air Conveying of Vapors, Gases, Mists, and Noncombustible Particulate SolidsVentilation Measures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as otherwise required by this Code, portable extinguishers shall be selected and installed in accordance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire Extinguishers
unique_id: Except as otherwise required by this Code, portable extinguishers shall be selected and installed in accordance with NFPA 10-2013 Portable Fire ExtinguishersSelection and Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Part includes requirements for the inspection, testing, maintenance, and operation of portable extinguishers, water-based fire protection systems, special extinguishing systems, fire alarm systems, emergency electrical power supply systems, emergency lighting, and exit signs.
unique_id: This Part includes requirements for the inspection, testing, maintenance, and operation of portable extinguishers, water-based fire protection systems, special extinguishing systems, fire alarm systems, emergency electrical power supply systems, emergency lighting, and exit signs.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When air exhausted by a dust collector described in this Article is returned to a building, the dust-collecting system shall be designed so that returned air will not create an explosion hazard inside the building, and the exhaust fan and ancillary equipment are automatically shut down in the event of a fire or an explosion inside the dust collector.
unique_id: When air exhausted by a dust collector described in this Article is returned to a building, the dust-collecting system shall be designed so that returned air will not create an explosion hazard inside the building, and the exhaust fan and ancillary equipment are automatically shut down in the event of a fire or an explosion inside the dust collector.Dust Collectors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every aboveground storage tank containing boil-over liquids shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances 0.75 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection referred to in Clause 4.3.2.1.(4) is not provided. (See Note A-4.3.2.1.(4).)
unique_id: Every aboveground storage tank containing boil-over liquids shall be separated from a property line or a building on the same property by distances 0.75 times those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection is provided against fire or explosion in the tank in conformance with Sentence 4.3.2.5.(2), or equal to those in Table 4.3.2.1., where protection referred to in Clause 4.3.2.1.(4) is not provided. (See Note A-4.3.2.1.(4).)Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system shall be provided.
unique_id: Where indoor piping for flammable liquids or combustible liquids is installed in trenches, a trapped drainage system shall be provided.Piping in Trenches

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by fire separations conforming to this Code and the NBC, but having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
unique_id: A laboratory shall be separated from other parts of the building by fire separations conforming to this Code and the NBC, but having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.Separation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping passing though the secondary containment walls of an aboveground storage tank shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.
unique_id: Piping passing though the secondary containment walls of an aboveground storage tank shall be designed to prevent excessive stress resulting from settlement or fire exposure.Arrangement of Aboveground Outdoor Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Mechanical connections in underground piping systems shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, not be in direct contact with the soil, and be provided within a transition sump.
unique_id: Mechanical connections in underground piping systems shall be readily accessible for inspection and maintenance, not be in direct contact with the soil, and be provided within a transition sump.Mechanical Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.2.3.(3), bed linen, window drapes and cubicle curtains shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-4.162-M80 Hospital Textiles – Flammability Performance Requirements if used in Group B, Division 2 treatment occupancies, and Group B, Division 3 care occupancies.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.2.3.(3), bed linen, window drapes and cubicle curtains shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-4.162-M80 Hospital Textiles – Flammability Performance Requirements if used in Group B, Division 2 treatment occupancies, and Group B, Division 3 care occupancies.Textiles in Group B Occupancies

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Used rags and similar materials contaminated with flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Article 2.4.1.3.
unique_id: Used rags and similar materials contaminated with flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be stored in receptacles conforming to Article 2.4.1.3.Removal of Combustibles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pumps located indoors shall be in rooms built in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. (See Note A-4.5.9.2.(1).)
unique_id: Pumps located indoors shall be in rooms built in conformance with Subsection 4.2.9. (See Note A-4.5.9.2.(1).)Pump Houses and Pump Rooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A drainage system referred to in Clause 4.1.6.1.(1) shall terminate at a location where such spill will not create a fire hazard or any risk to public health or safety, and direct the spill away from the areas identified in Sentence 4.1.6.1.(4).
unique_id: A drainage system referred to in Clause 4.1.6.1.(1) shall terminate at a location where such spill will not create a fire hazard or any risk to public health or safety, and direct the spill away from the areas identified in Sentence 4.1.6.1.(4).Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When a storage cabinet required in this Part is provided with ventilation openings, the ventilation openings shall be sealed with materials providing a fire protection at least equivalent to that required for the construction of the cabinet, or the cabinet shall be vented outdoors using vent piping providing a fire protection at least equivalent to that required in Clause 4.2.10.6.(1) for seals.
unique_id: When a storage cabinet required in this Part is provided with ventilation openings, the ventilation openings shall be sealed with materials providing a fire protection at least equivalent to that required for the construction of the cabinet, or the cabinet shall be vented outdoors using vent piping providing a fire protection at least equivalent to that required in Clause 4.2.10.6.(1) for seals.Ventilation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Instructions for the operation of dispensers in self-service outlets shall be posted in a conspicuous location.
unique_id: Instructions for the operation of dispensers in self-service outlets shall be posted in a conspicuous location.Self-service Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Controls for air-handling systems used for venting in the event of a fire shall be tested to ensure that air is exhausted from each floor area to the outdoors as required in Chapter 3, Sentence  of Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3)
unique_id: Controls for air-handling systems used for venting in the event of a fire shall be tested to ensure that air is exhausted from each floor area to the outdoors as required in Chapter 3, Sentence  of Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3)Air-Handling System Controls

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank that is below the liquid level and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.
unique_id: Each connection to an aboveground storage tank that is below the liquid level and through which liquid does not normally flow shall be provided with a liquid-tight closing device.Provision of Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Damaged or leaking packages or containers of dangerous goods shall be moved to a safe location and the product repackaged and labelled as soon as possible.
unique_id: Damaged or leaking packages or containers of dangerous goods shall be moved to a safe location and the product repackaged and labelled as soon as possible.Safety Precautions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
unique_id: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling CodeCompressed Gases

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except where they are equipped with hold-open devices conforming to the NBC, doors in fire separations that are required to be equipped with self-closing devices shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 24 h to ensure that they remain in the closed position when not in use.
unique_id: Except where they are equipped with hold-open devices conforming to the NBC, doors in fire separations that are required to be equipped with self-closing devices shall be inspected at intervals not greater than 24 h to ensure that they remain in the closed position when not in use.Inspection and Maintenance

ARTICLE_TITLE: Low Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code
unique_id: Pressure vessels shall be constructed in conformance with CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping CodeLow Pressure Storage Tanks and Pressure Vessels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be constructed of heavy timber or material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.
unique_id: The substructure and deck of a pier or wharf shall be designed for its intended use and shall be constructed of heavy timber or material that will provide adequate flexibility, resistance to shock, durability, strength and fire resistance.Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids in mercantile occupancies shall be kept in closed containers.
unique_id: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids in mercantile occupancies shall be kept in closed containers.Containers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure C is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure C, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when air is being injected into the stairshafts.
unique_id: Where Measure C is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure C, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in below grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they open automatically, if such means is provided, and remain open when air is being injected into the stairshafts.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows.
unique_id: Aboveground outdoor piping shall not be located on the exterior of walls except on those of noncombustible construction, or above windows.Arrangement of Aboveground Outdoor Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored in areas where they may be subject to temperature extremes or atmospheric pressure that could cause their containers to become deformed or rupture, or physical impact or temperature extremes that could cause a chemical reaction or chemical instability such that a fire could occur.
unique_id: Flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be stored in areas where they may be subject to temperature extremes or atmospheric pressure that could cause their containers to become deformed or rupture, or physical impact or temperature extremes that could cause a chemical reaction or chemical instability such that a fire could occur.Storage Arrangement and Conditions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where combustible materials, such as packaging materials, are used in a laboratory, their quantity shall not be greater than the supply for one day of normal operation.
unique_id: Where combustible materials, such as packaging materials, are used in a laboratory, their quantity shall not be greater than the supply for one day of normal operation.Combustible Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Emergency procedures conforming to Article 4.1.5.5. shall be established for refineries and process plants.
unique_id: Emergency procedures conforming to Article 4.1.5.5. shall be established for refineries and process plants.Emergency Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of this Subsection, aerosol products shall be classified as Level 1, 2 or 3 in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (See Note A-3.2.5.2.(1).)
unique_id: For the purposes of this Subsection, aerosol products shall be classified as Level 1, 2 or 3 in conformance with NFPA 30B-2015 Manufacture and Storage of Aerosol Products (See Note A-3.2.5.2.(1).)Classification

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A telephone or other clearly identified means to notify the fire department shall be provided in a location readily accessible to the user.
unique_id: A telephone or other clearly identified means to notify the fire department shall be provided in a location readily accessible to the user.Card- or Key-Activated Dispensers

ARTICLE_TITLE: Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment
FRAG_DOCUMENT: A secondary containment shall permit access to storage tanks, valves and ancillary equipment, egress from the contained space, and access for firefighting as specified in Article 4.3.2.4. (See Note A-4.3.7.5.(1).)
unique_id: A secondary containment shall permit access to storage tanks, valves and ancillary equipment, egress from the contained space, and access for firefighting as specified in Article 4.3.2.4. (See Note A-4.3.7.5.(1).)Access to Storage Tanks and Ancillary Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.5.10.7.(6).) (See Note A-4.6.1.1.)
unique_id: The maintenance of pressurized piping systems shall be carried out in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.5.10.7.(6).) (See Note A-4.6.1.1.)Maintenance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure M is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure M, and vent openings to the outdoors in above grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they can be opened manually and will remain open as provided in Sentence  of Measure M.
unique_id: Where Measure M is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested to ensure that the mechanical air supply to below grade stairshafts is initiated as provided in Sentence  of Measure M, and vent openings to the outdoors in above grade stairshafts shall be tested to ensure that they can be opened manually and will remain open as provided in Sentence  of Measure M.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent backflow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1).
unique_id: Check valves shall be provided for both water and flammable liquid or combustible liquid piping to prevent backflow in hydraulic transfer systems referred to in Sentence 4.5.9.5.(1).Hydraulic Transfer Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a container other than one of those listed in Article 4.2.3.1. shall be permitted only if the required purity of the liquid would be affected by containers of the types listed in Article 4.2.3.1. or if the liquid would cause the excessive corrosion of those types of containers, the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. has a capacity of not more than 1 L if used for Class I liquids and not more than 5 L if used for Class II or IIIA liquids, or the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. is a sample container used for quality control purposes or for testing by regulatory officials.
unique_id: The storage, handling and use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids in a container other than one of those listed in Article 4.2.3.1. shall be permitted only if the required purity of the liquid would be affected by containers of the types listed in Article 4.2.3.1. or if the liquid would cause the excessive corrosion of those types of containers, the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. has a capacity of not more than 1 L if used for Class I liquids and not more than 5 L if used for Class II or IIIA liquids, or the container not conforming to Article 4.2.3.1. is a sample container used for quality control purposes or for testing by regulatory officials.Other Types of Containers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence 4.5.9.3. shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.
unique_id: Pits provided in conformance with Sentence 4.5.9.3. shall not be larger than necessary for inspection and maintenance and shall be provided with a cover.Pits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When the flow of liquid can be stopped other than by the hose nozzle valve, a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is permitted to be used only if it is provided with a device that will automatically close the hose nozzle valve upon a drop of pressure in the dispensing hose.
unique_id: When the flow of liquid can be stopped other than by the hose nozzle valve, a hose nozzle valve with a hold-open device is permitted to be used only if it is provided with a device that will automatically close the hose nozzle valve upon a drop of pressure in the dispensing hose.Hose Nozzle Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
unique_id: Non-metallic piping systems are permitted to be used for underground installations, provided they conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S660-08 Nonmetallic Underground Piping for Flammable and Combustible LiquidsMaterials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where lecture bottles of dangerous goods classified as toxic gases or as compressed gases of pyrophoric materials are used in a laboratory, they shall be kept in a dedicated continuously mechanically ventilated hood or other continuously mechanically ventilated enclosure, and all exhaust shall be directed to a treatment system designed to process the accidental release of gas (see Note A-5.5.5.3.(5) and (b)).
unique_id: Where lecture bottles of dangerous goods classified as toxic gases or as compressed gases of pyrophoric materials are used in a laboratory, they shall be kept in a dedicated continuously mechanically ventilated hood or other continuously mechanically ventilated enclosure, and all exhaust shall be directed to a treatment system designed to process the accidental release of gas (see Note A-5.5.5.3.(5) and (b)).Compressed Gases

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Loose shavings and sawdust shall be collected at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Article 2.4.1.3.
unique_id: Loose shavings and sawdust shall be collected at frequent intervals and deposited in receptacles described in Article 2.4.1.3.Shavings and Sawdust Collection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In addition to the requirements of Part 6., components of fire emergency systems shall be maintained in conformance with Sentences 7.1.1.4.(2)to 7.1.1.4.(5).
unique_id: In addition to the requirements of Part 6., components of fire emergency systems shall be maintained in conformance with Sentences 7.1.1.4.(2)to 7.1.1.4.(5).Maintenance of Fire Emergency Systems

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components connected to the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the test procedure.
unique_id: Where test pressures exceed the design pressures for pumps or similar components connected to the piping system being tested, such pumps or components shall be isolated from the test procedure.Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where either of 2 aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences 4.3.2.2.(1)and 4.3.2.2. shall be doubled.
unique_id: Where either of 2 aboveground storage tanks contains unstable liquids, the distance required in Sentences 4.3.2.2.(1)and 4.3.2.2. shall be doubled.Spacing between Storage Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where Measure K is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that the mechanical air supply to vestibules is initiated as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure K, and doors to vestibules, if these are normally held open, will close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure K, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in above grade stairshafts and in vented vestibules shall be tested to ensure that they can be opened manually and will remain open as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure K.
unique_id: Where Measure K is used to limit smoke movement as provided in Commentary C of the CCBFC NRCC 40383 User's Guide – NBC 1995 Fire Protection, Occupant Safety and Accessibility (Part 3), switches at the central alarm and control facility shall be tested at intervals conforming to Article 7.2.1.1. to ensure that the mechanical air supply to vestibules is initiated as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure K, and doors to vestibules, if these are normally held open, will close automatically and remain closed as provided in Sentence  of Measure K, and closures in vent openings to the outdoors in above grade stairshafts and in vented vestibules shall be tested to ensure that they can be opened manually and will remain open as provided in Sentences  and  of Measure K.Test Procedures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Part applies to processes and operations that involve a risk from explosion, high flammability or related conditions that create a hazard to life safety.
unique_id: This Part applies to processes and operations that involve a risk from explosion, high flammability or related conditions that create a hazard to life safety.Application

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.
unique_id: Any process or activity that produces flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres in quantities sufficient to create a fire or explosion hazard shall be interrupted and the hazardous conditions shall be removed before any hot work is carried out.Protection of Combustible and Flammable Materials

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aisles in conformance with Sentences 2.7.1.2.(2)to 2.7.1.2. shall be provided in every floor area that is not subdivided into rooms or suites served by corridors giving access to exits, and is required by the NBC to have more than one egress doorway.
unique_id: Aisles in conformance with Sentences 2.7.1.2.(2)to 2.7.1.2. shall be provided in every floor area that is not subdivided into rooms or suites served by corridors giving access to exits, and is required by the NBC to have more than one egress doorway.Open Floor Areas

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flammable liquids, combustible liquidsand dangerous goods classified as corrosives shall not be stored with dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials in quantities or in a manner that would constitute an undue risk in the event of a fire.
unique_id: Flammable liquids, combustible liquidsand dangerous goods classified as corrosives shall not be stored with dangerous goods classified as radioactive materials in quantities or in a manner that would constitute an undue risk in the event of a fire.Separation from Other Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Vent piping shall be tested for leaks at the commissioning stage in conformance with Clause 4.4.1.2.(1)(a).
unique_id: Vent piping shall be tested for leaks at the commissioning stage in conformance with Clause 4.4.1.2.(1)(a).Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Nozzles for standpipe and hose systems shall conform to Sentence 3.2.5.11. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Nozzles for standpipe and hose systems shall conform to Sentence 3.2.5.11. of Division B of the NBC.Fire Protection

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.
unique_id: Electric power supply shall be shut off to the premises undergoing fumigation or thermal insecticidal fogging.Electric Power

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.3.1.(3)and 4.1.3.1.(4), the flash point of liquids having a kinematic viscosity less than 6 cSt at 37.8°C and a flash point below 93.3°C shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D 56-05 Flash Point by Tag Closed Cup Tester
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.3.1.(3)and 4.1.3.1.(4), the flash point of liquids having a kinematic viscosity less than 6 cSt at 37.8°C and a flash point below 93.3°C shall be determined in conformance with ASTM D 56-05 Flash Point by Tag Closed Cup TesterDetermination of Flash Point

FRAG_DOCUMENT: It is permitted to waive the clearance required in Sentence 3.3.3.2. if the stored products do not consist of wood chips, hogged material, rubber tires or combustible pallets, the exposed wall of the building has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, and the stored products are separated from any unprotected wall opening by a horizontal distance of not less than 3 m on either side of the opening, and 6 m perpendicularly in front of the opening.
unique_id: It is permitted to waive the clearance required in Sentence 3.3.3.2. if the stored products do not consist of wood chips, hogged material, rubber tires or combustible pallets, the exposed wall of the building has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h, and the stored products are separated from any unprotected wall opening by a horizontal distance of not less than 3 m on either side of the opening, and 6 m perpendicularly in front of the opening.Individual Storage Areas and Clearance

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the contained space created by the secondary containment is not accessible for an internal visual examination, and the secondary containment is not sloped so as to permit liquid to flow to a specific location that can be monitored, a monitoring device shall be provided to indicate the loss of integrity of the secondary containment.
unique_id: Where the contained space created by the secondary containment is not accessible for an internal visual examination, and the secondary containment is not sloped so as to permit liquid to flow to a specific location that can be monitored, a monitoring device shall be provided to indicate the loss of integrity of the secondary containment.Leak Detection

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing piping systems, except that pressure piping normally containing Class I liquids is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.
unique_id: Class I liquids shall not be used for pressure testing piping systems, except that pressure piping normally containing Class I liquids is permitted to be tested with such liquids at pressures not exceeding their maximum operating pressures.Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where more than 25 000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.
unique_id: Where more than 25 000 L of distilled beverage alcohol in storage tanks, drums or barrels are stored inside buildings, such buildings shall be sprinklered.Storage Tanks, Drums and Barrels

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. or be removed from the premises. (See Note A-2.4.1.3.(1).)
unique_id: Materials subject to spontaneous ignition, such as oily rags, shall be deposited in a receptacle conforming to Sentence 2.4.1.3. or be removed from the premises. (See Note A-2.4.1.3.(1).)Waste Receptacles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases are stored outdoors, they shall be supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms, and located in an enclosure fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.
unique_id: Where cylinders of dangerous goods classified as compressed gases are stored outdoors, they shall be supported on raised concrete or other noncombustible platforms, and located in an enclosure fenced in conformance with Article 3.3.2.6.Location

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in this Section, the storage and dispensing ofdangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations shall conform to CSA B108-14 Compressed Natural Gas Fuelling Stations Installation Code CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
unique_id: Except as provided in this Section, the storage and dispensing ofdangerous goods classified as flammable gases at fuel-dispensing stations shall conform to CSA B108-14 Compressed Natural Gas Fuelling Stations Installation Code CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling CodeApplication

ARTICLE_TITLE: Protocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Test devices and methods shall conform to the performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping
unique_id: Test devices and methods shall conform to the performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid PipingProtocols for Liquid Media Leak Detection Testing of Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Containers and storage tanks shall not be filled beyond their safe filling level.
unique_id: Containers and storage tanks shall not be filled beyond their safe filling level.Containers and Storage Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall be stored in detached buildings, in areas separated from the remainder of the storage area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less that 1 h, or in areas where the vehicles will not create a fire hazard to the storage area.
unique_id: Fuel-fired industrial trucks shall be stored in detached buildings, in areas separated from the remainder of the storage area by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less that 1 h, or in areas where the vehicles will not create a fire hazard to the storage area.Fuel-Fired Industrial Trucks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where equipment is provided to melt snow or ice on exterior passageways and exterior exit stairs serving an occupied building, such equipment shall be maintained in working order or alternative measures shall be taken to comply with Sentence 2.7.1.7.(1).
unique_id: Where equipment is provided to melt snow or ice on exterior passageways and exterior exit stairs serving an occupied building, such equipment shall be maintained in working order or alternative measures shall be taken to comply with Sentence 2.7.1.7.(1).Exterior Passageways and Exit Stairs

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.
unique_id: Containers for flammable liquids or combustible liquids stored indoors shall be stored in conformance with Subsection 4.2.7.Container Storage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Openings for measuring liquid levels in underground storage tanks if independent of the fill pipe shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap or cover which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.
unique_id: Openings for measuring liquid levels in underground storage tanks if independent of the fill pipe shall be equipped with a vapour-tight cap or cover which shall be opened only when measuring the liquid level.Openings for Measuring Liquid Level

ARTICLE_TITLE: Storage and Use of Dangerous Goods
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dangerous goods shall be used in conformance with Part 5.
unique_id: Dangerous goods shall be used in conformance with Part 5.Storage and Use of Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.5.3.(2), 2 or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.3.5.3.(2), 2 or more storage tanks are permitted to be connected to a common vent pipe for normal relief venting provided the vent pipe size is designed to vent the combined vapours produced in the connected tanks without exceeding the allowable stresses of the tanks.Interconnection of Vent Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.
unique_id: In areas where general cargo is handled or where piping might be subject to physical damage from vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, the piping shall be protected by means of guarding devices.Guards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Spill containment sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C58.19-1992 Spill Containment Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage Tanks
unique_id: Spill containment sumps shall conform to the construction and performance requirements of ULC ULC/ORD-C58.19-1992 Spill Containment Devices for Underground Flammable Liquid Storage TanksConstruction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids between tanks of marine vessels and piers or wharves shall be through flexible cargo hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a)), or jointed tubing or piping suitable for the cargo to be transferred, and designed to withstand the maximum design working pressure.
unique_id: The transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids between tanks of marine vessels and piers or wharves shall be through flexible cargo hose designed in conformance with good engineering practice (see Note A-4.8.8.1.(1)(a)), or jointed tubing or piping suitable for the cargo to be transferred, and designed to withstand the maximum design working pressure.Cargo Hose

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection shall apply to the storage of combustible fibres inside buildings.
unique_id: This Subsection shall apply to the storage of combustible fibres inside buildings.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to processes in which products or materials are immersed in a dip tank containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the unatomized application of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, such as by flow coating or roll coating processes.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to processes in which products or materials are immersed in a dip tank containing flammable liquids or combustible liquids, and the unatomized application of flammable liquids or combustible liquids, such as by flow coating or roll coating processes.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When a covered mall having a width of not less than 9 m has been provided for the purpose of considering each portion of the building separated by the mall as a separate building, merchandising or public activities are permitted within the required 9 m width provided alternative protection is installed in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1..
unique_id: When a covered mall having a width of not less than 9 m has been provided for the purpose of considering each portion of the building separated by the mall as a separate building, merchandising or public activities are permitted within the required 9 m width provided alternative protection is installed in conformance with Article 1.2.1.1..Alternatives to Spatial Separation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14. consist of multiple products within the same class, the individual class and division placard shall be posted.
unique_id: Where the dangerous goods identified in Sentence 3.2.7.14. consist of multiple products within the same class, the individual class and division placard shall be posted.Placards

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Battery-charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be located at least 1.5 m from combustible materials, when serving more than 2 trucks, in well ventilated areas, in areas where flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are not present in hazardous quantities, and in areas where precautions are taken to prevent ignition sources, such as open flames, sparks or electric arcs.
unique_id: Battery-charging installations for battery-powered industrial trucks shall be located at least 1.5 m from combustible materials, when serving more than 2 trucks, in well ventilated areas, in areas where flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are not present in hazardous quantities, and in areas where precautions are taken to prevent ignition sources, such as open flames, sparks or electric arcs.Battery-Powered Industrial Trucks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The clearance between the top of storage and the ceiling sprinkler deflectors or other overhead fire protection systems shall be in accordance with the standard used for the design of the respective system.
