unique_id: The clearance between the top of storage and the ceiling sprinkler deflectors or other overhead fire protection systems shall be in accordance with the standard used for the design of the respective system.Clearances

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa  at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.
unique_id: The static head imposed on a storage tank inside a building shall not exceed 70 kPa  at the bottom of the tank when the vent or fill pipe is filled with liquid unless the tank is designed for greater pressures.Maximum Static Head

ARTICLE_TITLE: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pipe leak detection referred to in this Section shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping (See also Articles 4.4.3.3.and 4.4.3.4.)
unique_id: Pipe leak detection referred to in this Section shall conform to ULC ULC/ORD-C107.12-1992 Line Leak Detection Devices for Flammable Liquid Piping (See also Articles 4.4.3.3.and 4.4.3.4.)Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 2.14., 3.4., 4.12., 5.7., 6.9. and 7.4. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
unique_id: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 2.14., 3.4., 4.12., 5.7., 6.9. and 7.4. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)Attribution to Acceptable Solutions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storage of closed containers of distilled beverage alcohols, packaging materials and empty bottles, drums, barrels and pallets shall be in conformance with Part 3..
unique_id: Storage of closed containers of distilled beverage alcohols, packaging materials and empty bottles, drums, barrels and pallets shall be in conformance with Part 3..Closed Containers and Storage Aids

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Measures to control spilled liquid or solid dangerous goods shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.
unique_id: Measures to control spilled liquid or solid dangerous goods shall be provided in conformance with Subsection 4.1.6.Spill Control

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In the design of the piping system, provisions shall be made for the expansion, contraction, vibration, settling and temperature changes of piping in accordance with Article 4.5.6.14.
unique_id: In the design of the piping system, provisions shall be made for the expansion, contraction, vibration, settling and temperature changes of piping in accordance with Article 4.5.6.14.Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In addition to the requirements of Article 4.3.9.2., the sumps referred to in Sentences 4.3.9.1.(1)to 4.3.9.1. shall be installed in conformance with the sump manufacturer's instructions.
unique_id: In addition to the requirements of Article 4.3.9.2., the sumps referred to in Sentences 4.3.9.1.(1)to 4.3.9.1. shall be installed in conformance with the sump manufacturer's instructions.Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Portable tanks having a capacity greater than 2 500 L shall be installed in conformance with Section 4.3.
unique_id: Portable tanks having a capacity greater than 2 500 L shall be installed in conformance with Section 4.3.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Heating appliances shall not be permitted in a fire compartment used for the storage of dangerous goodsclassified as flammable gases, flammable liquids, flammable solids, pyrophoric materials, water-reactive substances, oxidizers or organic peroxides, unless they are installed in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard.
unique_id: Heating appliances shall not be permitted in a fire compartment used for the storage of dangerous goodsclassified as flammable gases, flammable liquids, flammable solids, pyrophoric materials, water-reactive substances, oxidizers or organic peroxides, unless they are installed in a manner that will not create a fire or explosion hazard.Ignition Sources

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Liquid fuel storage tanks shall be drained and refilled with fresh fuel at intervals not greater than 12 months. (See Note A-6.5.1.5.(1).)
unique_id: Liquid fuel storage tanks shall be drained and refilled with fresh fuel at intervals not greater than 12 months. (See Note A-6.5.1.5.(1).)Supply of Fresh Fuel

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The storage of dangerous goods in quantities exceeding the maximum exempted amounts stated in Table 3.2.7.1., in a single individual storage area, shall conform to this Subsection.
unique_id: The storage of dangerous goods in quantities exceeding the maximum exempted amounts stated in Table 3.2.7.1., in a single individual storage area, shall conform to this Subsection.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in self-service storage buildings within the scope of Section 3.9. of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: This Subsection applies to the storage and handling of flammable liquids and combustible liquids in self-service storage buildings within the scope of Section 3.9. of Division B of the NBC.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The storage method and maximum height of storage as described in Clauses 3.2.2.5.(2)(b)and 3.2.2.5.(2) shall be posted in the storage area.
unique_id: The storage method and maximum height of storage as described in Clauses 3.2.2.5.(2)(b)and 3.2.2.5.(2) shall be posted in the storage area.Fire Safety Plan

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence 4.5.10.5.(2).
unique_id: Open flames and spark-producing devices shall not be used for leakage detection referred to in Sentence 4.5.10.5.(2).Visual Inspections

ARTICLE_TITLE: Location of Air Inlets and Outlets
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the flammable vapour being removed is lighter than air, at least one air inlet shall be located at a point near a wall, and no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling, and at least one air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling.
unique_id: Where the flammable vapour being removed is lighter than air, at least one air inlet shall be located at a point near a wall, and no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling, and at least one air outlet shall be located near the opposite wall, no lower than 300 mm from the ceiling.Location of Air Inlets and Outlets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Aisles shall be maintained free of obstruction.
unique_id: Aisles shall be maintained free of obstruction.Access Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.1.1. and except as otherwise specified in this Code, this Section provides the minimum requirements regarding the detection of leaks in aboveground and underground storage tanks, piping systems and sumps.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 4.4.1.1. and except as otherwise specified in this Code, this Section provides the minimum requirements regarding the detection of leaks in aboveground and underground storage tanks, piping systems and sumps.Application

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11. shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.
unique_id: In buildings of steel frame construction, piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.11. shall be fastened to steel beams or columns by pipe hangers attached to the flanges.Overhead Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.
unique_id: Any part of a building where floor finishing operations are done shall not be open to the public.Public Access

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.2.5.4.(2), in mercantile occupancies, the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from or into containers shall only be permitted in a storage room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9. (See Note A-4.2.5.4.(1).)
unique_id: Except as permitted in Sentence 4.2.5.4.(2), in mercantile occupancies, the transfer of flammable liquids or combustible liquids from or into containers shall only be permitted in a storage room conforming to Subsection 4.2.9. (See Note A-4.2.5.4.(1).)Transfer

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where 2 or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity permitted in the pile shall be equal to that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.
unique_id: Where 2 or more liquids with different flash points are stored outdoors in containers that form a single pile, the maximum total quantity permitted in the pile shall be equal to that permitted for the liquid with the lowest flash point.Mixed Storage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Dangerous goods shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.13.
unique_id: Dangerous goods shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.13.Emergency Planning

ARTICLE_TITLE: Tank, Piping and Machinery Reservoir Safety at Demolition Sites
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site shall be taken out of service in conformance with Subsection 4.3.16.
unique_id: Tanks, piping and machinery reservoirs at a demolition site shall be taken out of service in conformance with Subsection 4.3.16.Tank, Piping and Machinery Reservoir Safety at Demolition Sites

ARTICLE_TITLE: Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring
FRAG_DOCUMENT: The precision leak detection test for underground storage tanks that is referred to in this Section shall be capable of detecting a storage tank leak rate as small as 0.38 L/h within 24 h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less (see Note A-4.4.2.1.(10)(a)), and be conducted by an individual who has been trained in the proper care and use of the test equipment and the operating procedures. (See also Sentences 4.4.3.1. and 4.4.3.1.(3).)
unique_id: The precision leak detection test for underground storage tanks that is referred to in this Section shall be capable of detecting a storage tank leak rate as small as 0.38 L/h within 24 h with a probability of detection of 0.95 or greater and a probability of false alarm of 0.05 or less (see Note A-4.4.2.1.(10)(a)), and be conducted by an individual who has been trained in the proper care and use of the test equipment and the operating procedures. (See also Sentences 4.4.3.1. and 4.4.3.1.(3).)Definition and Performance of Leak Detection Testing and Monitoring

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Refrigerators described in Sentence 4.1.4.1. shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.14.
unique_id: Refrigerators described in Sentence 4.1.4.1. shall be identified in conformance with Article 3.2.7.14.Refrigerated Storage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pits for subsurface pumps for piping systems or for piping connected to submersible pumps shall be designed to withstand the forces to which they may be subjected without causing damage to the system.
unique_id: Pits for subsurface pumps for piping systems or for piping connected to submersible pumps shall be designed to withstand the forces to which they may be subjected without causing damage to the system.Pits

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Means of egress shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC.
unique_id: Means of egress shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC.Means of Egress

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A dispenser sump shall be provided under a dispenser, unless the dispenser is located on top of an aboveground storage tank.
unique_id: A dispenser sump shall be provided under a dispenser, unless the dispenser is located on top of an aboveground storage tank.Installation

ARTICLE_TITLE: Inspection, Maintenance and Testing of Fire Safety Devices
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where specific references to the inspection, maintenance and testing of fire safety devices and building fire safety features are not made in this Code, such devices and features shall be maintained to ensure they operate as per their design or function according to their original intent.
unique_id: Where specific references to the inspection, maintenance and testing of fire safety devices and building fire safety features are not made in this Code, such devices and features shall be maintained to ensure they operate as per their design or function according to their original intent.Inspection, Maintenance and Testing of Fire Safety Devices

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.4.3.(2)and 3.3.4.8.(1), dangerous goods shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 3.2.7.6.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 3.3.4.3.(2)and 3.3.4.8.(1), dangerous goods shall be separated from other dangerous goods in conformance with Article 3.2.7.6.Separation from Other Dangerous Goods

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except at distilleries covered in Section 4.10., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.5.2., Subsection 4.5.3.and 4.5.5.
unique_id: Except at distilleries covered in Section 4.10., vent piping materials and construction shall conform to Subsections 4.5.2., Subsection 4.5.3.and 4.5.5.Materials and Construction

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fuelled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.
unique_id: Where a covered mall is used for the display of fuelled equipment, batteries shall be disconnected and caps for fuel tanks shall be locked or secured against tampering.Fuelled Equipment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leak detection testing in areas where explosive mixtures of flammable liquid or combustible liquid vapours and air may be present in the vicinity of a storage tank that has been in use.
unique_id: Measures shall be taken to guard against the hazards associated with pneumatic leak detection testing in areas where explosive mixtures of flammable liquid or combustible liquid vapours and air may be present in the vicinity of a storage tank that has been in use.Pneumatic Leak Detection Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings regulated by Sentence 3.2.7.12.(1), access openings to each storey provided in conformance with the NBC shall be not less than 750 mm wide by 1 100 mm high. (See Note A-3.2.7.12.(3).)
unique_id: In buildings regulated by Sentence 3.2.7.12.(1), access openings to each storey provided in conformance with the NBC shall be not less than 750 mm wide by 1 100 mm high. (See Note A-3.2.7.12.(3).)Fire Department Access

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Ammonium nitrate classified as oxidizers and dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall not be stored in an area where the ambient air temperature is higher than 52°C.
unique_id: Ammonium nitrate classified as oxidizers and dangerous goods classified as compressed gases shall not be stored in an area where the ambient air temperature is higher than 52°C.Ambient Temperature

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as specifically prescribed in this Part, all tests specified in this Section and Section 7.3. shall be carried out at intervals not greater than 3 months, except that longer intervals between tests are permitted in conformance with Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b). (See Note A-7.2.1.1.(1).)
unique_id: Except as specifically prescribed in this Part, all tests specified in this Section and Section 7.3. shall be carried out at intervals not greater than 3 months, except that longer intervals between tests are permitted in conformance with Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b). (See Note A-7.2.1.1.(1).)Intervals between Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.
unique_id: Access aisles not less than 1.0 m wide shall be provided to fire department access panels and to fire protection equipment.Access Aisles

FRAG_DOCUMENT: ASTM D 3828-16a Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester is permitted to be used for testing aviation turbine fuels within the scope of this procedure.
unique_id: ASTM D 3828-16a Flash Point by Small Scale Closed Cup Tester is permitted to be used for testing aviation turbine fuels within the scope of this procedure.Determination of Flash Point

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Roofing operations and other surface applications that involve heat sources and hot processes shall be considered hot works and shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 5.6.1.7.(2)and 5.6.1.7. and Section 5.2.
unique_id: Roofing operations and other surface applications that involve heat sources and hot processes shall be considered hot works and shall conform to the requirements in Sentences 5.6.1.7.(2)and 5.6.1.7. and Section 5.2.Hot Surface Applications

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.
unique_id: In processes where an explosion hazard is present and conditions exist that prevent adequate explosion venting as required in this Section, an explosion prevention system shall be provided.Explosion Prevention Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For closed containers of distilled beverage alcohol, the sprinkler system referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.3. shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-3.2.3.3.(2).)
unique_id: For closed containers of distilled beverage alcohol, the sprinkler system referred to in Sentence 3.2.3.3. shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-3.2.3.3.(2).)Sprinkler Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 2.1.5.1.(2), portable extinguishers used to comply with this Code shall conform to the following performance standards as applicable: ULC CAN/ULC-S503-05 Carbon-Dioxide Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S504-12 Dry Chemical Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S507-05 Water Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S512-M87 Halogenated Agent Hand and Wheeled Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S554-16 Water Based Agent Fire Extinguishers and ULC CAN/ULC-S566-17 Halocarbon Clean Agent Fire Extinguishers
unique_id: Notwithstanding the requirements of Sentence 2.1.5.1.(2), portable extinguishers used to comply with this Code shall conform to the following performance standards as applicable: ULC CAN/ULC-S503-05 Carbon-Dioxide Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S504-12 Dry Chemical Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S507-05 Water Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S512-M87 Halogenated Agent Hand and Wheeled Fire Extinguishers ULC CAN/ULC-S554-16 Water Based Agent Fire Extinguishers and ULC CAN/ULC-S566-17 Halocarbon Clean Agent Fire ExtinguishersSelection and Installation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: All penetrations into a sump shall be situated at least 50 mm from the bottom of the sump. (See Note A-4.5.5.7.(1).)
unique_id: All penetrations into a sump shall be situated at least 50 mm from the bottom of the sump. (See Note A-4.5.5.7.(1).)Penetrations into Sumps

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except where a building is provided with a fire alarm system or similar equipment, a watch, with tours at intervals of not more than 1 h, shall be provided when a portion of the building is occupied while construction operations are taking place.
unique_id: Except where a building is provided with a fire alarm system or similar equipment, a watch, with tours at intervals of not more than 1 h, shall be provided when a portion of the building is occupied while construction operations are taking place.Watch

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Containers and storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be kept closed when not in use.
unique_id: Containers and storage tanks for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be kept closed when not in use.Containers and Storage Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: If the vents of the receiving or delivery tank are obstructed, the transfer of liquid shall be stopped.
unique_id: If the vents of the receiving or delivery tank are obstructed, the transfer of liquid shall be stopped.Unloading

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-16 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe Joints
unique_id: Threaded joints in piping systems for flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made using joint compound or polytetrafluoroethylene tape conforming to ULC CAN/ULC-S642-16 Compounds and Tapes for Threaded Pipe JointsThreaded Joints

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Separations in Partly Occupied Buildings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where part of a building continues to be occupied, the occupied part shall be separated from the part being demolished or constructed by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.
unique_id: Where part of a building continues to be occupied, the occupied part shall be separated from the part being demolished or constructed by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.Fire Separations in Partly Occupied Buildings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention Systems
unique_id: When an explosion prevention system is required in this Section, it shall be designed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in NFPA 69-2014 Explosion Prevention SystemsExplosion Prevention Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 2.4.5.1. to 2.4.5.1. and in Article 2.4.5.2., fixtures shall be protected by a separate trap.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 2.4.5.1. to 2.4.5.1. and in Article 2.4.5.2., fixtures shall be protected by a separate trap.Traps for Sanitary Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: An indirectly connected fixture that can discharge only clear-water waste other than a drinking fountain need not be protected by a trap. (See Clause 2.4.2.1.(1) for indirect connections.)
unique_id: An indirectly connected fixture that can discharge only clear-water waste other than a drinking fountain need not be protected by a trap. (See Clause 2.4.2.1.(1) for indirect connections.)Traps for Sanitary Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.3.12.(2), joints in copper tubes installed underground shall be made with either flared or compression fittings, or be brazed using a brazing alloy within the American Welding Society's AWS-BCuP range.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.3.12.(2), joints in copper tubes installed underground shall be made with either flared or compression fittings, or be brazed using a brazing alloy within the American Welding Society's AWS-BCuP range.Copper Joints Used Underground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The developed length of a building sewer between the building and the first manhole to which the building sewer connects shall not exceed 75 m.
unique_id: The developed length of a building sewer between the building and the first manhole to which the building sewer connects shall not exceed 75 m.Size and Spacing of Cleanouts

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe. (See Note A-2.4.6.4.(6).)
unique_id: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe. (See Note A-2.4.6.4.(6).)Protection from Backflow

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The vent stack required by Sentence 2.5.4.2. shall be connected to a vertical section of the soil-or-waste stack at or immediately below the lowest soil-or-waste pipe connected to the soil-or-waste stack.
unique_id: The vent stack required by Sentence 2.5.4.2. shall be connected to a vertical section of the soil-or-waste stack at or immediately below the lowest soil-or-waste pipe connected to the soil-or-waste stack.Vent Stacks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Storage-type service water heaters that are located in a ceiling or roof space, or over a floor of wood construction, shall be installed within a corrosion-resistant watertight drain pan, as described in Sentence 2.6.1.7.(10).
unique_id: Storage-type service water heaters that are located in a ceiling or roof space, or over a floor of wood construction, shall be installed within a corrosion-resistant watertight drain pan, as described in Sentence 2.6.1.7.(10).Relief Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Installed air admittance valves shall be accessible, and located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.
unique_id: Installed air admittance valves shall be accessible, and located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.Installation Conditions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.
unique_id: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.Stainless Steel Pipe

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a public or private sewage disposal system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.
unique_id: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a public or private sewage disposal system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.Sewage Treatment

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except (See Note A-2.2.6.7.(3).)) in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
unique_id: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except (See Note A-2.2.6.7.(3).)) in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.Steel Pipe

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 2.6.3.2.A and 2.6.3.2.D when using a detailed engineering design method.
unique_id: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 2.6.3.2.A and 2.6.3.2.D when using a detailed engineering design method.Hydraulic Load

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Screwed cast-iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.
unique_id: Screwed cast-iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.Screwed Cast-Iron Water Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping used as an internal leader, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.
unique_id: Piping used as an internal leader, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.Protection from Condensation

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pipes that pass through an exterior wall to supply water to the exterior of the building shall be provided with a frost-proof hydrant, or a stop-and-waste cock located inside the building and close to the wall.
unique_id: Pipes that pass through an exterior wall to supply water to the exterior of the building shall be provided with a frost-proof hydrant, or a stop-and-waste cock located inside the building and close to the wall.Protection for Exterior Water Supply

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.7.4.(3), the use of copper tube shall conform to Table 2.2.7.4.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.7.4.(3), the use of copper tube shall conform to Table 2.2.7.4.Copper Tube

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Piping shall be provided with support that is capable of keeping the pipe in alignment and bearing the weight of the pipe and its contents.
unique_id: Piping shall be provided with support that is capable of keeping the pipe in alignment and bearing the weight of the pipe and its contents.Capability of Support

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Additional circuit vents shall be required where each cumulative horizontal change in direction of a branch served by a circuit vent exceeds 45° between vent pipe connections, or where more than 8 circuit-vented fixtures are connected to a branch between vent pipe connections.
unique_id: Additional circuit vents shall be required where each cumulative horizontal change in direction of a branch served by a circuit vent exceeds 45° between vent pipe connections, or where more than 8 circuit-vented fixtures are connected to a branch between vent pipe connections.Circuit Venting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube.
unique_id: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube.Insulation of Support

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Pedestal urinals, floor-mounted water closets and S-trap standards shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast-iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast-iron pipe.
unique_id: Pedestal urinals, floor-mounted water closets and S-trap standards shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast-iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast-iron pipe.Connection of Floor Outlet Fixtures

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Water hammer arresters shall conform to ASSE ANSI/ASSE 1010-2004 Water Hammer Arresters
unique_id: Water hammer arresters shall conform to ASSE ANSI/ASSE 1010-2004 Water Hammer ArrestersWater Hammer Arresters

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Connections between 2 pipes of different sizes shall be made with an increaser or a reducer fitting installed so that it permits the system to be completely drained.
unique_id: Connections between 2 pipes of different sizes shall be made with an increaser or a reducer fitting installed so that it permits the system to be completely drained.Increaser or Reducer

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Drainage systems shall have at least one vent that terminates to the outdoors in conformance with Sentence 2.5.6.5.(1).
unique_id: Drainage systems shall have at least one vent that terminates to the outdoors in conformance with Sentence 2.5.6.5.(1).Installation Conditions

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.4.6.(2), nominally horizontal piping that is underground shall be supported on a base that is firm and continuous under the whole of the pipe. (See Note A-2.3.4.6.(1).)
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.4.6.(2), nominally horizontal piping that is underground shall be supported on a base that is firm and continuous under the whole of the pipe. (See Note A-2.3.4.6.(1).)Support for Underground Horizontal Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage or in an area where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow through the hose bibb.
unique_id: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage or in an area where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow through the hose bibb.Hose Bibb

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tank-type water closets shall be provided with a back-siphonage preventer in conformance with Sentence 2.2.10.10.(2).
unique_id: Tank-type water closets shall be provided with a back-siphonage preventer in conformance with Sentence 2.2.10.10.(2).Tank-Type Water Closets

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Polyethylene pipe used underground outside a building for the rehabilitation of existing drainage systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F 714-13 Polyethylene  Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter and shall be HDPE 3408 and SDR 11 or heavier. (See Note A-2.2.5.4.(1).)
unique_id: Polyethylene pipe used underground outside a building for the rehabilitation of existing drainage systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F 714-13 Polyethylene  Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter and shall be HDPE 3408 and SDR 11 or heavier. (See Note A-2.2.5.4.(1).)Polyethylene Pipe Used Underground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for risers that serve only one dwelling unit, risers shall be provided with a shut-off valve located at the source of supply.
unique_id: Except for risers that serve only one dwelling unit, risers shall be provided with a shut-off valve located at the source of supply.Shut-off Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a fixture or device is indirectly connected, the connections shall be made by terminating the fixture drain above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture to form an air break.
unique_id: Where a fixture or device is indirectly connected, the connections shall be made by terminating the fixture drain above the flood level rim of a directly connected fixture to form an air break.Indirect Connections

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Each lavatory in a public washroom shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Note A-2.2.10.6. and .)
unique_id: Each lavatory in a public washroom shall be equipped with a device capable of automatically shutting off the flow of water when the lavatory is not in use. (See Note A-2.2.10.6. and .)Supply and Waste Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A soil-or-waste pipe is permitted to serve as a wet vent, provided the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 2.5.8.1., the number of wet-vented water closets does not exceed 2, where 2 water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level by means of a double sanitary T fitting if the vent pipe is vertical and by means of a double Y fitting if the vent pipe is horizontal, the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 inches in size, except for connections from emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 2.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than 2 fixture units, are connected to the wet vent or a wet-vented water closet trap arm, the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent are not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, where a wet vent extends through more than one storey, the total discharge from any one storey above the first storey does not exceed 4 fixture units, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and the offset does not exceed 1.2 m for pipes 2 inches or less in size, or the offset does not exceed 2.5 m for pipes larger than 2 inches in size, the wet-vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), and the length of the wet vent is not limited.
unique_id: A soil-or-waste pipe is permitted to serve as a wet vent, provided the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 2.5.8.1., the number of wet-vented water closets does not exceed 2, where 2 water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level by means of a double sanitary T fitting if the vent pipe is vertical and by means of a double Y fitting if the vent pipe is horizontal, the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 inches in size, except for connections from emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 2.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than 2 fixture units, are connected to the wet vent or a wet-vented water closet trap arm, the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent are not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, where a wet vent extends through more than one storey, the total discharge from any one storey above the first storey does not exceed 4 fixture units, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and the offset does not exceed 1.2 m for pipes 2 inches or less in size, or the offset does not exceed 2.5 m for pipes larger than 2 inches in size, the wet-vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), and the length of the wet vent is not limited.Wet Venting

ARTICLE_TITLE: Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
FRAG_DOCUMENT: For the purposes of Table 2.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil-or-waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, vent header or outside air.
unique_id: For the purposes of Table 2.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil-or-waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, vent header or outside air.Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall conform to ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard and ASTM A 182/A 182M-16a Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or AWWA ANSI/AWWA C228-08 Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges for Water Service – Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1,800 mm)
unique_id: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall conform to ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard and ASTM A 182/A 182M-16a Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or AWWA ANSI/AWWA C228-08 Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges for Water Service – Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1,800 mm)Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where piping may be exposed to freezing conditions, it shall be protected from the effects of freezing.
unique_id: Where piping may be exposed to freezing conditions, it shall be protected from the effects of freezing.Protection Against Freezing

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The design and installation of every piping system shall include means to accommodate its expansion and contraction caused by temperature changes, movement of the soil, building shrinkage or structural settlement. (See Note A-2.3.3.9.(1).)
unique_id: The design and installation of every piping system shall include means to accommodate its expansion and contraction caused by temperature changes, movement of the soil, building shrinkage or structural settlement. (See Note A-2.3.3.9.(1).)Expansion and Contraction

ARTICLE_TITLE: Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Branch vents, vent headers, circuit vents and continuous vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.8.3., unless they are individual vents or dual vents.
unique_id: Branch vents, vent headers, circuit vents and continuous vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.8.3., unless they are individual vents or dual vents.Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 2.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 2.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.Offset Relief Vents

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS drainage system to a PVC drainage system.
unique_id: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS drainage system to a PVC drainage system.Transition Solvent Cement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil-or-waste stack is 1.5 m or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.B or Table 2.4.10.6.C, whichever is the less restrictive.
unique_id: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil-or-waste stack is 1.5 m or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.B or Table 2.4.10.6.C, whichever is the less restrictive.Hydraulic Loads to Soil-or-Waste Pipes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be sized less than ¾ inch.
unique_id: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be sized less than ¾ inch.Size

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the NBC.
unique_id: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the NBC.Lighting and Ventilation Requirements

ARTICLE_TITLE: Cooling of Hot Water or Sewage
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a fixture discharges sewage or clear-water waste that is at a temperature above 75°C, provision shall be made for cooling of the waste to 75°C or less before it is discharged to the drainage system.
unique_id: Where a fixture discharges sewage or clear-water waste that is at a temperature above 75°C, provision shall be made for cooling of the waste to 75°C or less before it is discharged to the drainage system.Cooling of Hot Water or Sewage

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.
unique_id: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.Sheet Metal Leaders

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Sanitary drainage systems and storm drainage systems shall be provided with cleanouts that will permit cleaning of the entire system.
unique_id: Sanitary drainage systems and storm drainage systems shall be provided with cleanouts that will permit cleaning of the entire system.Cleanouts for Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of a water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only.
unique_id: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of a water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only.Check Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A building sewer intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than 4 inches in size, terminated above ground, provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, and a means to protect it from frost heave, and designed and constructed in accordance with good engineering practice.
unique_id: A building sewer intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than 4 inches in size, terminated above ground, provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, and a means to protect it from frost heave, and designed and constructed in accordance with good engineering practice.Mobile Home Sewer Service

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Brazing alloys shall conform to AWS ANSI/AWSA5.8M/A5.8:2011 Filler Metals for Brazing and Braze Welding BCuP range.
unique_id: Brazing alloys shall conform to AWS ANSI/AWSA5.8M/A5.8:2011 Filler Metals for Brazing and Braze Welding BCuP range.Solders and Fluxes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the term pipe or piping is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing unless otherwise stated.
unique_id: Where the term pipe or piping is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing unless otherwise stated.Pipe or Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11-17 Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.13.(1).)
unique_id: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11-17 Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.13.(1).)Polypropylene Pipe and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: PVC injection-moulded gasketed fittings shall conform to CSA B137.2-17 Polyvinylchloride  Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure Applications
unique_id: PVC injection-moulded gasketed fittings shall conform to CSA B137.2-17 Polyvinylchloride  Injection-Moulded Gasketed Fittings for Pressure ApplicationsPVC Pipe and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A section of horizontal branch is permitted to be circuit-vented, provided a circuit vent is connected to it, all fixtures served by the circuit vent are located in the same storey, and no soil-or-waste stack is connected to it upstream of a circuit-vented fixture.
unique_id: A section of horizontal branch is permitted to be circuit-vented, provided a circuit vent is connected to it, all fixtures served by the circuit vent are located in the same storey, and no soil-or-waste stack is connected to it upstream of a circuit-vented fixture.Circuit Venting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Compression fittings shall not be used underground under a building.
unique_id: Compression fittings shall not be used underground under a building.Copper Joints Used Underground

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A backwater valve is permitted to be installed in a building drain provided that it is a “normally open” design conforming to CSA B70-12 Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1-15 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2-15 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1-15 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings and it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.
unique_id: A backwater valve is permitted to be installed in a building drain provided that it is a “normally open” design conforming to CSA B70-12 Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1-15 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2-15 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1-15 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings and it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.Protection from Backflow

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
unique_id: Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. of Division A shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.Non-defined Terms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Tubular metal or plastic traps conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2-2015/CSAB125.2-15 Plumbing Waste Fittings shall be used only in accessible locations.
unique_id: Tubular metal or plastic traps conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2-2015/CSAB125.2-15 Plumbing Waste Fittings shall be used only in accessible locations.Tubular Traps

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tube shall be used.
unique_id: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tube shall be used.Stainless Steel Tube

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wiped joints in straight pipe shall be made of solder, have an exposed surface on each side of the joint at least 19 mm wide, and be not less than 10 mm thick at the thickest part.
unique_id: Wiped joints in straight pipe shall be made of solder, have an exposed surface on each side of the joint at least 19 mm wide, and be not less than 10 mm thick at the thickest part.Wiped Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Non-potable water piping shall not be located where food is prepared in a food-processing plant, above food-handling equipment, above a non-pressurized potable water tank, or above a cover of a pressurized potable water tank.
unique_id: Non-potable water piping shall not be located where food is prepared in a food-processing plant, above food-handling equipment, above a non-pressurized potable water tank, or above a cover of a pressurized potable water tank.Pipes

ARTICLE_TITLE: Connection of Overflows from Rainwater Tanks
FRAG_DOCUMENT: An overflow from a rainwater tank shall not be directly connected to a drainage system.
unique_id: An overflow from a rainwater tank shall not be directly connected to a drainage system.Connection of Overflows from Rainwater Tanks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Interceptors shall be designed so that they can be readily cleaned.
unique_id: Interceptors shall be designed so that they can be readily cleaned.Interceptors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.
unique_id: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.Threaded Cast-Iron Drainage Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A 53/A 53M-12 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless
unique_id: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A 53/A 53M-12 Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and SeamlessSteel Pipe

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain by (See Note A-2.4.5.5.(1).)) the use of a trap seal primer, using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or other equally effective means.
unique_id: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain by (See Note A-2.4.5.5.(1).)) the use of a trap seal primer, using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or other equally effective means.Trap Seals

FRAG_DOCUMENT: For fixtures listed in Table 2.6.3.2.A that are permitted to have a supply pipe 3/8 inch in size, a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture.
unique_id: For fixtures listed in Table 2.6.3.2.A that are permitted to have a supply pipe 3/8 inch in size, a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture.Size

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Mechanical couplings for non-pressure applications shall conform to CSA B602-16 Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe
unique_id: Mechanical couplings for non-pressure applications shall conform to CSA B602-16 Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer PipeMechanical Couplings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Every fixture shall have a smooth, hard, corrosion-resistant surface free of flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.
unique_id: Every fixture shall have a smooth, hard, corrosion-resistant surface free of flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.Surface Requirements

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Adaptors, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.
unique_id: Adaptors, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.Dissimilar Materials

ARTICLE_TITLE: Support for Vent Pipe above a Roof
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a vent pipe that may be subject to misalignment terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced. (See Article 2.5.6.5. for location of vent pipe terminals.)
unique_id: Where a vent pipe that may be subject to misalignment terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced. (See Article 2.5.6.5. for location of vent pipe terminals.)Support for Vent Pipe above a Roof

ARTICLE_TITLE: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of the NBC, multiplied by the sum of (See Note A-2.4.10.4.(1).)) the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of the NBC, multiplied by the sum of (See Note A-2.4.10.4.(1).)) the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Adjacent compartments within an oil interceptor shall be connected to each other by a vent opening.
unique_id: Adjacent compartments within an oil interceptor shall be connected to each other by a vent opening.Venting of Oil Interceptors

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where PEX, PP-R, PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX plastic pipe is installed, hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.
unique_id: Where PEX, PP-R, PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX plastic pipe is installed, hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.Support for Horizontal Piping

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1-15 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2-15 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
unique_id: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1-15 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2-15 Polyvinylchloride  and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride  Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe FittingsTransition Solvent Cement

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Wiped flanged joints shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is not less than 19 mm wide.
unique_id: Wiped flanged joints shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is not less than 19 mm wide.Wiped Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentence 2.5.4.2.(2), every soil-or-waste stack draining fixtures from more than 4 storeys that contain plumbing fixtures shall have a vent stack.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentence 2.5.4.2.(2), every soil-or-waste stack draining fixtures from more than 4 storeys that contain plumbing fixtures shall have a vent stack.Vent Stacks

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Floor-mounted and wall-mounted water-closet bowls shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.
unique_id: Floor-mounted and wall-mounted water-closet bowls shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.Capability of Support

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Direct flush valves shall open fully and close positively under service pressure, complete their cycle of operation automatically, be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that they discharge, and be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.
unique_id: Direct flush valves shall open fully and close positively under service pressure, complete their cycle of operation automatically, be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that they discharge, and be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.Direct Flush Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall (See Note A-2.2.3.1. and .)) be provided with a cleanout plug located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast-iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, or be designed so that part of the trap can be removed for cleaning purposes.
unique_id: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall (See Note A-2.2.3.1. and .)) be provided with a cleanout plug located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast-iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, or be designed so that part of the trap can be removed for cleaning purposes.Traps

ARTICLE_TITLE: Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.
unique_id: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil-or-waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil-or-waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than (See Note A-2.4.2.1.(4).)) 40 times the size of the soil-or-waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before changing direction, and 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe after changing direction.
unique_id: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil-or-waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil-or-waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than (See Note A-2.4.2.1.(4).)) 40 times the size of the soil-or-waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before changing direction, and 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe after changing direction.Connections to Sanitary Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.
unique_id: A non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.Not Permitted

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Flared joints shall not be used for hard  copper tube.
unique_id: Flared joints shall not be used for hard  copper tube.Flared Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4-14 Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings
unique_id: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4-14 Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and FittingsConcrete Pipe and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Not more than 6 shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.
unique_id: Not more than 6 shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.Showers

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In buildings of residential occupancy that contain more than one dwelling unit, a shut-off valve shall be installed where the water supply enters each dwelling unit, so that, when the water supply to one suite is shut off, the water supply to the remainder of the building is not interrupted. (See Note A-2.6.1.3.(5).)
unique_id: In buildings of residential occupancy that contain more than one dwelling unit, a shut-off valve shall be installed where the water supply enters each dwelling unit, so that, when the water supply to one suite is shut off, the water supply to the remainder of the building is not interrupted. (See Note A-2.6.1.3.(5).)Shut-off Valves

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure-reducing valve shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.
unique_id: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure-reducing valve shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.Static Pressure

FRAG_DOCUMENT: A water service pipe intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than ¾ inch in size, terminate above ground, and be provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, a means to protect it from frost heave, and a curb stop and a means of draining that part of the pipe located above the frost line when not in use.
unique_id: A water service pipe intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than ¾ inch in size, terminate above ground, and be provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, a means to protect it from frost heave, and a curb stop and a means of draining that part of the pipe located above the frost line when not in use.Mobile Home Water Service

ARTICLE_TITLE: Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
FRAG_DOCUMENT: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
unique_id: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.7.1. and Sentence 2.5.7.3.(1).
unique_id: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.7.1. and Sentence 2.5.7.3.(1).Circuit Venting

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.11. and 2.2.5.11.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.
unique_id: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.11. and 2.2.5.11.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.Polyethylene/Aluminum/Polyethylene Composite Pipe and Fittings

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Air pressure tests shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions for each piping material, and air shall be forced into the system until a pressure of 35 kPa is created, and this pressure shall be maintained for at least 15 min without a drop in pressure.
unique_id: Air pressure tests shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions for each piping material, and air shall be forced into the system until a pressure of 35 kPa is created, and this pressure shall be maintained for at least 15 min without a drop in pressure.Air Pressure Tests

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Backflow preventers required by Sentence 2.6.2.4. shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection. (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(3).)
unique_id: Backflow preventers required by Sentence 2.6.2.4. shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection. (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(3).)Backflow from Fire Protection Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Cold-caulked joints shall not be used except for bell and spigot pipe in a water system, a drainage system or a venting system.
unique_id: Cold-caulked joints shall not be used except for bell and spigot pipe in a water system, a drainage system or a venting system.Cold-Caulked Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: In making a screwed joint, the ends of the pipe shall be reamed or filed out to the size of the bore and all chips and cuttings shall be removed.
unique_id: In making a screwed joint, the ends of the pipe shall be reamed or filed out to the size of the bore and all chips and cuttings shall be removed.Screwed Joints

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision shall be made for the necessary future connections.
unique_id: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision shall be made for the necessary future connections.Provision for Future Installations

FRAG_DOCUMENT: No other fixture shall be connected to a lead bend or stub that serves a water closet.
unique_id: No other fixture shall be connected to a lead bend or stub that serves a water closet.Connections to Sanitary Drainage Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Systems for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-F383-08 Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems
unique_id: Systems for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-F383-08 Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water SystemsSolar Domestic Hot Water Systems

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51-09 Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast
unique_id: Cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51-09 Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally CastCast-Iron Water Pipes

FRAG_DOCUMENT: The hydraulic load that is drained to a leader shall conform to Table 2.4.10.11.
unique_id: The hydraulic load that is drained to a leader shall conform to Table 2.4.10.11.Hydraulic Loads on Leaders

FRAG_DOCUMENT: When a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use, it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
unique_id: When a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use, it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.Water Closets in Public Washrooms

FRAG_DOCUMENT: Except as provided in Article 2.6.2.4., backflow caused by back pressure of non-toxic substances into a potable water system shall be prevented by the installation of an air gap, a dual check valve backflow preventer with atmospheric port, a dual check valve backflow preventer, a dual check valve backflow preventer with vent, a double check valve assembly, or a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer.
unique_id: Except as provided in Article 2.6.2.4., backflow caused by back pressure of non-toxic substances into a potable water system shall be prevented by the installation of an air gap, a dual check valve backflow preventer with atmospheric port, a dual check valve backflow preventer, a dual check valve backflow preventer with vent, a double check valve assembly, or a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer.Backflow Caused by Back Pressure
